aqZwsI5vf2yesWCP90R6Rg.text: Great Mexican food... Good luck finding a place to park!

Es8P_vglVsAMTLqDkXC1hQ.text: Ick.  I must also have visited on a bad day.  Valle Luna serves up by far the worst Mexican food I have ever eaten.  And I've eaten Mexican food in Connecticut.  That's saying something.  I think the best part was the bean dip (I think it was beans) they serve with their chips.  There was nothing memorable after that.  The best and really only good thing about Valle Luna is its location.  It sits right on the Anderson Springs "waterfront" so if you can get the patio, go for it.

EMyXgt-b3n5g6RC2N5ZLug.text: I used to go here years ago and the food with happy hour was free and delicious! I went there today and my chimichanga was ready in just a few minutes. Fast service, nice staff. about 25 bucks for 2 people to eat. I like this place

BgoASTgru8RZk8LbBksI_w.text: Large restaurant with a view of the lake, plenty of indoor seating, outdoor seating, and a separate bar area.  Great salsa, good food, excellent Pollo Fundido.  The margaritas are decent as long as you don't get the house margarita (very cheap tequila).

YHLNiAqs5zWOWX9PWICk-g.text: We went there a few months ago with a restaurant.com gift certificate. Pretty good service, refilled water without asking. We really stuffed ourselves with food too. I think I got Fajitas, very good. Girlfriend doesn't remember what she got but she thought it was good as well.

bu4C7LOhN39KimFVOlhC0Q.text: The tortillas that they use for their chips and tacos are fantastic and some of the best I have ever had.  The rice is good with a perfect amount of cumin.  If you go when the weather is nice you can sit outside right by the lake, and if the kiddos are at home it makes for a romantic night out.  I have been here three times, and although it's not "wow gotta have" it's a safe bet that the food is consistently good.

CvZbICEbwhCBfD2NKQriVQ.text: The chips, salsa and bean dip are the good reasons to go here.... other than that not much to say.  Everything seems to be sooo greasy and mushy within seconds.  If you order something with a crispy taco, eat that first!  It will be a soggy mess soon.  I have to say that they have a nice patio or drinks which has been a better experience than the food and I wish it wasn't so because I live really close by.  I do have to say that the service is always 5 star.

jBOMdDTmnGIqavvUnuaGdw.text: The food is good (thumbs up for the taco salad) but the view is awesome. Sitting out on the patio & gazing out at the lake makes the meal that much better. The last time I was there we couldn't get lakeside seating because of a quinceanera. Because of the view, it's an excellent place for parties, meetings, etc. I believe they also have karaoke.

bJqrxLjxNUGi7ESuvzbzaQ.text: Good chips and salsa, food average. Service good. Extremely busy on fri and sat notes.

uFYoodjzojlmQxVXxKsONQ.text: Great location right off the lake with indoor/outdoor seating, family friendly (Weds are family night), great Mexican food (yes, its greasy)-with about 10 dinner combos which can please just about anyone, AND we get a buy one get one free through the mail almost weekly that it just makes sense to keep coming back for more! =) Plus their chips, salsa, and bean dip just about seal the deal for me! Yummy!

1H2xTEXbDweLRo1EUMrfYg.text: I love Valle Luna! I only give 4 stars because they don't blow me away good. We have so many mexican restarants in the valley to choose from  but what does impress me is that every time I have gone, the food is consistently good.Good chips and salsa which is very important. I love the margaritas there because they are never watered down tasting in fact, they tend to be a little heavy on the liquor which is a good thing but know that  before you plan to drive. I personally don't drink if I am so I always go there and make my husband drive ;-) It is a great place to meet people for food and drinks because they never rush you and it is very relaxed and friendly there. I for one will keep going

X-cchx2xZpIWODJyM7n3yQ.text: I am not a big Mexican food fan to begin with, so take this review with a grain of salt. My fiance, her family and a few friends decided to eat here when we saw that it was featured restaurant on Restaurant.com. Each couple printed out our coupons as we were all going to pay separately. Everything was going great, the service was fast and courteous and the food was good, but when it came to paying for our check we were told that they would only honor one coupon since we were all sitting at the same table, even though we alerted our waiter to the fact that we were all paying separately and he said that would be fine. After a few tense minutes with the manager, he reluctantly agreed to accept the coupons. Aside from that the experience was okay. The party I was with really likes Mexican food, so I'm sure they would rate it higher. I had the shrimp fajitas I would rate as a 6 compared to the best shrimp fajitas I have ever had.

74dVv0JlXt4fzYJ8plHeDw.text: Though the service was slow at the beginning, the place was crowded and had to wait 15 minutes.  Ordered the carna asada steak and my friend ordered the shredded beef chimi, both were really good.  The plates didn't look sloppy but appetizing.  The salsa and chips were also good, they add some herbs to their thick salsa which is pleasant.  Didn't order drinks but they seemed very reasonable.  Rita's for 5 bucks and they looked legit.  Look forward to going back.

AUArF1Q1SgkMJ756F4sonQ.text: Valle Luna bats .250.  Not high enough to put in the middle of the lineup (hell, probably not enough to even start), not low enough to send back down to AAA.  Completely average.  I'll admit, however, to frequenting the restaurant primarily for its bar which seemingly promotes about 17,696 drink specials and more on football sundays.  Other than that, there isn't really a whole lot to say one way or another.  Perhaps that says more than a lengthy review ever could...

BSbx0ZHzRbvTLXkQ7_WkSw.text: Valle Luna Chandler  My wife and I were kid free the other night and were deciding where to go and deducted down to Valle Luna because of the lakeside setting. We got there and parked in the lot and the very first thing you see in the front parking lot is an overflowing open gated nasty dumpster with boxes and rotton food spewing out. We nearly turned around and said S@REW THIS, but we didn't.  Inside we asked the host for patio seating which she said was booked; however, there was first-come-first-serve on the bar patio. Scored a ringside seat next to the lake! Yippie! I'm so gettin' some tonight with this setting. However, the ambiance was really marred by 2 things. First was the wafting of clouds of cigarette smoke lofting into our serene spot. Ewww, not to be a hypocrite as I smoked like 12 years ago..no check that cigarettes are gross. The other issue was the EXTREMELY INTOXICATED middle aged foul mouthed trashy cougar hooker seated behind us. Her and her skank girlfriend sat down about 1/2 hour after we did and she was friggin' hammered upon being seated. She later exclaimed to her friend about how she'd been drinking wine ALL DAY...yea really, you handle and hide it well. I totally shook my head as I watched the server dude take her order and thought, "Dude you're not really going to serve that sloshy puddle more booze are you?" and he did - and multiple times. Unbelievable! Where's the Liquor Board when they're needed.   The other issue about the facility is the stank in the bar area. It has the aroma of a high school boys locker room. They really need to address this as it's nasty...carpet looks like it hasn't been cleaned this millennium.   You can't go wrong drinking a Corona Light in this atmoshere and my wife had a Don Julio Blanca Marg Rocks that was good to. Later she prdered teh same but with a Chambord shot in it...awesome drink!  My wife loves that they serve a bean dip with the chips and I thought the salsa was very tasty and chunky. I hate it when the salsa is watery thin. Chips were good ny wife said as I don't eat them.   My wife had red cili enchiladas that were just ok...nothing special. I was pleased to see sea bass on the menu...yea! Ordered it but the server forgot to ask me which of the 2 sauces I wanted or about the sides. I flagged him down and told him the sauce and also said that I didn't want any rice. Food comes, there's the friggin' rice all over my plate. I'm not really picky but seriously I asked specifically for no rice and there it is and it's not like you can just push it aside as it crosses the international borders into the veggies, beans and fish sauce...forced to have a re-make. 8 minutes later and my wife is 1/2 done and here it comes back out. Looks good...taste is stone cold...what a shame as it was a good looking piece of fish.   Without that lake...we would never come back.

fN7uLRkchrLz9mcyTOd0Dg.text: Went for lunch the other day because I had a coupon and I love Mexican food, so I was excited to give it a try. I have to say, I was disappointed. I had the shredded beef chimichanga- it was so-so. I've definitely had a more flavorful chimichanga at a cheaper price elsewhere. I was also not impressed by the service. Our waiter never came to check on us, other than taking our order and bringing the food, which meant we had empty water glasses most of the time. Not cool. But on the plus side, they have a killer bean dip. I'd go back just to eat the chips and bean dip, but probably sit in the bar for (hopefully) better service.

tOlwOZfyNPG3BYxc_ma3KQ.text: my husband and my two small children decided to try out this Mexican Restaurant last night. We waiting for 25 minutes to get a table, which is understandable. We walked around the beautiful view of the lake while we were waiting which was really nice. Once we were seated, we decided to order some drinks and appetizers. We went for what we thought was "happy hour" to enjoy 1/2 price apps and reduced priced drinks, but we were told by the waitress you could not order from that menu at a table, only at the bar. As we were eating we noticed it was getting really warm. When we asked the waitress she said the air condition was broke. My husband asked why we weren't told by the hostess, because we may have decided to go elsewhere. She didn't have an answer and proceeded to get a manager. The manager was very rude and was trying to tell us that she thought the temp was fine. It was definitely not fine. We were sweating at the table. We weren't trying to get anything for free, we had already paid the bill. We were just looking for an explanation. We left very unsatisfied. We probably will go back because the food was ok, and the location is very close to our house. But if we had similar poor service after our next visit, we would definitely not go back a third time.

CTuG12QvSWBuBjMgJo6_Jw.text: Foods alright, but patio atmosphere is worth the trip.

YAJj4Ho0K0EswNiFlfaZRQ.text: Great food, Great service, Great patio on the lake. The cantina side is where we go, every time we're there. The TV's are kind of small, not placed very strategically, but it is a blast for NFL Sunday. Good drink specials, too. At night, on Thurs & Sat, they have a DJ.

F5wDPgxCVwXH2ClZDYwNHA.text: My friend and I went for lunch today, as it is close to both our offices. We had never been there, and for good reason after going. The place has an 80's decor, that's the good part. The oil they fry their chips in must be very old because every chip I ate tasted like I was just eating a chunk of lard, literally disgusting. The salsa & bean dip was the best part. I had a beef taco that completely fell apart, and the rice & beans were mush. My friend had the pollo fundido w/unmelted cheese. With in the hour after we left the place, we both got sick w/the runs ( think it was the lard tasting chips).  I came back to work, and my coworker said he went last week , his girlfriend got the pollo fundido burrito (same as my friend), and she literally got food poisoning, hurled7 times ! Wish I would have known before going there! It's expensive too, so not worth it. Not Recommended whatsoever! Some Burros is 100 times tastier & it's fast food!

LtMxToIZ9sRXfkK-PQO4JQ.text: We have been going to this restaurant for a lot of years. Always had great service and great food. Till tonite I got some bad pork on my tacos, told the server she said she would get new tacos... well all said and done. Had to send chips back -- detail, never got a refill on my tea.. when she finally gave me the check I was charged more for my dinner. She said she would send the mgr to our table never came... so bottom line he took2.00 of the bill-- no apology they just lost a good customer-- they just didn't seem to give a rats butt!!!!!!!!

rU_F-xqMlmWAwZNG4uYqbw.text: Bad service. Took long time to take order. Food doesn't taste good. I ordered veggie fajita and veggies were just steamed. No spice nothing. Not going to come again. Avoid.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Veggie Fajita

DQYfEgTAUe8TJUNuaH2U5g.text: We used to come here a lot, but haven't in several months (probably close to a year) and now I remember why!  Taco was over cooked to the point that it completely fell apart when I picked it up.  When I told the waitress she said that most people order them soft not crunchy because they are so brittle. The tostada was a soggy mess!  My mom ordered the burro de la casa and it was so greasy and the cheese had hardened so much by time it was delivered that it was almost completely inedible. The tea tasted like it had been sitting for 3 or 4 days. Overall a very bad food experience from a place we use to love.

zJGPD0_XKz4ZNr-Yeg_aHQ.text: Happy hour is well worth it.   The service was good , my waiter kinda got lost in the crowd ( maybe he can crowd surf).

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mini taco basket.  They don&#39;t look that mini to me

93pavhteCEeyVEztUL3JeQ.text: Absolutely rude and horrible service. They are the worst experience I have ever had. The manager John is awful and unprofessional with a know it all attitude! First and last time I'll ever go there. I am a total foodie and quite frankly with all my travels all over the world this has been the worst experience I have ever had. They deserve like -0 star.

WbMROOU_9KGLJOu_DV-Amg.text: Where to start? I came in on a Saturday to a semi busy atmosphere. There were 2 hostesses at the front, one very friendly and the other indifferent to be there - which is ok, sometimes you have off days. Opted to sit outside where the view of the pond was nice along with the weather. Our server may have been new as he misheard or misremembered part of the order and then charged the wrong amounts for our checks. The most disappointing parts of the visit had to do with the high prices and charges for every little thing. My friend ordered street tacos that did not include any type of sauce unless an additional $1.25 was paid. Just not what was expected..

DvBMjn6uGJw-6qP00VroBQ.text: We used to live down the street from the N. Phoenix restaurant and were regulars at the cantina. This place has an even better cantina and their outdoor section overlooks a man-made lake! Their food is pretty good, though we mainly just eat cheese crisps and grilled chicken wings. And their happy hour is awesome, having great specials and cheap beer.  We'll definitely be headed back to catch a game or just chill on the patio.

N71Ux8IfcXDdX_68VvL8iw.text: Well...I gave them another try against my better judgement. Since they were close and it was about 8 pm when a friend dropped by and said she was hungry and had noticed the restaurant was close by. We walked into the place and were ignored by 3 giggling gals standing at a register. Finally a guy comes out of the kitchen...chewing on something..I asked for a seat on the "no smoking" side of the outdoor patio. At that time he took off like a rabbit to the patio area...tried to sit us at a table that had not been cleaned..which we refused and found a clean one and sat down. The drink order was taken...but no chips or salsa arrived until after the drinks....There was no silverware or napkins brought until AFTER we requested it. Awww yes, finally the "food" arrived...a burnt to the bottom of the pan cheese crisp....and a taco....Never an offer of drink refills at all. SAD SAD SERVICE AND FOOD TOO....The last time I ate there I got the meal FREE because the meat was sour in the enchilada ..and the taco had what looked like baby food in the bottom. This place has some serious management issues...or at least I think that's the problem. It use to be a decent place to eat...and the location is TERRIFIC!

px8qKyz2twJ_AZ5YU_ZeLg.text: The food here is always spectacular but last night my family and I went for dinner and the corner we sat in had this awful stench I felt like we were in the dungeon and our server his  name was Esteban he didn't care at all didnt care if we had refills forgot about us pretty much the whole time usually when you sit in the bar or outside service is good

xOyJNp4Q19cQM-T8psqOOw.text: Well, we had a good run old friend.  The food has always outweighed the service in this place.  Unfortunately tonight we never even got a chance to eat.  By the time we had sat, made paper airplanes for the kids out of your placemats, ate an entire bowl of chips and salsa, seen nearly a dozen employees stroll past our table, alas, we were never served.  We finally flagged a begrudging server down to find us someone who was willing to take the table and she made no verbal confirmation of our request but walked back to the kitchen to find someone and passed the hostess.  Words were exchanged and when the hostess turned and looked in our direction she began to laugh.  Now maybe, just maybe this was an honest joke like, "do I have to do everything around here" kind of banter.  But to us, after a hellish day, and we still haven't fed the kids and it's 7pm on a Monday; it was the straw that broke my wife's back.  She packed up our shit faster than I've seen anyone move and as we got up to head out, a server arrived to wish us a good evening.  Valle Luna is a staple in our rotation but this really was disappointing.  We will take a break for a bit and regroup.  I suggest they do the same.  If you can get service, the food here is great!

b_Si08udiQW0SX7hFHdCtw.text: Friends and I were in search of a location...the first two to were duds. One wasn't open and the other was at a hotel bar. My girlfriend suggested this place and I couldn't be happier.  Great atmosphere, wonderful food for a good price. Staff was so friendly and tolerated me during my day drinking session!   Great job!

JCa1fpgTy32RmmhKxTey7Q.text: Craving Mexican food... stopping by is a must. Service was outstanding, refilled drinks without noticing...lol. Not to mention Happy Hour Specials were great! No skimping customers on food(fish tacos=$3) and margaritas are . Enjoy!!

q9tAjRLIkxaAqV5E8OyYCg.text: Valle Luna serves my brother's favorite soup - the one with meat balls - every day of the week. The chips and salsa served with your meal are good.

qvrq-363yPztaPVzB8qpkA.text: Service was not good. The waiter (Ariel) asked me for my ID (which I'm always flattered to hear) and as I go to my purse to get it he says "I'm not kidding". That was a bit uncomfortable considering I didn't think he was joking. I ordered shrimp tacos with flour tortillas because I do not like corn and I still got corn. He could not remember our drink order and came over 3 times instead of just writing it down. The drinks were strong but not good. The food was not worth the price. I would much rather go to Abuelo's where we are never disappointed. I would not recommend this place. My family and I will not be returning.

SMeqS1HP2tQRRJNbtezPmQ.text: 2 things that do not go well together: 1) mexican food 2) high prices. With hundreds of Mexican restaurants to choose from, we were lured in with a coupon and Wednesday "family" night.  Sure kid gets 4 corn dogs the size of your thumb for $1.50 and the wife and I split a $13 chimichanga + $2 upcharge for splitting (we were stuffed from the bottomless chip and salsa bowl)  now i gotta throw down a few prunes just to keep the pipes clean (and smooth, if you get my drift)  fool me once.....  on a side note, the whole Anderson Springs shopping center is packed to the gills on a wednesday night.  amazing

OY9O2nFfMsYLOiQiaBHy_Q.text: Best food, drinks and service. My wife and I love this place. Thanks

GxA7l2D38MPTJyU4M-lPGg.text: still the best place to eat Mexican food. kids can play by the lake and the happy hour deals are perfect for our budget.

Wabj8ZtdLDyva_CQmcjyew.text: Very nice place. Staff was very friendly and efficient. Food was great. Will be back in the fall to enjoy the patio.

j4YfqsHmOHrdktpKrZWl0Q.text: Went there for dinner last night. Men's rest room had lots of standing water (?). LOTS. No the first or second time this has happened.

gpDi1sfJCgEo4Y6DwSgA8w.text: When we walked in here it really felt like a chain Mexican restaurant like 3 Margaritas or On The Border.  They start off by giving you a big bowl of chips and everyone gets their own little bowls of salsa and refried bean dips. I really enjoyed the dips and think I ate every drop of it.  I got the shredded beef chimichanga and I don't remember it wowing me. It tasted fine, but nothing really stood out for me.  The service was another thing that was kinda "meh". It felt like we sat there for a really long time before anyone came by to take our drink order and they didn't come by a ton asking if we wanted refills on our margaritas (which were the one thing that was excellent).

SDOTNjmjG-Q26oK55WsuzQ.text: All I can say is that the reviews connected with this restaurant have to have been written by friends of the owner. If I could have given this place no stars, I certainly would have. Never had I had a more terrible dining out experience than at Valle Luna. I just arrived in Arizona from NY and took my family to dinner there. Six of us sat down to dine and we went to order. Last year I had the best chili relleno dinner here, so I asked for it again. Sorry ma'am, you have to have a taco instead of the two chilis! Why said I, I don't like tacos, can't you just charge me for a second chili. No substitutions! Just take off the taco and put on a chili, don't you want your customers happy? My granddaughter heard him mumble, for a price and for a price it was! Instead of charging me for one chili, they charged me for double chilis, beans and rice...18 bucks for two soggy cheese chilis! Where last year they were crisp and hot and delicious, this year they were two drowned out soggy cold messes lying mixed in with the beans and rice, drowned in tasteless watery sauce. I asked for the manager and Carlos, the manager came to tell me...tough! We have rules. We don't change things! I said don't you care about customer satisfaction? He said, we have rules! I said I guess you don't care about your customers and he shrugged. That says it all! Tasteless soggy food, nasty manager, greasy plates at the table, uncaring waiter..including the one who elbowed me as I left the restaurant. All this for 118 + dollars. Enter at your own risk! I'm sure there has to be better Mexican restaurants in the Chandler area, or at least ones that actually care about their customers.

mbioupEQW7t_OMrW7IIpMg.text: Who doesn't love the buy one get one free entree's coupons for Luna?! we love the Fajita's and the Fundido. and it's even better when we get one meal for free!!! awesome place, great service. yummy chips and dips for free. it just gets better and better when we come. love it

SyU32lXVqCz7nVrmAdtU9w.text: Always great service. The food is also good and well prepared.  Prices are very reasonable too. I have been here many times with my wife. Chicken or beef enchiladas and flan for desert.

cknHIkp8stSFNG3xGToCSg.text: They have corona light, dos equis amber and negra modelo on draught.  The chips and bean dip are really good.  They have really good enchiladas.

QVCf3wcQ7nZu7_74zT6lgw.text: I always have a good experience at Valle Luna. Went there for lunch today and had a great time. The service was good. Our server was friendly and attentive, very on top of things. I have not been disappointed in the food either. I usually try something different every time while the wife always sticks her combination plate.

0nM1z0jeN_zLZmLOL26JZg.text: Drinking water cause they got the pepsi.  Food came out uncooked,  slow service. Server tried to tell me thats how it is.  really you serve mexican food with cheese that isn't melted?  No visit from a manager or anything. this is a place in need of a visit from restaurant impossible.  I won't be going back.

Ae51nW4JqAaOFQ0SYnV9KA.text: We've been here six or seven times and you never know what you're gonna get. The service will range from terrible to average (one exception) and there's always confusion at the front door. The food varies too... I've had great and I've had gross. This is the ONLY restaurant I've been to where I would be concerned to send food back. It just has a sketchy vibe.  The last time we went our server was Liz, and she was AWESOME! I don't know if we'll every have her again but she made my day. Same visit we both ordered seafood enchiladas, and for a $14 lunch portion you expect more than six 61/70 shrimp. Eh, we'll be back, 'cause my wife likes it. lol

OsFfZeAp2iJSMia0Q7UbDg.text: Food was awesome, but service was terrible. Asked for extra salsa, never got it for dinner. We were never checked in on after we received food. Also waitress took our receipt right out off our table before the ink dried and had to lean in over our to go boxes to get it. Very rude.

pHAH1YpiqY9C3NzINQ7Ung.text: Shitty service from the shitty bartender Tomas.. so I  told the manager we will never be back.

KGoIVyiRKTPMkmYHo86EYg.text: I recently held a banquet here for my mother's 50th birthday. It was recommended that I use Valle Luna because they are easy to work with. I made a couple visits to the restaurant before booking the banquet. What had me sold was their beautiful view from their back patio. I was able to set up the menu for the banquet. They answered all of my questions. What really had me sold was on the day of the banquet I had an excellent server called Ricky. I can tell Ricky is a pro. He made sure to ask me all the questions he needed to help me make the party run smoother. There was a very small mix up with a menu item we ordered and he resolved it very quickly. Ricky really made the party. I was able to focus on the guest of honor and other party guests. The service was good and the food was excellent. Everything tasted good and there was enough food for everyone. They were even able to accommodation a last minute desert order. I will consider using Valle Luna again for a banquet!

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. View of the back patio
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

AnnBzr7VDQPsASJ0HwR4WQ.text: Had a lunch date with my mom there it was great. It was a first time going and we are definitely going back. The lake view was great. The service was efficient and there wasn't to long of a wait. We loved the food and being from Sonora and them claiming that they have sonoran-style we definitely agreed. They're Chimichangas were delicious.

p2V2idcOdrgWvKrG3i5THA.text: I started with the complimentary salsa, re-fried beans, and chips followed by my margarita and chicken taco basket everything was really good def one of my favorite mexican restaurants :) !

x9iQ8dHDX6EbgRFRG3HawA.text: Valle Luna is one of the best Mexican restaurants in the valley! The atmosphere is great and all the employees there are very friendly! I recently discovered jalapeno cream cheese sauce over my shredded beef burrito! Amazing! If you're new to Arizona and you want some good Mexican food go to Valle Luna!

etVCqF6FP0dWGHB-CqYSAQ.text: If you haven't been to happy hour you haven't seen the amazing taco basket!  My wife and I love to grab a taco basket, wings and sit outside on a nice day.  Every once in  awhile the rush is so big that the service slows down, but on a nice day- who's in a rush?  While the salsa they give you is tasty - the hot salsa could be hotter.  The price is right during happy hour - the food is good - and the service is on point.

RbOx090gVjmLMFUHYcNIYA.text: Best happy hour in town, the $5.50 taco basket is delicious! The back patio is a great spot to meet friends and grab a drink.

MgPyOoumwAyXw36y40zP0Q.text: I've been going to Valle Luna ever since I can remember!! They have awesome salsa but not awesome chips. The bean dip is a hit or miss, it depends on who makes it that day. The pollo fundido is my favorite... even though it cost like $15 and an extra $3 for a side of the jalapeno cream cheese. I also recommend the pollo sandwich and the grilled honey-hot wings! Now about the service... it's terrible!!! A lot of the servers have worked at Valle Luna for many years and treat NO ONE with respect. They treat customers like they are an inconvenience then wonder why they don't get good tips lol.

cA7zJcfWVFvxtjAGJTBv1g.text: Horrible service. I filled up a survey with my contact information. I was never contacted by management. My waitress Krysten was horrible. She was always on a rush, never brought to the table what i asked for, and presented the wrong check to me. Never going back here.

tGhaSubCvEvrrUpMvA7_eg.text: As a third decade restaurant business owner I would like to go on record as believing that web sites that permit ad lib, subjective, and frequently inflammatory reviews have no credibility.

B-gFgDq3-tcrhUM4X53nhQ.text: I'd like to give it no stars. The food is all right super greasy but Okay for a few chips and Margaritas. Oh and  the only place worth sitting is the bar. The front hostesses are total C U Next Tuesdays. We walk in late on a Sunday night after painting and we are tired. Bar is full so we go to leave. The hubs says let's get a table. We ask for a table, not one of their super uncomfortable booths. The hostess tells us there's not a table available except on the patio. It's 45 degrees out. While the staff is sitting waiting for patrons at tables. When I say can't we sit there she just stares at us.  Never going back.

wi6wSAN4J0SBbDuwULIDhw.text: We had come on a Sunday night and for some bizarre reason a birthday was being held in the bar area.  So with that being said it was impossible to get around to go to the bathroom directly unless you went the long way and then when it came to our food and drinks the older lady that was our server took forever to come over to bring us our food and drinks regardless if it was a soda or water.  Whenever i go to restaurants and am thirsty the servers wont be there to ask if you would like a refill or not. but the days i am not thirsty they are there non stop which is great.  Bad luck maybe.  The chicken tacos were disgusting. The fish tacos apparently were okay. So next time i suppose I should try that instead of the chicken tacos.

o77R_Vo39eWF0YqqnU2xZw.text: Terrible service from Esteban, no pre-bussing, no refill on pop, we sat for over 5 minutes before we were acknowledged, and he walked by the table 3 times.  Chicken wings were overcooked and extremely dry. We split a taco basket 1/2 chic, 1/2 beef, very bland, no seasoning to the meat at all. The veggies for the wings were old and dry and obviously old by the fridge burn on them.  It's a great patuo, and the cocktails were good, too bad the food and service were awful.  Lastly it states it's non-smoking outside, there were several ashtrays next to us, full of butts, definitely un-appetizing.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

CcmgV5eh8dW1Zucg8D0vjA.text: The Sonoran enchilada and shredded beef chimichanga covered in red enchilada sauce are exceptional. The ground beef chimichanga enchilada style is also very good. My girl let me try her Mexican Pizza and that was delicious, too. The Sonoran Enchilada is one of my favorites besides the chimichangas. The complimentary chips and salsa are also better than most Mexican joints.

X2LOp6covQbX3EUFWKPhsg.text: I have eaten at Valle Luna a number of times over the years.  In the past the food and service has been top notch.  Unfortunately that has changed in recent visits.  While the waitstaff has been consistently great, the quality of food has drastically diminished.  On my most recent visit, both the drink order and meal were wrong.  Additionally, the food was cold and unappetizing, and the corn tortillas were stale.  The only reason I gave two stars instead of just one was due to our server.  She was efficient, welcoming, and a delight to work with.

2to7WwyrC-BSoavc_7Kssg.text: Loved this place! Gorgeous outside patio overlooking the water. Good service and good food! We will be back!

Jt4vKzcmRZO0SmjZdxy0cw.text: Omg!!!! Can I just tell you what a fabulous server Dan is!!! I guess the air conditioning isn't working in the bar and he tried his hardest to make a group of Peri-menopausal women happy!!!!! He was so attentive and accommodating!!! The food is as always great. Dan just made it extra special!!!

-3Zqv-sf1KlOSTJsSDyLJA.text: The food here is amazing! My husband and I enjoyed dinner here the other day and we were greeted by our waitress Heather. She was more than helpful in recommending dishes to us. I ordered the shrimp fundido per her recommendation and it did not disappoint! Heather was genuinely kind and continuously checked on us to assure we were satisfied. She built such a professional and honest rapport, it made us feel like we were dining with comfort and treated like family. That alone will assure that we are making this restaurant a go to for our family for sure! I grew up in California where my family and I would always go to a specific restaurant and my family became a part of their family. I'd play with their kids and they would always welcome us with open arms, and treat us with love and kindness. I even learned how to make tortillas once. This is so important to me as I have kids of my own and want them to experience that same kind of relationship, where even though we are going out to eat, it can still feel like home and we can still dine comfortably. Thank you heather for assuring that these kinds of restaurants still exist, and for helping my husband and I find our new go to restaurant, and thank you Valle Luna for providing such excellent and flavourful dishes!

vXw_KJA8FE51B2gc5ft7-w.text: My daughter and I got there at 8:15 on Friday. We were seated close to the doors to the patio. Restaurant is 60% empty, so I figured we would have great service. Young man came over and gave us the chips and salsa. Then a girl comes over with a high ponytail, says I'm leaving for the night, Gabe will take care of you. She took our drink orders, brought us our drinks moved on to service her tables. About 15 mins later Gabe showed up. I ordered the #2, enchilada/taco rice and beans. I asked if the macacha was really hot. He said, "It has habaneros in it." With sarcasm... I said I wanted green chili chicken enchilada and green chili taco. Oh you can't have green chili on a taco. I said ok, green chili chicken on the enchilada and shredded chicken taco. He repeated me. The busser brought our meals out, gave my plate to my daughter and vice versa (she also ordered a 2 but different meat). We traded and I started digging into the enchilada. It was not chicken, but some pork or beef. I could not eat it. Gabe never came by and I said this is not chicken. Our green chili is pork. I said I asked for chicken. He said, you said green chili. No offer to make it right. No apology for the misunderstanding. I could not eat it. The meat looked gray.  15 mins later, he came by with new drinks and our check. Didn't ask if we wanted dessert. If we wanted anything more. For that, he got 3 bucks on a $35 bill. I will NEVER be back! I loved this place when it was in Ahwatukee. No more! I'll go to Si Senor first!

bK6HnqkKbrYhD7THOCQAZA.text: This place used to be our favorite. But on Tuesday we went there and the service was awful. They got two parts of our order wrong and didn't offer any resolutions. The following day we were all sick. Suffice to say we won't be going there again.

r19NtkDteVSBr3akhI32Cw.text: Thomas was our server today and he was the absolute best!! Very friendly with a great attitude. He recommended items to us and they were delicious. Food came out quick. Definitely come back and will be asking for Thomas. He was the best server we've ever had at any restaurant!

4T-D-2ijdmkMxBu56RtuBg.text: Great place for Mexican food. We visit on Tuesday nights for senior night. This is a terrific value with 2 for 1 meals. Sometimes it's good to be a little maturer. The chummy is my favorite. It is not over cooked and is large enough for 2 meals. All the food is very well prepared and the service, even with a larger crowd is great. I have eaten here for many years,  even before I was eligible for the special. This place has always been a great stop.  If you are one of the fortunate to be able to partake in senior night remember that your tips should reflect paying for 2 meals. Let's not short change the wait staff.

wb4w6dq9LlGLuye-OGNM_Q.text: I wish I was able to give this restaurant less than one star. I attended a good friend of our family's reception dinner here and I was impressed with the catering service but the actual personal service was severely lacking. I ended up making a tab inside at the bar to get quicker service.  At the end of the night I went to grab one last beer when I heard the manager who had been so helpful earlier whispers to the bartender "she's been here for hours" hands me change for a ten (for a $4.30 beer)$4.30....he thought I was too drunk to realize that he ripped me off. Be careful if you go here they are ripping "drunk" people off.

FoH7QdWeJfteLrY4qOrkvg.text: If I could give it 0 stars I would. I have no idea what's been happening over there but it's quickly gone down hill. We've been happy patrons for years until recently. You never have the same server twice, no less than 3 servers knocked stuff off of our table and NEVER looked back. My partner got sick, called the restaurant to tell them. We were told too bad. That's it.. Too bad, go to the ER if you think you're sick. LOST US!!

UGTjx9q9efNSuxdIPMwgIA.text: We we're there tonight for happy hour Sunday, and the server was overworked and didn't have time for her customers.  The food was not good, and had to send back Mexican pizza from old oil.  They were out of Sopapillas, so replaced with fried ice cream that had very little ice cream.  We love the location on 35th Avenue, but will not waste our money at this location.

8mLWG99MItvwwUY0jTKr7w.text: The wait was awful!  When we finally got seated (in no mans land) we got a drink and chips and waited again!! The staffing was poor. The wait staff could not keep up. Really disappointed.

2_frlw7KJLRykoNy8WWhcw.text: I recommend skipping this place if you were expecting Kilt Lifter. They switched it out with 4 peaks peach ale?!?! WTF Valley Luna? Peach ale? Really? Their food is good but they only have 3 dark beers and 10 light beers. Like they needed more light beers. :'(

kdMp1dtTWwEDxQO5Qm9iCQ.text: If a Mexican restaurant doesn't have good salsa its a sign the food isn't either & sure enough that was True here. We took a chance & will not be back. The service was very good, the food not so much. Dont waste your money here.  If I could give zero stars I would have.  Not one of Chandlers best. The food was very bland, not what mexican food is supposed to be. Chips were not warm & tasted like they came out of a bag.

7RcKA2BUF_DO41Z2IZz-bw.text: This is my parents' go-to place to enjoy a sangarita and beer on weekends. I went this past weekend and we just ordered appetizers. Food is okay and the service can be a hit or a miss. I will say that this past weekend the waitress did take care of us. But I've gone other times where service wasn't the best.  Their spicy salsa is actually pretty good considering I'm used to eating pretty authentic spicy salsa. I enjoy their cheese crisp and nachos here. Not a bad place to go to!

E1QWzxhDO0p4cqdRquOEhQ.text: Excellent authentic Mexican food that is moderately priced.  Service is surprisingly quick considering how busy they always are and how large they are.  A little trick from a regular: If you don't have time to wait for a table in the main part of the restaurant, grab a table in the bar.  You can enjoy the full menu there.  My only negative, like all large, busy, popular places, it can be a little noisy on the weekends.  Simple solution: Ask for a table on the patio overlooking the lake if it isn't too hot or cold and you don't mind waiting a little longer.  No reservations for parties less than 10, but you can put your name on Yelp's Wait List shortly before you arrive and get seated fairly quickly.  Try it, you'll love it!

D8efriIH18nhbO5aCYEogA.text: This place was super busy, but worth the wait. Be prepared to wait.  But the food was amazing and the service was great. We will definitely be back! Maybe just not on a Friday night around 6.

I7eQwfiU1InDAoXlCoFxkA.text: Love the size and openness of the atmosphere. Food is good and drinks are amazing here. Service is very pleasurable . Great for families or out with the ladies.

aDP_RJNvcdvqth3q9yYHng.text: Horrible customer service. Took my father there for his birthday.  When the food arrived, he was the only one that didn't get his food. It took 15 minutes to flag the waiter and when we asked about his order the server lied and said it would be 3 more minutes. After another 15 minutes we asked again and were now told that his order "somehow ended up on another ticket and it would be another 20 minutes".   The rest of the table was now finished with their food.  When my husband asked to speak with the manager, the manager defended the server and told us if we didn't sit down and be quiet he would call the police! Needless to say my poor father's birthday was ruined.

t5snYgN7ALIdE1dwuGMjfg.text: First, I feel bad about this.  I love Valle Luna and have been a regular customer for years now.  Good food, great ambience, and generally good service.  Not tonight.  We settled in the lounge to take advantage happy hour drinks with a plan for a nice long evening ending in a full dinner and desert.  It was a hot day in Phoenix, and even hotter inside the lounge.  In the end I was literally about to pass out and had to leave mid meal to go to the car to cool down. We mentioned the heat to the waitress who, much like her services (I won't go into that, but not good), dismissed us saying it was hot for her too.  Frankly it was inexcusable to have the establishment even opened,  and a waste of patron money ordering food that they are unable to eat.  I would have preferred they had closed the doors until they could get their air fixed.

PJeA_zCxWVageEGKpomAFw.text: Have eaten here many times with my family.  Good food at reasonable prices.  Usually packed on the weekends.  Service is just ok. Parking is difficult on the weekends but we will return :-)

Pcq6Xq3O6GOe3RgesBamOg.text: My boyfriend and I come here all the time! Sometimes when the bar is too full we sit in the regular dining, and let me tell you, I definitely don't recommend it. If you want good service, SIT IN THE BAR! The bar servers know what they're doing. To name just a few: Julie, Alexis and Brittany. Everyone we've had is AMAZING. My favorite drink is the coronarita and we both love the chicken tacos. If you want a good time and over the top service, sit in the bar. You'll have a great time. If you sit in the regular dining area, don't expect great service. 5 stars goes to all the servers in the bar and the bartender.

XXwA-C7fyvBBpxSyUu7pMg.text: I have been to Valle Luna many times, but today was exceptional! We phoned in a take out order to Brandon, and he got everything right! He was very polite on the phone, read back our order, then offered to meet me at the curb, because parking can be a bear. When I arrived at the restaurant, Brandon was there to greet me, he processed my payment and got the order from the kitchen. He then offered to walk it out to my car. I appreciate good service when I receive it, thank you Brandon!

qVaC6HnRfNEDu5tYY6iEnA.text: The fish tacos and pollo Fundito were awesome.  The view  from our seat looking over the lake was great. The fried ice cream was awesome.

x5h6RYORBWatl9SnN4wdvw.text: This place is one of our favorite. We are usually there once if not twice per week. But the last 4 times, their service has been horrible. Today we were there for 3 hrs. It took the server forever to come and take our order. We had to call him to get a drink and to get refill on our salsa and chips. We could have had another drink, but the server never came after he dropped our food at the table. We had to get the managers attention to explain what was going on, and all she did, was bring our check. We pay our bill and left. Food is AMAZING, service could use ALOT of improvement. P.S. if your memory is not that great while taking our order, use a notebook to take our order down and actually bring out what we order. Definitely going back for the food and drink. Just hopefully we don't get the same server. And hopefully this review, helps the manager of the place as a feedback of what needs to change if they want to capture customers. Because if we choose to spend our money there, we deserve some attention. We could easily go down the street and give our money to another restaurant.

47tNgcbBO6zzixSLSgXxVw.text: UGH. One, they don't honor groupons or restaurant.com certificates on any happy hour items. Two, the food is definitely not the best Mexican in the area. There are far better places within a block or two. It's overpriced and definitely not easy on the stomach. We had margaritas, beer, the chicken nachos, and some 1/2 taco baskets. Today, all three of us have some serious stomach issues. The nachos were large (and for $15 they should be) but they had cheese, onions, refried beans, jalapenos, chicken, and sour cream. We had to ask a number of times to get our salsa refilled (there was never enough, and only one brought each time). The tacos didn't taste like much, just deep-fried shells without much flavor. The ONLY thing I liked was that refried beans are served with the salsa and chips. Go anywhere else.

6ipKRs2R6aUFX0cxoH-jWg.text: Went on a Saturday for HH.  Decent prices...decent food. The cantina was very crowded.  We enjoyed it.  Would definitely go back for Happy Hour.

6fbX6jYuIOaK_qYqf3d4eA.text: Red chille Carne is the best. Every Wednesday they have special priced menu where meals are 7.95 and kids eat for 1.50. Such a great deal and it is very filling. The food is always fresh and hot when they sever you. Bean dip and salsa with chips when u first arrive, um I'm good. Definitely recommend this place for any occasion.

v1OzkNJQv6AjgPRQQ_DTVw.text: I love their salsa I love their pollo fundido And this is my favorite Valle Luna location of them all... thanks to the lake :)  Love it!

PdiP5DlLbnq3UfK9_e3kag.text: I had heard about this restaurant from some neighbors and certainly have passed by it many times. Finally I decided to stop by for lunch during the weekend. I arrived after the lunch rush and the place was nice and tidy. The decor, tables and booths are very outdated and the dim lighting doesn't help. I was seated in a booth by the window overlooking the outside patio and pond, nice view.   I ordered the chicken fundido with refried beans and rice. The chicken was grilled, nice taste, but the tortilla was over cooked. The beans and rice were what you would expect. The chips and salsa were pretty good but I've had better.   After my meal I wondered about and found the bar area, seemed nice but a little tight seating and yes they had lighting a plenty.   Overall, not a bad experience but not so memorable either. They really need a makeover in their decor, very outdated and just reeked of old! At best 2  1/2 stars.

SaxkezlmCAxb9oF8p3rrLQ.text: I love this place! I brought my boyfriend here about a week or two ago because I crave it all the time. I usually get a chimichanga every time. The frozen strawberry margarita was sugary and amazing! The service is great and everyone is very friendly. The food is amazing! We will definitely be coming back :)

8BxEcNgbXPYBPCNpMcAhsw.text: My favorite place for Mexican food. Relaxed by the lake I have never been dissatisfied

dGuyqqCG3T7zugyZchC0XQ.text: I had the pollo fundido here, it was pretty good.  I think you would like this place if you are someone who's not afraid of cheese and a little grease to go with that.  Its Sonoran style so U should know that there is gonna be a bit of cheese thrown in.  As for the grease, it comes from all the frying : )    They have pretty decent salsa and chips, but I guess the bean dip does not come standard any more because I did not see them serve that with the chips.  Maybe you got to ask for it.  Food alone should give this place 4-5 stars but the service was a little underpar.  Its not that bad, but certainly was just sufficient without any attempts to improve.  The host was in the midst of seating me but stopped to address an issue with the kitchen on a phone order.  I guess its not a big deal as the bus boys were really fast and would bring u, the salsa and chips and greet u warmly.    As for my server, well I guess she would be a 7/10 service-wise.  Passable but not exceeding anything.  She was in a hurry to put her order in and I noticed her doing the same thing to other customers too.  When the table next to me asked what kind of meat was in their chilli rellenos, she just replied, there is no meat in the chilli rellenos, without any explanation of what it was and if there is an alternative.  The customer got convinced into ordering a pollo fundido which according to the waitress was the same as a chilli rellenos but with a chicken (not really !).    In her defense, she was not rude or uncaring, just very order-oriented and focused on fulfilling them.  She would go around and ask if everything was okay with her charges and did ask if I needed a refill on my ice teas.  I guess its better than a server who would not come around at all, that would be worse.  So perhaps you would want to view the menu online first, using the link on this page and then read about what they were, so you can ask "educated" questions about the foods or know right up front what you want, so they can bring you something nice and hot to eat real fast :)  I would come back again if I am craving a nice cheesy (in a good way) meal.  Also the view is pretty good, its overlooking a little lake that it shares a view with Coffee Rush.

RP7349fi_6yMw38K9ShlZg.text: I love this place! Sits right on the lake offering a beautiful view of the fountain. The restaurant is appealing with the authentic mexican look. The food is good. The service is good. Avoid Friday and Saturday if you are looking for quiet dining

dEyLKqMcJSrol_CY8_Nl1A.text: Ok. The food was fine.  However the wait staff sucks! The guy we got stuck with had a serious problem with what he seemed to want as a language barrier.  And had attitude when we had to ask him to slow down and repeat what he said. When I asked for another beverage he walked away. So I went to the dar to self service, and...wow! Actually got good service. I hate to give a bad review, but the table staff completely sucked.

R1EK9AWKtd8Vnsw5OowcdQ.text: Excellent customer service and excellent food! Our server was great even though the hostesses seemed a little behind. It was senior night (50+) and the special is either buy one get one free or, since there was only 1 senior at our table, 50% off his entree. I had the Fundito which was very rich and pretty salty, but was still delicious! I also loved the interior set up of the restaurant, and can't complain about the view of the lake right outside! The only thing I disliked about Valle Luna was the salsa.

e0ODE0HYFkOImY_KC_wUMw.text: Visited today after the hubby went with his co workers for lunch. I have to say, I'm impressed. Service was great, the food was excellent, happy hour specials are every day and even my son finished his food. When we were leaving, we saw one of my husband's co worker's who is particularly picky when it comes to Mexican food...so he def must've approved because he came back with his wife!  We'll def be back again.

JHT3CI3MvZNEPh_0nEv1Qw.text: Valle Lune is awesome. The Mexican pizza, tacos and potatoes skins were awesome. Go for Happy Hour! Mango margarita was strong -loved it!

qP8qkPM6DskQ--KGSZfLlg.text: The Mexican Pizza with chicken was delicious! Nice view of lake and a good vibe for some playoff football.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mexican Pizza!!
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

81s_VkVXNIWZkj1VaZIeSA.text: Great ambiance. Been taking the family for a decade but needs allergy friendly menu items. It's funky decor is fun. I haven't been to happy hour which I hear is fun. Regular hours are family friendly

yaFjHxLT8oonfElUAy5zZA.text: I always forget this place is here.  It has probably been 15 years since I have visited Valle Luna.  I was looking on my nav system for a new place to take the kids and rediscovered Valle Luna and I am glad I did.  It was very busy when we went in, there was an ASU game and the lounge was very boisterous.  The kids enjoyed the view of the lake.  I can vouche for the chili verde pork enchiladas and my grill like there ground beef tacos with rice and beans (they said the tacos weren't as good as what mom and dad make though ;) but they ate it all up.    Chips are bean dip are similar to Serrano's and the kids really liked them.

BGkTtfd5JeWUe8QWFzN13g.text: I usually go here for business lunches although it's not the best idea due to the slow service. It is not the employees fault though, this place is always understaffed - especially in the bar area and on the bar patio.   If you aren't in a rush though and can take your time, bring your patience with you and sit on the bar patio. It is right on a lake and the view is beautiful.   I like how the chips and salsa comes out with a couple salsa bowls as well as a bean bowl. That is different from what I've seen at most Mexican food restaurants.   The fajitas are a good choice and are always very flavorful. If you ask for corn tortillas be prepared to wait about 15 minutes for them. Happens to me every single time, even if I ask for them when I place the order.   The guacamole is fresh and cold from here.   The margaritas kind of suck and have too much mixer in them, but they are cheap so I always order them anyway.   This place is great if you have a Mexican food craving,  time on your hands, and aren't picky about your cocktails. The food is always what brings me back.

s4vtL_v7HjHD70ySq5HGYA.text: Shrimp Fundido - awwwwwwwwwwwwwsome.  Great service, good food.  Glad there is one so close by!

bbtX2pxzJPv5CU7iKGsp0A.text: I've been here before and it was good food and good service. Today was definitely not a very good day. Four of the hosts were crowded at the door touching each other's hair and not welcoming customers or saying thank you. They had attitude as well. Our server looked like she got deal a wrong hand for the night so was unfortunately taking over her problems with attitude and gossip. A whole crew of servers were standing behind our table gossiping. I will not come back here even if i like the food. I am a waitress and there was absolutely no excuse for the service we had tonight.

fhszTuXA_2jK4Gs5-YpZ8g.text: It has been awhile since we last visited Valle Luna.  It is about a 20-25 minutes drive from our house, so it is not exactly convenient.  I'd promised a Mexican Food Wednesday and I got so wrapped up in the day that I forgot to cook dinner (or even shop for it).  So, we headed to Valle Luna for Family Night.  When we arrived, we were told there would be a 15 minute wait.  About 22 minutes later, we were seated in Gloria's section.  After being seated, we didn't see our waitress for about 5 minutes.  She came up to the table sort of frantic and asked if she could take our drink order.  I asked if we could put in our daughter's food order, since it was getting late and she was hungry.  She told me that she couldn't take the order because she had to go drop off two checks.  Huh?  So she took our drink order and came back with the drinks.  Then she said she would be right back.  Ten more minutes passed and she asked to take our daughter's order.  We told her we were ready to place our entire order, but to please bring our daughter's food out as soon as possible.  I also asked for hot salsa.   After that, we did not get visited by Gloria again.  She made eye contact with me twice - once when she was headed in from the patio and once when she was picking up silverware from a makeshift host table next to our table, but she did not come to our table and just zoomed off.  We heard her say aloud "oh, hot salsa" but she never returned.  No drink refills, nothing.  We waited for more than 30 minutes before asking the hostess to find her.  The hostess was under the impression we were just waiting for our check.  We said, no, we had not even been served our food.  We asked for a manager.  Then, Gloria comes to our table, picks up our drinks and asks if we want a refill.  "No thank you.  We would like to leave.  We have been waiting for too long without service."  She said she would get a manager.  We waited another ten minutes and then I took my daughter to the car, letting the hostess know we were leaving and that her dad was staying to talk to the manager.    He talked to the manager and the manager offered to check on our food and comp the food, but it was already far too late and we were in the car.  He said the manager seemed genuine and polite.  We won't be back to Valle Luna again.  I don't know why the waitress was serving both our table and the patio, but that has to be part of the problem.  There is no real team service there, which could have resolved our drink refill issue.    The bottom line is that Valle Luna is just OKAY food to begin with.  They really need to have stellar service if they want to keep customers... and they just don't have it.

K1NpxFZJl0lSyJMuE4pOyg.text: Food was excellent! They lost our order so it took over a hour to get our food...service was alright

wCQrg9lvxB8zYa_oMG-mnQ.text: The portion sizes are good and it was averagely priced. But the service was honestly really slow. Our waiter couldn't handle our big top, which would be intimidating, but the manager should have kept her in training longer. It's a really pretty restaurant though and the food is average.

JhYeRI8h74CIfSE8U48tcw.text: I want to give a shout out to our server Brittany. She was awesome! It was happy hour on Tuesday night and the place was really busy. Not only did she NOT write our 6 person order down, but she got everyone's food correct and was very attentive despite them being busy. Good with bringing drink before you ran out. :)

z9wRvFo67rq7QyvqWDLWWQ.text: Took family for Happy Hour last night and had the best service from Brittany.   She took all of our food and drink orders without writing anything down and everything came out perfect.  Thanks Brittany!

JZKvEotAVG8_g0peaTMP5A.text: They have a pretty good lunch menu, I generally like the Caesar wrap. Do not go unless you have time because service is pretty slow.

93FOXawCXPCDEvJluimNOw.text: Arriving at the restaurant, the lunch hour hostess (ink covering her left arm) directed us to a dark corner booth. When asked if we could sit by the windows,  she rolled her eyes and pointed at the empty booths available.  Perhaps she should work in the back of the house instead of greeting customers.    Our server, Christa, was very polite and professional! She did a fantastic job and almost changed our opinion of this visit.  Our order was very good and very hot!    We noticed that the lunch hour hostess was training a new employee.  Big mistake, she needs to be retrained herself!  After coming to this restaurant for about six years, this will probably be our last visit!

aVuS5cttdjQ4WDGnavL-0A.text: This place has definitely gone downhill. It used to have the best Mexican food at a great price. We each ordered the fajitas which now cost $16, and we received a plate full of sauteed onions with 4-5 pieces of over cooked meat and a couple of strips of green pepper. Of course we got the usual pile of beans and rice, but we really felt ripped off. We are really disappointed that one of our favorite restaurants has lost its way!

orMgud5DXov9coSxq0dUNg.text: Decided on going here tonight with family. Got a table pretty quick. Was prolly 15 mins before the waiter acknowledged, then about 5 more mins until he came back to take our drink and dinner order. Well 35mins later the food arrives, but during the wait not a single word from waiter as to why so long. The waiter during the meal never checked back to see how everything was. VERY poor service this visit. We go here on a regular basis and we are very disappointed.  We ended up talking with the manager about the server, he was very sorry that we had a bad experience and he took care of some of the items on the bill and offered dessert.  Food as always is very good and we plan on still going there for our monthly Fundido fix,

S9ve_dI5pBKE9nOIHIcnbA.text: My boyfriend introduced me and my girls to this place 2 years ago. It became one of our Go To Places. The service, for the most part, was mediocre. Chasing your waiter to come take your order or get drinks isn't my ideal of great customer service. But we loved going because of the patio sitting and their delicious bean dip which used to be FREE! I understand times are hard and can't always have things for free but to start charging your customer $4.25 for a bean dip, it better come in a large bowl that feeds more than 3 people! If anything, there should be free refills! Otherwise change your price. I never knew refried beans were so costly! You're better off ordering your meal which gives you their rice and beans...and not waste your money on the $4.25 over charged bean dip.  #MediocreService #WhatWasOnceFree #OverPricedBeanDip #ValleLuna

j57rCUJiub3f1CZmgOFoXQ.text: Great local place that I don't go to enough.  The food is really good and they have great specials almost everyday.

RqaLmETfrcRRI3uoGKlrOQ.text: I love this place, my friends and I have always come here for their quesadillas. It's always better with chicken. I always take to go their chips, salsa, and bean dip.

KmBjCWvuN80Q5CqpJW7d-g.text: Huge disappoint. I've been going to Valle Luna for years because our family loved the awesome complimentary bean dip, chips, and salsa with our meals. They are now charging $4.25 for a tiny order of their bean dip. The order wasn't enough for my three small kids much less anyone else.

3jxDjm56u7OOhCslhQHUkQ.text: This spot is a staple of mine and my family's, along with many of our friends.  A really fun, really neat bar with a great vibe.  Tons of locals come into the place and much of the staff are on a first name basis.  The drinks are great - try the blue margaritas.  The food is INCREDIBLE - try the taco basket (chicken and beef combo) and the wings are legit (try them grilled).  The location is great, you can hang out on the back patio right next to the lake.  A really fun place to watch games - especially for Cards fans on Sunday.  Excellent happy hour and the actually just remodeled so the bar area is a lot more open and welcoming. Check it out!

G92GQ2m2EcmvOM0Q3JcLiA.text: the food's good and the drinks are too however, If you are Wheelchair bound and the patio is closed there is nowhere for you to sit... Twice now over the past couple of years we've had this happen to us most recently last week. What restaurant can't handle a Handicapped individual? We've NEVER been to an eating establishment that we couldn't get a seat at. They only have booths inside and a wheelchair won't work... I'm from here and my family has been frequenting Valle Luna for decades, this is what it's come to. Sad times

6XSawjmwXHYiIs2RGanMwQ.text: The food was good, unfortunately it took 40 minutes to get it and it had definitely sat under heating lamps awhile before we got it.   One meal never actually came. The food was good, and I would consider trying it again, just not on a Saturday night.   We checked in through yelp and waited another 20 min.

Qn9oDtZou_lBY3EB8V21Nw.text: I have tried quite a few Mexican restaurants in my area and this is now my go to. The service was excellent the food came out fast and hot and was delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

gq9Q2Qxl1PeYz8LP8dZfnQ.text: After 5 visits over the years am never disappointed in the food and the service is usually very good. The Spinach Conqueso Dip is addictive, the pollo marinated just so, the Poblanos sweet and mildly hot, chips light and refreshing, and the Chimichangas are muy bueno! Will always return when nearby and in the mood for delicious Mexican-inspired dishes!

y6pF4rN3W42Qx-dThnMGrg.text: They can definitely benefit from hiring new greeters. We walked in and one was half laying on the podium talking to the other one. I let them know we were meeting our party and had a reservation. One girl informed me the reservation was at 1. The other one stared and continued laying there. I asked if we can be seated while we are waiting for others to arrive. The second girl rolled her eyes and said, "Your tables aren't ready." I tried my best to keep my composure and asked if there are other places in the restaurant we can sit and wait. They looked at each other and the first girl said, "Well, I guess you could be seated somewhere and when tables open up, we can move you." We opted to wait outside where we saw the patio, where our reservation is, located. It's empty but for one party of two. Rocket scientists worldwide can rest assured their jobs are safe...

jVOF7BsU_e1M-ir8OOvqJw.text: The atmosphere on the patio was awesome! Beautiful view of a serene lake! Southwest chicken was delicious and the chorizo queso was also really good! I would go back or reccomems to a friend to try out

wIHx4VMdUm_P-KIXVQHOrg.text: All around great experience. We had Thomas as a server - request him! He is the best. Food was great - had shredded beef enchiladas with rice and beans.

qBxURjc4d9F5o2dTNDcEWA.text: Great food, awesome drink specials, and cool location on the water. I had great service when I visited last week. Delicious chips and salsa. Got the pollo fundido, so good. Brother had the fajitas that were delicious. I want to go again soon!

LP51JDeZxYZbQhWqKyd2nA.text: Came here for lunch and some cocktails after a long hike with a friend. Was hoping for some Taco Tuesday specials but they had none. Actually they only had tacos as an appetizer and they were lackluster. We tried a dip trio and a chimichanga which were both good and filling. I also couldn't get enough of their complimentary salsa which was really good. Our server, Christian was very nice.   The only gripe I have with this place is the drinks. I had to send back a drink because i could barely stomach it. I don't know if the bartender is pouring half a bottle of bad tequila into those margaritas or their lime juice is off but it was just terrible. We tried multiple drinks and all were awful except for a frozen sangria margarita which was ok. I definitely won't be coming back for the drinks but overall he food and service were good and they had a lot of nice patio space. Shame, I live around the corner and this would have been a perfect spot for cocktails and a safe walk home.

What0_k3O3UrP9kOJ16p1A.text: Big restaurant with tables overlooking the water. Walking in the place smelled pretty horrible, but the dining area was fine. Our waitress was friendly and attentive, kept chips and drinks full. The food arrived in good time on a Monday night.   I had the shrimp fundido, a chimi covered in baja sauce. It was really tasty, as were the rice & beans and the hot salsa. I will definitely keep this place in mind next time I'm in the mood for Mexican food.

FndcIMZTPqbFiDYbeUinCQ.text: One of my favorite local Mexican food joints. Located a couple miles from home I've come here a few times. Nice atmosphere and the food is quality.   Window seats have a nice view of the lake behind and the style of decor within the restaurant is fitting.   Highly recommend the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

-UceLrGp2dgNhQLA4Iysvg.text: The staff took over a hour to seat us. Once we were finally seated it took about thirty minutes just to have our orders taken. Our tables didn't have any utensils even after our food arrived we did not have any utensils and we had to ask multiple times for utensils. The food was alright. I highly recommend their valle Luna bowl

LDzeee_iVJP919nEzYr6rw.text: We come here and eat often. They have great food and a great view with an awesome misting system that kept it nice and cool while we ate on the patio. I highly recommend to eat here.

ndm2F3WHva_PTXW4DUc2ww.text: Service is sometimes not the best when they are really busy but it's understandable. Their food is so worth it and their margaritas are amazing. Try the jalapeno cream cheese boat!

FW2U7fuppbrgCZPt4ZufqA.text: We have been coming here for years for great traditional Mexican food. They have excellent prices and specials. Last night my wife and friend came here because we had a coupon for a buy one get one free entree. My wife ordered the pork street tacos, our friend ordered the shredded beef burro and I ordered the pollo asada burro with rice and black beans. Everything was spot on! We will be back, probably again and again.

Qz-ncAtut_3x6QHda9kRmQ.text: Very good food, so much so there is usually a wait to be seated for dinner. That said, the service can be a little slow as they are usually packed. You also get good value as their prices are reasonable compared to their portions. The Tia Rita Chimi dinner is outstanding! I highly recommend it!!!

51MABa3wAGLIV8C9ZqnFiQ.text: Valle Luna is an old favorite restaurant of mine. I have been coming here for years in part because it is near my work and home, but the food and atmosphere make it an easy choice when you are craving a good, authentic Mexican meal.   Whether you are here for Happy hour, lunch or dinner- there is something for everyone. Any restaurant that serves me a quality salsa with chips to begin my meal is solid in my book. Overall, it is a great looking restaurant with a lake side view if you dine in the back of the restaurant or on the patio, the food is decent and the prices are fair and the service is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chille Relleno

cLsDbUA11w94QnMqIsPE9Q.text: Good service and great food. Only thing is they didn't have refried beans that were on menu. But service was amazing, drinks were on point and food was so good. It's beautiful to sit on patio and enjoy your food with the view of lke and waterfall

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Patio area

bG_h7UvyReWIMv-iVyrbfg.text: Valle Luna has always been good to us every single time we come in. Great atmosphere and goooood food. During fall, sit outside by the lake. Good vibes and good food.

kGxbWvhU-I19BE4jqDaOYA.text: Decided to order a platter for a going away lunch for a coworker got the platter that feeds 12 but i think it's more like ten. Everything to serve the mini tacos taquitos and burritos along with beans and rice is included except for plates. The food was great and everyone commented how spicy the machaca was.
