wYx0AL5R-KSQeDNi5twkHA.text: This place has a great happy hour that lasts till 7:30! Great drink specials and half off of appetizers. I had two drinks and the guacamole,  which was perfect. My server was prompt and attentive even though it was packed in there. I wish there was more patio seating for the bar area. The patio seating for the restaurant was empty but you cant get the bar specials if you sit there.

E25etb02MqIxEsqm1EixbA.text: $30 for two plates of hot mush. My wife and I had belly aches the rest of the day. Never again.

EHLpY0wlG15kIfcdiTczPw.text: I'm going to go out on a limb and give Valle Luna four stars.  Why? Because I like their thin-cut chips and spicy bean dip, lakeside dining and sea bass that comes with a unique concoction of sauteed vegetables, rice and decent jalapeno lime cream sauce.  The best menu item I've ordered (which I coincidentally don't order anymore because I fear the calories) is the South of the Border pollo sandwich. The chicken is soft, flavorful, and the green chile slice gives it a True southwestern ring. Make sure you get the requisite avocado slices.  One complaint is the drink prices - unless you sit in the (usually busy) bar side of the restaurant, a semi-decent margarita might run $7 or $8. I guess I'm spoiled, paying $3 for a margarita at Salty Senoritas.  Sometimes, I've felt the service was a little under par. A lack of warmth and friendliness, maybe? But most of the waiters/hostesses are young and perhaps don't consider this a career, so I don't blame them for not being perky.  I should note - my family loves this place, and they tend to be picky about Mexican food and atmosphere. Considering the other reviews I've seen about Valle Luna, I'm not sure why my family is so entranced with it. But it has become our hangout each time I'm in the southeast Valley.

Fox-MiRsBXT3ktc3shP7eg.text: THE ONLY PLACE I GO TO FOR MEXICAN!  Let me start off first by saying that there is a server that works there named Jill and she is like this precious, sweet, wonderful lady who ALWAYS knows what me and my boyfriend want when she see's us! We just love her so much! She ROCKS!  The staff there seem to have worked there for a long time which always says a lot to me. The chips and salsa are good - but the bean dip? Oh man! I am in love with their bean dip! The atmosphere is really nice and the view is really nice to (over looks a little man made pond with a fountain in the middle.). Me and my boyfriend always order the same thing - the minnie taco basket, beef, with no tomatoes - and we always walk out stuffed and happy. They use shredded beef that is so juicy and flavorful!   Sometimes I am disappointed with the wait staff because certain servers aren't really on top of things, even on a slow day. But, my boyfriend and I don't let that impede out love for the minnie tacos and delicious bean dip!  I will be a patron for forever (or least until I don't live in Phoenix anymore)!

-b7G0m8MmqiKINrCptJEJQ.text: We normally love your place but why would you not have some kind of specials on margaritas for cinco de mayo?

f40vQ3s5cmOc-HQ7S2Ldgw.text: The lake view is what brings my friends and I to this place for an occasional dinner. Place gets packed so we try to come later than the prime time dinner rush. That really works best on the weekend when the hours of operation are a little longer. So... I've tried a lot of their dishes - Fundidos, Shrimp Enchilada Dinner, etc but once I tried their Shrimp Stuffed Poblano Chiles - that was it! I could never try another dish off their menu. Like the pathetic and predictable crack addict that lives for the next hit I come here and predictably get that each and every single time. I mean it comes with everything I love - shrimp, calabacitas, chiles, melted Monterey Jack cheese and jalapeno-lime cream sauce. So Valle Luna, don't you ever ever ever ever ever take that off the menu or I will walk out of your restaurant for the last time ever after throwing a tantrum that would have even embarassed John McEnroe back in the day. One valid complaint that I'm not alone in (judging from OTHER reviews) is they stopped serving the bean dip with the chips. Now it's just the blander salsa that the chips come with. And now they charge a kidney for the beam dip if you still want it. Well not really THAT much - it's more like just a big toe or something. But they used to give it for free as part of the complementary chips and dip. For that I dock a star - since that awesome dip was a mandatory part of the complete Valle Luna experiece. Lots of parking - shares a mall with Nate's Third Base, Sprouts, Hon Machi Sushi, Coffee Rush, and Pita Jungle.

UrZyOsL06AqnFbaHA76AFg.text: i tried thier Sunday morning $2.99 breakfast at teh Cave Creek Rd. location.  The eggs were cold, teh bacon was cold, the sausage was cold.  The fried hash browns were perfect and delicious.  You have to buy a beverage which for me was coffee, it was so so and cost $2.25.  It is served in the Cantina with bartenders doing the serving  For an award winning restaurant I found this to be disappointing.

PuqM8gtB12kNVyr2OiYYng.text: Ate dinner here for my dad's birthday. Service was excellent and so was the food. They serve bean dip and salsa with chips both were very yummy. Their margaritas are excellent.   I had a green pork burrito with beans and rice. Everything was super tasty. My daughter had the cheese crisp extravaganza which she loves...has tons of steak and grilled vegetables. Their Polo Fundito is also excellent, the cream cheese sauce is perfect, not too hot. Really didn't have anything bad. Servings are huge so you will have leftovers for lunch the next day!!   There is a lovely outdoor patio that would be really nice when the weather is cooler.   Will definitely be back soon!!

wgVw3992nUWf9DEu_scstQ.text: This is not going to blow your sox off... but they food is consistent, good variety, and decent quality.  I like their green chili best. Pretty much all I get there now when I go.

v29wFvkQq4GGDljp8HWV2Q.text: Beautiful view of the water if you sit by the windows or on the patio. They have the best chicken fundido I have ever had! Really good salsa too. Staff is always fast and friendly.

ooNhF6bFnCJRbVYTGMmGnw.text: I am opening a day spa practically right next to this place so after hours of meeting contractors, taking measurements, etc. in our currently empty space my wife and I were ready for a margarita and some good food. So we decided to try one of new neighbors and I have to say that we were very impressed.   The inside is beautiful with wood beams and little False roofs that make the atmosphere cozy. Of course, the lake is right there which also adds to the atmosphere. Margaritas were $5 on Mondays, which we were happy about because that was number on our list that day. The menu had lots of great choices but we decided to just order two appetizers. We got a mixed mini taco plate and sliders.  Both of our choices were first rate, not greasy, and were served quickly. We thought the service was exceptional. A manager was walking around checking everything the entire time and was actually the one that asked if we wanted a second drink. I always like it when managers are hands on with customers.  My only negative is that one item we ordered was more expensive than we thought. The menu we looked at was for the cantina only, not the main restaurant. Apparently, the cantina has its own specials. I thought that was confusing for a new customer but I don't think they were trying to be misleading at all so I would not knock their rating for that. It was really our fault.  I noticed most of the negative reviews here are old. I thought it was excellent so maybe they changed.

uitUERn65kScHEfz9xnefA.text: Great happy hour specials.  Great food and yummmmy food. Wednesday has family night specials.

HYCSKsgkh4p0gnzlGud4bA.text: This place offers consistently good Mexican Food. However, it is kind of hard to compete in Phoenix. The chips, salsa and bean dip was very good. Chips were served hot to our table. Sadly they were out of salsa verde which is totally my favorite part. I ordered the Port Verde which comes with rice and beans. The sides were spot on but the Pork Verde was a bit bland. My friend ordered a combo plate with a tostada, enchilada and crispy taco. Unfortunately, his instructions had been forgotten and the tostada and taco had ingredients on it that he couldn't eat. Portion sizes are good and the server was pretty attentive.

pUe0fBFPMD0ax-axjfYBfA.text: Ughhhh!! go anywhere else but here! food was bland bland bland and horribly greasy! not a fresh item to be had. It was like drunk college food only worse.  It takes some serious work to mess up tacos rice and beans in my opinion but Valle Luna more than succeeded. Way too overpriced for the junk they serve. All I wanted were two veggie tacos and i got the greasiest hard tacos ever that were falling apart with refried beans from a can and not a vegetable to be had. Rice was tasteless and horribly mushy. We will never be back. Honestly I wish that I had complained but our server was too nice and we were so intent on leaving that I just did not...save your wallet and your stomachs and skip Valle Luna!!

QAeK4xu2tKFoH_JehQl1TQ.text: Besides being my husbands favorite place, this place is downright delicious! Great prices, great atmosphere, and great service. Even during a rush they manage to make diners feel like it's empty and you have their undivided attention. We look forward to date nights as it's our usual spot!

bqdzIZwAf0eyN1rBXorzvA.text: The taco basket on happy hour with the chips, salsa bean dip. Cheapest dinner ever. delicious.

bRcEZ8p2x30Zpv1S7sklJQ.text: Food is good . Service is hit or miss.  Prices have gone up in recent years but quality has not.

-9_EMPwBlNeGcRNAADF2jg.text: We thought we tried out Valle Luna restaurant because we had buy one get one free entree  Worth trip!  The food is excellent, great service unfortunately the air in  part of the restaurant was out but I would definitely come again.

03FWmKVc_rEPXIUa4gRyaQ.text: This place is awesome for happy hour.  You can get a dozen wings or a taco basket, add a  Mexican import beer, free chips and salsa plus bean dip. All this for $8.50. You can up the beer to a 32oz for just $1 more.  The food is very good, I was very happy and returned the next night to try it again.  They have a nice menu for happy hour, I have tried the wings and the taco basket, they were both excellent. Have to go back and try some of the others soon!

t_zqUs1jCQ37-AhdsP-hZw.text: Emailed Valle Luna and the owner responded with the results of an in-depth inquiry into what happened at the restaurant. Sounds like an owner who really cares about her business. Very pleased with this response and happy to continue to frequent one of our favorite Mexican food restaurants!

7y3NAZ2KVHlHoXOe_5GrBw.text: I have been a Valle Luna fan for over a decade now and finally found a location close to me again. I brought my wife here for the first time and she LOVED it. this is our new GO TO mexican restaurant!!!

dwDmbEh8Q8mcRGPCgBrupw.text: Had a great dinner with family and didn't break the bank. Great margaritas! We also had an EXCELLENT waiter named Mason!! Can't say enough good things about him.

PIa9prXhESuFkPysOkrxXw.text: The food here is predictably good, not great. It does not display depth of flavor or creative anything. The portions are large and the view of the cement lake,  well... It's a good deal if you are over 50/55 on a Tuesday the second entree is 50% off, The service is good. Sadly, their signature bean dip is no longer served gratis with the salsa. It is still available but you pay for it. That was actually my favorite thing about the place. The margs are really good and the bar always hopping. They must have a decent happy hour.

xwsc50Socst8C8Mm2poKhg.text: My favorite Mexican food restaurant in AZ! We have had some ups and downs over the past couple decades almost, but more ups than downs. The downs have been fixed in, in my opinion. Gabe is the man and has probably been serving us for 7 years by now. They have the best tacos in the state. It feels like you are with family when you are there after all these years.

9Kq9GBq5AlDcC8EZUlRBEg.text: They have a pretty good salsa. However, beef fajitas had hardly any beef in them. I was out of sour cream and other extras, but the waitress didn't ask if I wanted more.

wUKvJrLXNZKSK97LFPzOXA.text: Came to lunch with on my coworkers that I have not seen in a long time.  We sat in the patio due to nice sweet weather.  The patio tables and chairs are a little dirty.  Service was super slow.  Had to get the server's attention a few times for refills.  The food was ok and little bland.  =(

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Patio view

RSoRmxyY23rWR3uwEY6YeA.text: My wife and I have been thinking of Valle Luna for a week. A co worker brought a platter to my wife's work and she loved it. She brought her plate home for me and we both were very happy with the flavor.   Flash forward to tonight. Carlos was our knowledgeable server. We described the plate that we had eaten and he instructed us that we needed the green chile chimis. We got the Vallitas and Lunitas as an entree, crispy chicken flautas and bean/green chile/red chile chimis. I got the numero Uno. Chicken taco was juicy and crispy and crunchy and the flavor was just right. Green chile enchilada was piping hot but I could not stop eating. Rice and beans were done right.   The real winner of the night was desert. Carlos undersold and over delivered. The fried ice Cream was not the usual rock hard interior. This was the right size to fry the outside and just soften the inside. Not only do you get the best fried ice cream but cinnamon fried tortillas AND caramel cheesecake stuffed chimi.   We found our new favorite Mexican food. Well done Carlos and thank you Valle Luna.

5mj0O0me7TwBcsW13_rzCg.text: What happened? What happened to this east valley landmark? I think it's gone downhill. Four of us sat at a table and none of us were impressed by anything.  I had the most bland fajita's ever. I could feel a cold coming on so I asked for jalepeno's or habenero's or anything to spice it up.......I got nothing.  Servers were attentive and dessert was good, but I can't say anything positive about the main courses. I doubt I will make it back.

eEv_6PZXr6x2XjJwDVUvQQ.text: Valle Luna has been my go to Mexican restaurant for 2 years now. Tonight I had the pleasure of having Brian as my waiter. He gave the best service I've ever received at this restaurant. Very laid back and genuine! he also gave excellent advice for the different meals my group was ordering, for example he recommended the grilled chicken for the taco salad which was amazing! On top of that he was fast and always made sure we had everything we needed- never left us wondering where our server was.

EYahpMlgmw24Oz_FzlkhWg.text: Best Mex around. Good variety on menu, fokd well prepared. Service quick and friendly. Prices fare. Di it.

dXSdTzk6CoB6LmCwg2iLgA.text: So its Thursday night and I got a certificate from Resturant.com for Valle Luna and thought I haven't been out with the kids in a while wonder if they are up to trying a new place, and guess what, they were, ok when I say kids, I really mean 21, 19, & 16 yr old, yea they are not really kids, but they are my kids :) It was my 1st time there and I really wanted to like Valle Luna, it's just right up the street from me. I did some research and read some reviews of friends and thought ok, this is going to be a good place! When we 1st got there they put us in a small booth, we were sitting on top on each other, the 21 yr old is 6 months prego and they placed us in table where it was very tight and making her uncomfortable and I had my left handed son sitting next to me elbowing me already and the food hadn't even arrived yet (s/n: I really think he sits by me to bug the crap out of me) so we asked for a bigger table and we got moved almost into a small booth on the other side, my daughter said yea that's not going to work, that's what the other one was and it hurt to sit there, so we were moved to a table with the view of the lake, it was nice, felt like was in a different area then just chillin in chandler It was happy hour when I arrived and it was Three-O Thursday, all Three Olive Vodka drinks for 3 bucks, so I ordered the Cherry Smash, it was a pretty drink, but way too strong for me , I know I was even shocked I couldn't finish it! The chips, bean dip & salsa arrived to the table, now to me the chips were not that bad, tasted ok, some of the reviews said it was the worst part of it, to me they were ok, the salsa on the other hand reminded me of pace picante, one was sweet and the other was just like tomato sauce, packed no heat what so ever, but the kids liked it and ate it. Ok I'll just tell you what they ordered real quickly: 21yr old ordered the Tamale Dinner, she loves tamales, she thought the flavor was good, tamale itself was a little dry, but it cured her caving. 19 yr old ordered grilled asada burro dinner, she loved it! This plate looks like something I should have ordered, she loved it! 16 yr old ordered southwestern chicken breast, he didn't care for it, he said the chicken tasted like I cooked it, meaning it looked great, but was dry, sometimes I just wanna smack him haha After reading everyone's reviews, I was really looking forward to what I ordered, I ordered the Fundido, I understood that it was deep fried, but mine looked and tasted like it was left in the fryer for way too long, the tortilla was inedible, I scraped everything out of it and left the shell on another plate. The beans & rice were good, and so what the filling inside the tortilla, the jalapeno-cream cheese could have had more heat for, but was very good. I don't think I will be ordering this dish again. We were having a good time talking with each other and decided that we wanted desert, so 2 of us ordered the fried ice cream and one ordered the chocolate taco. I was one of the ones who ordered the fried ice cream and I chose caramel for topping instead of chocolate, and I asked if it could be drowned in caramel and it was ,,omg it was soo delish!!!!! I do want to come back to Valle Luna to give them another try, the kids did enjoy themselves and the food, so they are willing to go back with me.

Ktt2kwT-lxFbzdmYgsx6nw.text: Recently I decided to have a surprise birthday party for my girlfriend, and being that she and most of her friends are Mexican I wanted a place with good food. She is from Sonora, and the restaurant is described as Sonoran-style, so I put it at the top of my list.  I spoke to someone a few weeks prior who gave me additional information on private parties. They offer three different levels of menus for large parties. In selecting the Sonoran Celebration I picked two menu items and it came with rice, beans, a zucchini dish, and chips & salsa. Unlimited soda, tea, and coffee also come with that option. I had half of the patio overlooking the lake, booked it for 5pm with dinner served at 6.   I arrived a little early and had the opportunity put up decorations and set up the cakes I brought. While I was doing that two staff members were busy setting up the food line and brought me drinks. As the guests arrived they were offered drinks and chips & salsa while the food was being prepared.   The setting was perfect, my girlfriend surprised, and everyone reported having a good time. They enjoyed the food and as I booked for 35 but didn't have quite that many show up there were some leftovers that we brought home. It was a good choice (thanks to those Yelpers who provided suggestions on my Talk post), and I will definitely visit again.

MQfW1bSjykMD1jvxzXP4HA.text: Service was good, but the food...seriously the most bland "Mexican food" I've ever had.  I guess it explains so many older folks here for lunch.  I cannot believe it was so bland...wow!  I can make better tacos at home. Won't be back...well maybe one day for drinks on the patio in cooler weather.  I had a taco and a tostada.

D6hqOirFL608p_lTtozqIQ.text: This place is good. Love the people and the drinks. Food is always hot. You will leave with a smile on your face guaranteed. Try it out just once you will see.

EZBGAa7iWnWGYJTxk0jKnQ.text: Food was better then I expected to be honest. Would go back for sure if I was in the area. I got the spicy matcha burrito. Super spicy

58ngcGpYl9ECdZw3amRQFg.text: Food was good, parking is a pain in the tukas.... You get what you expect at Valle Luna and no complaints from us, wife did think her Pollo Fundido was lacking in flavor thou.

ymIKJStzQGOGdwQbrdFjRw.text: American adapted Mexican menu.  I loved exploring the menu until I thought to ask about trans fats in the flour tortillas.  Yes, there are trans fats!!!  Shocked.  How could any local restaurant use an ingredient that goes in; but, doesn't come out: collects around organs and clogs arteries.  I now have to find another American-Mexican restaurant.  Sad.

Y2iXd5HtYqw6GLfPEOVizg.text: good quality food which is why i return but the last few times that i have came i sit at a table for 10 minutes with no service. the first time i left, this time i finally got my chips and salsa before i can leave so i stayed. I don't know my waitress's name and i've been sitting here ready to order with my waitress nowhere to be seen. it sucks that i love coming here for good food but horrible service.  i completely understand busy hours but i don't understand waiting 10 mins before being attended to.

gjf0daq5yuygARcei6-j6g.text: If there was a zero star option I would choose it!  They messed up tacos, how can a Mexican place mess up tacos???  The service was very slow and snarky. I don't think I would come back here again!!!

ucm3tbYQs8dOzpQmGlWY1A.text: I'm a huge fan of Mexican food so it's hard to let me down and Valle Luna definitely didn't! The spinach enchiladas were super tasty and I was so glad to be able to find so many vegetarian options. The location is really cool and we nabbed a table overlooking the water so we had a super great night. You can tell that this is a neighborhood place by all the groups of friends gathered and having a great time. We'll be back for sure.

PrGUqu81zMFk4fLwW1pKLg.text: Love love love this place!  The service was prompt and very friendly.  I really felt  at home here.  The food is fantastic!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and I am a serious foodie (:

wLLhjN2Wao0dJa9-d4imCw.text: I was interested in trying this restaurant and was please to get a flyer in the mail with a buy one meal get the second one free coupon.  I got it about a week or two ago and was hoping to enjoy it.  Went there with my companion and liked the surroundings and the lake view.  Was expecting a great experience.  But, when I went to order I was shocked that the server said the coupon expired last December (2013).  This was September 12 2014 around 1pm at the Ray road site!!!  The server said he would have to check with the manager and this was the second one he had seen like this lately,  I should have known I was in trouble when he never came back for a long time.  When he did, he asked if we ready to order as the manager was busy right now and he wanted to see if we wanted to get our order started..  I said I think we better wait until we speak to the manager as the coupon is what brought us in.  Eventually the manager came by.  She said that there was nothing she could do as the expiration date was clear on the coupon.  I restated I just got it in the mail in the past two weeks so something must be wrong with your advertising department.  She said she didn't know how I got the coupon but, it was out of date and she could do nothing for us.  We then left and went to Charleston's and got wonderful service and great food.

InwxSmRl0sGGuz4WkQhvlA.text: I love their mexican pizza!  Happy hour in the cantina has great deals, half off appetizers and drink specials.

fl_iNYfuYqSSe0b5J5fxVw.text: Absolutely love love this place. The food is good, drink specials and service is always great. We come here once a month, the location is perfect with views of the water from the patio! They also have specials if you use foursquare you can get $ off your bill.

VF6Tr5BlwLa7S_QPNLoQtg.text: We've been going to Valle Luna on and off for years.    The last time that we ate there, we were less than pleased.  The food was bland, the sauces all tasted the same.  I ordered tamales, my favorite, they were as hard as rocks, so dense and heavy and unpleasant.  The rice was blah.  My daughter decided that rather than order from the kids meal, she would order a 1/2 price happy hour appetizer.  The happy hour menu was standing up in the middle of the table for all to see.  When we tried to order off the appetizer menu, we were told that those items could only be ordered in the bar and that the server was unable to accomodate us.  I decided to go into the bar and order the appetizer to bring back to our table.  On the upside, the bartender was very helpful and said that it was fine, nothing worng with bringing it back to our table and then offered to bring it to us when it was done!  So helpful!   We were very  disappointed that the server was so unwilling to help us solve the problem.    We went home with tons of leftovers because none of us thought the food was any good.  Don't know why we took it home, it just ended up in the trash.   I guess we'll continue our quest to find the best Mexican food restaurant!

y1Fg24CcN2trk0yJL6r7dQ.text: Their host Brandon is always super sweet and welcoming! Such great food..their fried ice cream is amazing!

MBo3AH4DOVBKNKrVg1ZEzA.text: I know people who really love this place, so maybe I have visited on a bad day(s) or I am just extra-picky when it comes to my Mexican food. IMO, Valle Luna is just average. Although I admit the service has been good and the ambiance is nice.   On our last visit, we were immediately greeted by a cheerful hostess and taken to a booth along the far side of the wall. Unfortunately the patio was full. If you get a choice, ask for a table outside overlooking the water. It helps the so-so food go down better.   Pros: Big portions, lots of cheese, good service.   Cons: Ho-hum food. Lots of grease. Can be too crowded.

GPcZJge4BItKSbfzXjo3qg.text: Very good chips and salsa. Prompt, fast service.  Will return in future.

I1k4uyBv6tU5hlo82DzVSg.text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere. I couldn't ask for a better place to spend an afternoon/evening. Even the late night bar scene is fun! Highly recommended.

C3LgfBJi75bxfVAPOH_Kjg.text: I'm a regular. Love their green corn tamales and their taco basket is good. I go to the cantina to meet up with friends and enjoy happy hour. Always relaxed and can watch the game and talk with friends. Prompt service and good drinks. The "lake" nearby provides a good atmosphere. I love Mexican food but wouldn't say this is the greatest Mexican you'll ever have but pretty decent. I come from New Mexico, so I'm hard to please.

aDhh-K1MfuKlynEKt5ew0g.text: Best happy hour!! Weekdays until 7:30. Sit on the patio with a couple margaritas and some mini bean burros without spending $10.

4AMcPwRtpqEYda7xMyC77A.text: Good food, nice outdoor patio, moderately priced....unfortunatly, service needed some work. They offer unlimited chips and salsa and bean dip, and negro modelo on tap! Amazing chicken chimichanga!!

ILJ0VoHGVub5RUlzA-yP1Q.text: Love that Valle Luna sits right on the lake, I enjoy feeding the duckies chips (even though I'm not supposed to) and sitting outside. The food is good, not great, but good. The bean dip is also pretty good, but not as good as serranos. We come here once in a while, but not a place I'd go out of my way for. Like I said, good, but not great.

3TGnIjEb7Mqxdbk2Ky7Faw.text: The restaurant wasn't bad but nothing blew me away. The fundido (steak) was good, as long as I didn't think about how many miles I'd have to run afterwards to counteract it. I'm a huge dessert fan and their deep fried ice cream was not something I'd order again (this is where they lost the most points with me). I'll probably eat there again before I make a final decision.

OzO-acpVVcaCRuyBh1DSKw.text: Great atmosphere in the bar area during happy hour. By the way, happy hour is from 3-730pm mon- fri. Saturday is 12-6pm. Chuey or Thomas are usually behind the bar. Awesome bartenders. Both these guys exceed expectations. Get the taco basket basket, will not be disappointed.

01rOBFYok2YG7Jlg2F7VGw.text: My wife and I ate there on Sunday, April 23.  There was a twenty minute wait for dinner, about usual on the weekend. Decor is faux Mexican cantina. We were seated promptly after the wait and  fresh chips and a slightly watery salsa were provided. The atmosphere is very family friendly and has a view of the Andersen artificial lake. My wife had the shrimp/pork  combo fajitas and I had a red chili/machaca chimi. Both were served with ample sides of rice and refried beans and were very tasty. The draft Amber Bock and  Dos Equis XX  were fresh & cold. They were out of draft Modelo.  We split a flan for dessert, which was average. My wife also ordered flautas for next day lunch. We have eaten there many times over the twelve years Valler Luna has been open and the Sonoran food is consistently good. It is a bit less hot then I prefer, but does hit a happy medium for most people, There is outside deck seating and a nice bar area.

SlEhzztM5V0URTwrlm8Zfg.text: I am having a hard time finding AMAZING mexican food in arizona.. but valle luna has some tasty bean dip to go along with those thin chips. First impressions make or break with me.. so that definitely helped! I have tried multiple things here and each time i am happy with my decision! mmm and mango margaritas are sooo good!

dx72tw-SSaH0kgdE-wqZ3Q.text: Valle is all about the ritas happy hour, chips and bean dip and an awesome patio, if you are looking to eat awesome pollo funditos well they have that too...

CYnfI3Q0tu15tT_pkI7GgQ.text: I used to come here regularly.  However, after they decided to allow patrons to bring guns into the bar I stopped going.  I simply can't take my children to a place that mixes guns and alcohol.

q9TPPkK-xxRU0wosjZvsZA.text: The location is nice, the service was good, but in my opinion, the food has gone so far downhill I hope never to return. It's not that the food is gross or anything like that, it seems fresh but the flavor is just so blah. My parents and grandparents love it but if you like spicy, flavorful Mexican food this place isn't for you.

crkipejFy1v7Rndjiu_Jvw.text: I normally order from the one in Phoenix because I work over there. Never had a complaint about that one. Tonight I ordered my favorite which is the Steak Fundido with pinto beans. I can't stand refried beans. Got it home and it is the most horrible thing ever! I was given refried beans the chimi was disgusting. The fundido sauce was IN the chimi which normally  just goes on the outside which it was as well. The steak had absolutely NO taste/ seasoning except the fundido sauce.... Will never order take out from this one again. I am not taking it back because it's hot outside and don't want to drive all the way back again. Not worth the $17 + $3 tip I just gave.

Lz5UO3T2fWjguGtdG2E-zg.text: we waited 1 hour for our food, for it to come out cold, and i ordered enchiladas but instead we got some pancake looking enchiladas? which i don't think taste at all like enchiladas. i got the runs now.  update: currently still sitting in bathroom stall.. w/o toilet paper..

KGfImrv2qwxfGhhprYIHJA.text: Where do i start.  I always have a blast and i love the taco baskets  so delicioso and i love sharing those with myself. fd157O4QIG0fbr9ihgtckw.text: What a disgusting place.... waited over an hour for ice cold food!!A manager ( Hispanic Lady ) walked around never asked anyone anything until all hell broke loose. YXOKEHV0APT1QN2R4YghYQ.text: Been going here for years and enjoy the food.  Ate here this afternoon and found a hair in our hot sauce.  Told the waitress who whisked it away quickly.  Never brought us more, never told a manager, didn't offer discount, DIDN'T APOLOGIZE.  Nothing.  I understand these things happen at times.  But I would expect at the minimum an apology.  Sadly, do not think we will return.

DpHnQ5YD8Me8A7esSA_btA.text: I rarely leave negative reviews but yesterday's experience warrants one. My family and I have never been here before yesterday. We decided to grab lunch to celebrate a late Margarita Day. The issues began when almost immediately:  1-my mom is elderly and walks with a cane. The hostess took us up stairs without asking if she could navigate the stairs. I thought this was thoughtless. But we soldiered on because I heard great things and we had a coupon.  2-our waiter introduced himself and was obviously stressed. He mentioned that he was super busy with another party. This is okay and I only mentioned it because I think it reflects on management issues. When we walked through the restaurant ppl were not working as hard as our waiter.  3-the food was not good. The food was lightly warm and not great. It was edible but not close to the rave reviews I heard.  4-coupon issues. We ultimately chose your restaurant because we had a coupon. I presented my coupon as did others at our table and it caused an unexpected ruckus. We were told you could not accept our coupon in a digital format. We took pictures of our coupon. Your coupon has no language that requires it be presented in paper form. The manager was hostile and unprofessional. She tried to place the responsibility of the issue on us the guest. She raises her voice and was rude. She allowed us to use on coupon but made it clear she wasn't happy doing so.  She actually yelled us for insisting you honor your coupon.    I slept on it before leaving a review. I don't like leaving bad reviews but it was such a negative experience. It left such a bad impression especially for place in Chandlers.   Ultimately the food was descent with subpar service and lacked quality management. I would recommend taking a few extra minutes to go to Macayo's or Elmer's.

DCYNW0L4AR3j6wkALl_CuQ.text: Mondays are $0.99 margaritas, cant get a better Happy Hour price than that. I am apart of a local Chandler meet and greet group and we have discovered this great special and plan to be back every Monday while we support local Chandler businesses.  We sat on the patio next to the beautiful lake, so relaxing and peaceful.  The patio is large and has multiple TV's for everyone.  Our server was awesome, with our large group if 20+ people she was attentive, sharp, friendly and provided awesome service.  Haven't been to Valle Luna in many many years, but it was just as awesome as I remember.

F6n-zCKwVN3yw4XsUNvKBw.text: I ate at the Cave Creek restaurant  with a group of 12.  The service was excellent.  Our waitress was pleasant and quickly substituted one guest meal who ordered a plate that was too spicy for her.  I ordered the shredded beef taco and cheese enchilada and it was so good!  I definitely   will go to Valle Luna again but will try the one on Bell Road because it is closer to home.

J7aJcy38ZMqVyAf0mDNIXA.text: Tried this place tonight as it came highly recommend on my Nextdoor Neighbor app.  It was about a 20 minute drive, so I had my hopes up.  We sat outside for dinner and it was perfect! The view of the little lake was peaceful and the patio had misters, although the whole patio is shaded in the evening so it's not to hot.  The service was great and our waitress was very attentive.  The food is a little above average, but I have a hard time justifying a 20 min drive for it.  I will return for a date night, but mainly for the environment.

R93GjqzqOt0SIjlhtpAQDw.text: Appetizers in the bar were great. Went back the next week for a meal, and wasn't as impressed with the dinner. Restaurant was loud, service a little slow on a Friday. I never did get any salt, which was needed for the chips and salsa! I thought I would give 4 stars after the Vallitas and Lunitas appy but the rest didn't live up to the hype.

UXPtew7xTAjy3rIcLdkKCQ.text: Sat out on the patio for our meal and it was pretty nice. It wasn't too hot and they have misters so it was rather enjoyable. I got the Luna burger and my friend got the fundido. It was pretty good but the micheladas not so much. Service was pretty slow & hardly saw our waiter but I will go back to try it out again.

EQV7yHxXiVa6mhVayPHrbA.text: Zero flavor. Love Mexican food but this is by far awful and the worst place ever. 3 out of the four people had a few bites of food. Total waste. Should've listened to all the other reviews.

izVT-hN3jfmcOV_U47t9yQ.text: Good food.  Competitive prices. And a nice view from the patio.  The hot sauce salsa with chips are the best.

BMyqvOUZACeTp1w14rmiXg.text: So lets start off by saying this place is in a super funky location. Were seated in a timely manner and chips were brought out promptly. But, thats probably the best of what I can say about this place. Our food was sub-par and lacked real flavor. And our waiter seemed like he had "a lot going on".

2N3sUUE_49Om8OHSkLztCA.text: Our server came over to us twice. Once when we arrive and then once after our food was delivered. He otherwise ignored us the whole time. We had to get another waitress to help us out.   The chips and salsa were okay. The food was large portions, with okay flavors.
