jm7_hk2vPhhoyYHjJVE6oA.text: Decided to give this place another try because my friend suggested it for the margarita special. Monday Margaritas for 99 cents! I'm there! However, I was disappointed once again by the lackluster food. I ordered the burrito special on the lunch menu that was about $8.50. When I got my food I cut into my burrito and took a bite expecting a mouthful of flavor but instead all I got was the taste of reheated shredded beef. I asked for the sauce on the side, which is probably what they use to cover up the reheated meat. I complained to my waitress and she apologized and offered me something else and I said no I just want it taken off my bill. I told her I would eat the rice and beans it came with. Then the bill came and she took the $8.50 burrito off my bill but charged me $2.50 for the measly side of rice and another $2.50 for the tiny bowl of beans. Are you kidding me? Your burrito was awful and you still charged me $5! I had to wait for her to come again to complain about the charge for rice and beans that a toddler wouldn't even get full on. She said she would talk to the manager. She came back with my bill once again and he took off a $2.50 charge. I work in customer service and any common sense would say you don't charge the customer at all....but I guess that is lacked at this restaurant along with flavor.   If you read Valle Luna's reply you'll see what I mean by lack of customer service....

E0p94IqLwmNxAC2a-qXqaw.text: I'm a native in AZ and this place is hands down my favorite Mexican food place of all time. You won't regret coming here! The food is amazing. & The salsa is the best salsa I've ever tasted, I wish I could buy it by the gallon! So good.

LMveygFvY4PT4R1qKFDyXw.text: Worst restaurant in Chandler! Worst food and even worst service! We waiting a hour and half for food. It came out cold and my son pork was rotten meat! Manager was ok but should have comp our meal!

tTt2wuaeEdRj7Yug0zdTNQ.text: Fine for a quick shredded beef taco.  I ordered it to go, and they had the wrong order when I arrived.  They did fix it pretty quickly.  Taco was really greasy, but that happens with shredded beef tacos.  I know what I'm getting in to.  Good amount of cheese, lettuce, and tomatoes.

jP6Twkq9c-qsS8u8nOtZkg.text: went out To dinner Last Night after son's Soccer game.  Parking lot of Valle Luna Packed as usual.  We Had a really good waitress, Wish I could remember her name.  We Had good time,Good Company, Good Food, and Great Service. I Highly Recommend There Fundido,I usually get there chicken, last night I tried there steak (really Good) and of course don't forget to try Their Margarita's

IgBNePemEIFUwFr_xn3PpA.text: Good food, Service was not the best. Slow and not very good interaction but not rude. Good drink specials.

OSZkwYe-rOOkKWEEm6a-6g.text: Valle Luna isn't the best, most authentic Mexican food in the land, but it's plenty good enough for those that don't know any better. I've only visited for happy hour, but always leave with a happy tummy after chowing down on spicy chips and salsa, margaritas,and half-priced appetizers.  I'm particularly fond of this location because of the sweet lakeside view. Its beauty at sunset combined with the savings from coupons they repeatedly send in the mail are reason enough to return for more.  HH is 3-7:30 M-F and 12-6 on Sat. Cheers!

N3yz4lZw3HCYzAvHPkqaew.text: My most disappointing meal at Valle Luna. We have gone to the Chandler location for years but today our service was very poor at best. Our waiter, who I can't name because he said the name on the tag was not his, did not  provide good service. The booth next to us was seated 10 minutes after us but was served their meals before my wife and I received our order. I had to get up and get my own "to go" box because he never returned. Finally got or bill, paid cash, and got out. There are so many restaurants in the area there is no reason to return to one that does not provide good service.

VWtd3Sxk3oMmf3oZ0PsF5A.text: They have three different locations and the first time I had their food it was catered for an event, and it was so good, that I had to go there. I went to one location out in Phoenix by one of my jobs, and ordered the shredded chicken tacos. AMAZING!!! They were soooo good, that I had to try their other location on Ray Road and it was just as amazing as the other two times I had it. I LOVE their tacos and their chips and salsa is to die for.

es1oiPevc7BpBBCOoP66iQ.text: The service here is awesome and the food along with it! I had the burrito bowl and my hubby had the enchiladas! Both very tasty. Be careful with chips and salsa. Muy delicioso!!!

fuPL0JL70sffnpJugmb-fA.text: Best Mexican food around love it great service best place around they have the best service and the best food try the spinach enchiladas there they're the bomb the waitress I don't know her name she's been there forever she is fantastic I love having her every time I go there I wish I knew her name but we sit on the patio every time we go and she's always our server 90% of the time and she is just fantastic and the food is the bomb I give A5 star rating

E5o8_KIIP3sbtw6td_hPuw.text: Food is good, a bit of the greasy and messy side. I went around the end of the lunch rush and it was quick to get seated and order in. The food took a long time to come out and the waitress did not check on us to refill drinks or anything. We probably waited about 20 minutes for the food to come out. That seems like a long time for a lunch rush. Overall food is good, and typical, value was on the average side.

R8rDFNfuuAmw34SYNLg-PA.text: Got there on "Taco Tuesday" around 6pm and wow was it packed!  We went to the bar area and was able to grab a table top.  Our server was right on the ball with getting us waters and menus.  He made sure we got the chips and salsa to tie us over as the place was packed!! 2nd mention.  We got our order in right away and only had to wait about 20 minutes to get our food.  We didnt order off the happy hour menu but there was plenty to choose from.  My order wasnt correct when I got it but were in a time crunch so didnt want to wait to send it back.  I ordered a combo plate with all chicken and ended up with ground beef :(  Taco fell apart, enchilada was all cheese and the tamale was the worst I had ever tasted.  My daughters ground beef enchiladas were less than par also.  Definately not the quality of food we were hoping for.  Unfortunately cant rate it very highly.  Maybe if we went during a non-happy hour time would have been a different experience however I'll go with my instinct to not go back to try again.   Great service, just poor food.

VSZKFVXOzaL4HAQQEOUOVA.text: Not the same as it used to be. There is no longer complimentary bean dip and it's not even the same recipe. Total bummer and disappointment.

ACYuhSJY1rrFAXd3XN5v_w.text: We used to go to Valle Luna years ago because it was the best and had the best bean dip and chips.  The greeters were wonderful, felt like it was going to be a wonderful reunion.  Then no bean dip with the chips...okay we ordered it.  Not the same bean dip, runny and not tasty.  The service was less than ok. The food was not what we had before.   Our waitress did not even visit our side of the restaurant, other servers in the area practically had to be tripped to be asked to have our server come by.  The manager came and got our drink order.  Wrong beer, and no waitress in sight.  Will have to savor the memory of years gone by.  Won't be going out of our way to eat there again. Have much better places close to us.  Very sad.

DzwKMY4QjICElyUubuvL1g.text: Ok service, waitress was nice. But she didn't  seem to care once we told here that the food we ordered was dry and was unsatisfactory. All she said was, yeah nothing compares to home made. We ordered the tamales they were dry and had almost no meat in them. Our waitress said they wouldn't be dry if we put the sauce on top. But if your cook could make tamales correctly we shouldn't need sauce to make them moist. The best part of our meal was the rice. We spent 40 for a plate of nasty tamales and good rice. We will never be back. If your smart you will not come here any hole in the wall Mexican restaurant is better than this dump. Too bad really we live close and could have been regular customers.

ZAyIfwOE6-ystaKy9ZI3jA.text: I don't know how anyone can eat at this place! The food is disgusting; bland, overly salted, and greasy are the best words to describe the 4 dishes my party ordered (and that includes a taco salad)! The meat on it smelled like dog food. I assumed when I paid extra for steak it was going to be big decent pieces. Nope. It was like weird Taco Bell meat cut into tiny cubes the size of raisins. In all honesty I should have just gone TO Taco Bell instead of wasting money on this food- especially since the dressing I asked for on the side came in a plastic take out container. When I am paying to sit down, please don't serve me anything in crappy plastic containers. The margaritas were terrible as well! Watered down, way too sweet, and pretty much see through. I also asked for a salted rim and was given this weird sugar mixture on it instead. This overly sweet drink they tried to pass off for a margarita might work well at a sorority house but not as a restaurant that boasts being voted the top Mexican Food in 2014. My two thoughts on that:  1) According to who (because whoever decided that doesn't have tastebuds) and 2) HOLY CRAP how Valle Luna has gown down hill in just 2 short years.

0fg3jGXEP-QayAMidgfqJw.text: Food is ok. Portions large. What pissed me off is that to get the "Sunday Funday" deals you have to sit in the bar or bar patio--smoky and awful. I cannot be around smoke. We had to sit at the far west end of the restaurant patio to avoid the smoke blowing over from the bar patio. So apparently we must risk lung cancer to get the discounts. Because of that I won't go back. I experienced breathing problems when we sat inside the restaurant a few months ago so that is not an option. Why can't anyone get the discounts even if they are not in the bar or bar patio? Isn't that discrimination? Parking is always horrible there too.

bg7rn3qdFi_IaHcYDIJHEg.text: Get their special magaritas. And the free bean dip is amazing...  This is my new favorite local joint. As for food not the greatest if you are looking for authentic mexican. And it is not spicy at all....  But this is my new spot. Dibbs.

1fUW_IJrfN3ZXxWy2KNuWg.text: I have been going here with my family for years but lately we avoid this place. During our most recent visit to this location, the salsa was very watered down and the fajitas definitely weren't as good as they used to be. There was less chicken which seemed to be substituted with more onions and bell peppers. In addition, it took a while for the waitress to greet us and take our drink order. She was not very friendly and we seemed like an inconvenience to her. Thank you for the great food and service in the past but we will be going elsewhere until this place is turned around.

YneVs1-hQVSi59wBTCMvJw.text: Great homestyle Mexican food. If you like heat, order the pedazos, which are actually considered an appetizer but the serving is so big it can easily be shared. It's this delicious pulled beef/chile combo stuffed inside a giant,  cheesy quesadilla. Heaven. Eat it with the mexicali relish and it's game over. Its the only thing I order. Love the bean dip and chips, too.   Service can be a little hectic,  but I've seen most of the waitstaff always just hustling and bustling all around so I think that's why, and I'm fair when taking that into account. Maybe add some staff to take the pressure off? Wait times suck during peak hours (Friday night, for example.)  It's certainly not gourmet but it hits *the* spot when you get that naughty-bad-for-you-good-for-the-soul-craving for Mexican food.

UML1vO4WRYifZPZ95-OfOg.text: Valle Luna has been our choice for Mexican food for years. Today was the one and only time they disappointed us.  They have added a new menu and when the waiter asked me if I wanted grilled or shredded chicken.  The waiter said grilled is better so I said ok    Without telling me that it was two dollars extra  Just to grill. The point is I felt like I was being taken advantage of for more money. It's not the money it's that telling someone is the right thing. The burrito bowl was so and for the price it's mostly lettuce

z_6Q7gAohA7qZ-tcZ8gVGw.text: I went for dinner after not having visited for over a year. I recalled why I stopped going. The chips were burned and I had to ask to have them replaced. They stopped giving bean dip with the chips. And when I got my food it was lukewarm and tasted like fast food. I used to like this place 20 years ago but it is not the same now. Will not be going back unless it is for happy hour.

vHbNBrukj0wjn5HU4o59gg.text: Their $5 margaritas are always the perfect start to any night out!   Service and cleanliness definitely leaves room for improvement. The bartender we has wasn't very friendly and engaging, and the surrounding tables were filled with crumbs from the chips and salsa. So this isn't exactly where I would spend a good portion of my night, but staying for one or two drinks was fine.

t4bhlWkAqrjjbXTw_3ZvUQ.text: I really like their spanish rice and chicken tacos. The salsa is good. The view of the lake is nice. We've always had good service here. The biggest negative is the decor. It could really use some updating. The colors, the dusty tiles...it looks very 80s. I wish they could clear it out and redo with a more modern, simple style.

ZGODPiV-3WpC9jKgYgZfHQ.text: Me and my girlfriend love this place. Much better than the other local chains. Its a pretty nice atmosphere and all ages seem to go here. One of our favorite places to eat.

mwecTksxwAy8bKjDD_-wSg.text: it's a winner.  make sure you sit outside on the lake and order the mini taco basket split between 2 people.  free chips, salsa and bean dip are plenty especially along with the ritas on the rocks.  it's also a kick azz happy hour because the apps are half-off.  the food is cheap and super good.  don't try and walk around the lake though.  it doesn't connect up in a full circle.  and don't swim in that sh*t either.  just eat the good food at valle luna:-)

jUEcg0fexmo6bTsmMJKqnQ.text: I wouldn't typically to go that kind of restaurant for a mexican food ( I look for hole-in-the-wall type of mexican restaurants), but because I was with a big family who was craving for a mexican dish, I found this place in my area (Southeast Valley). My grannies were thrilled to see the 2 for 1 deal for senior citizens-the place was flooded with happy 'n' stomach-crammed senior citizens-we were waiting for them to leave and tables to clear up. I can understand some of the bad reviews, but the restaurant has been there forever, since I was born, and it's good enough for a big group who aren't very picky about Mexican food. A neutral place in hope to satisfy everyone in the group as there are alot of selections on the menu. I was lucky to have had an amazing vegetarian tamale called "Tamale Dinner" (with green chili corns), and apparently, it's one of their specials. I finished the whole plate-the rice and beans were delicious, and I was surprised to leave without an upset stomach (mexican food=be ready for a screwed up digestion function). I wish we sat outside as there is a nice terrace with a man-made lake view.

FUWTK5AQFLxQD3no1znxDA.text: My husband and I recently took out-of-town visitors to Valle Luna based on our past experience of it being a great local spot with great food, but I doubt we will return after our newest experience. We arrived just prior to the evening rush, and were quite surprised by the staff's lack of prioritization skills as we sat in the entry at least 15 minutes while others who arrived after us requiring seating for 5 were seated before us. When we inquired about this, the hostess proceeded to seat us near the smelly restroom, with other suitable booths in plain sight. Unfortunately, the odor overshadowed any quality of food that may have been there. Needless to say, my husband and I were mortified by the staff's haphazard treatment, especially since we had recommended the restaurant so highly to our guests. Valle Luna used to be our favorite local spot, but I doubt it will be on our short list of preferred places to go the next time we are asked to recommend a restaurant. We are very disappointed since that evening was to be the last get together before one of our guests deploys to Afghanistan.

i10EK-R-HcEsJq7S4aZkCg.text: Tried this out because of the rave reviews.  Not what I was looking for and we won't be back.  If you want Americanized Mexican food with many fried things or drowning in cheese you will like it here.  There was a ton of cheese on the salads (iceberg lettuce), twice as much as other places that do lots of cheese.  Got the shrimp stuffed poblano chiles - pepper had nice flavor and shrimp plentiful and nicely cooked but again a ton of cheese that overpowered the dish and could not taste or see other ingredients.  No lime crime sauce - maybe cheese buried it or it was forgotten.  Friend got chile rellano - it was ok but nothing special and again lots of cheese.   The meals could have been much better with small changes (use Mexican cheese not American cheeses), don't drown things in cheese (covering up a dish not that good?).

DZ088SxXCJQBB8XLqTIokQ.text: First time at Valle Luna happy hour! Lake view amazing! Excellent choice!!! Drinks and food, awesome!! Thank you Esteban for the great service!

z2YTweEg_FFmIAX0cu6-Nw.text: Never a disappointment at Valle Luna. Great food and great atmosphere. Bean dip and salsa are absolutely delicious and the margaritas are even better. Never had a meal there I didn't enjoy.

mvH-5ilRmP4I5T79N5imyA.text: One of my favorite places to eat! They're usually super busy but for good reason. They have awesome happy hour deals and dishes in general! My favorites are the wings, quesadilla, cheese crisps & the FISH TACOS!!! Ugh to die for! Love this place! The staff is also friendly.

kUe1LaD6-h_b1eHk9nCOwQ.text: Poor service, food not that tasty, the best thing they had available was my coke and margarita. It is a cute restaurant but did not meet my expectations at all. They need to go on restaurant impossible ...

qUAhOEl2cMDrYqP7iNd-Lw.text: This has become our go to spot for a couple drinks and some wings. Happy hour is great and I love their wings. I've been there about 15 times now in the last year and have always had good service even when they are super busy. My wife gets the taco basket and she is always happy. She has also got the fandito a couple times and it's really really good. I recommend  Valle luna fo sho

Vv9pIvbzlh7Al7Xt3oGZLQ.text: The best Mexican food that money can buy. I especially like the machaca beef burrito with rice and black beans.  The green chili burrito is excellent too.  The service is excellent as well as the salsa and chips.

XHn7tT8PDYy-SuW3JL0KMw.text: Food was good. Service was lacking. Our drinks didn't come for at least 20 min+ and could not find our waiter when needed. Views were nice of the lake and atmosphere was nice.

mOyBsY8OKa55GAXhMU9SpA.text: Ate here with my wife and sister.  I'm a big fan of Mexican restaurants, and this place did not disappoint. The chips were served with bean dip and salsa, both of which were good. They stayed on top of refills as well.  Ordered the house margarita on the rocks, which was also delicious. Very strong as well, be careful!  I had the chicken Chimichanga which was delicious and a generous portion... it was so large but also delicious that I was still full when dinner rolled around the next evening...  I also enjoyed the nice lake view. Was not able to sit next to it but added to the atmosphere. Overall would recommend and return.

OGjyTC2pZa1SqvN47fbG9A.text: We found our recent dining experience to be most excellent.  The food portions are huge - I could enjoy seeing some smaller meal choices for a less expensive price.  In my opinion, the best value on the menu is the Pollo Sandwich - if you like chicken.  It is easily enough for two people.  I had cheese enchiladas, which were very good, but a bit too cheesy and needed more sauce.  Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant.  I hope to have room next time to try some delicious fried ice cream.  Yum!

hGu5Lbl3lqJsLHcG7aGTxA.text: Had 2 ground beef taco platter with rice & black beans, never got the beans, rice was dry and the amount of ground beef fill was a joke. No brainer why they're fighting Prop 206...never again, never again

oCBbkY58pOuRiCwMImQ4eg.text: We have eaten here many times before but this time we ordered the taco baskets.  My wife bit into one of the tacos and bit into a 3" wood stick. She called and spoke to the Manager to explained what happened and all the Manager could say is that they use them to cook the meat and they should have taken it out. She didn't even offer to comp the meal. Be careful and check your tacos before you bite into them because you could choke or lose a tooth. See attached photo of stick.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Stick found in the beef taco basket. BEWARE AND CHECK BEFORE BITING INTO THEM.

vVm-gZFyapYF4mUUfsnb4g.text: 4 friends enjoying mexican.  We walked in around 8 o'clock on a Friday night and had no problem getting a table outside.  At first glance, I prob. wouldn't have eaten here.  It was in a strip mall, and really not appealing from the outside.  There was a glow of the red light reading Valle Luna, and neon writing on the glass windows advertisiting the specials and NFL ticket (it's not football season).    Anyway, we had good service and the food was great.  Pros: I loved the chips, salsa, and black bean/refried bean dip they gave us for an app.    The portions were HUGE!  I suggest splitting or come prepared to take home.    Outdoor seating  Neat canopy like booths and tables inside, transporting you to another place  $20 off $60 coupon  Fajitas were able to come with two different meats for no additional charge  All food was really hot (temp wise).  Cons: One of the frozen margaritas came out not blended.  The fruit was on the bottom, still whole, and the ice and booze was taking up the top of the glass.  Our waitress, Jenni, had no problem bringing a beer in place of the unsatisfactory drink.

eyKHC40T5aXlTEraJoAm2A.text: Not bad food, but the frozen margaritas are really good.  It may have just been what I ordered (shredded beef tacos) but they could back of on the salt!   All in all, I will go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

Qi3_DEDihAO5aZB82tJAuA.text: Just went in for the first time and had the Fundido! It was so good, definitely the best I've ever had. I would have given 5 stars but the servers weren't particularly friendly or attentive.

NWjinjNCTfpwfsJEyNX6aQ.text: We drove about 30 minutes to have dinner here and should have saved the fuel. This spot was a favorite for my wife's family growing up. It took about 45 minutes to get our meal. On arrival my order was incorrect. The children's plates were excessively hot-not sure why you would hand a 4 year old a plate they could burn them self on?!  The servers were friendly and apologetic of the length of time it took. Overall, the food wasn't worth the drive. We will find a new local favorite for our family that is closer to where we live and that tastes better.

SYygb34oQMFvTDJFTC5kQA.text: Good tacos and price but it was missing a little more variety and parking isn't the best. Good margs

Sz7Z1KZ42LkcKXXCh0i2Wg.text: Good margaritas and the patio is nice most of the year. The complimentary bean dip is awesome but for the most part the food is fair. My go-to dishes here are the pollo fundito or fish tacos, they have whole pinto beans as a side and they are amazing. Service is hit or miss, the buy one get one coupon in the circular is a bonus!

VE140U17Bl0yvIfvZ3-x3Q.text: I absolutely LOVE this restaurant!  Their food is great with huge portions and LOW prices!  We delayed heading back to TX (where we have MANY) wonderful Mexican restaurants) just so we go eat lunch before leaving!!  Can't wait to come back to the Phoenix area so we can eat here again! Tuesdays they have a BOGO for seniors, in case you are interested. (3-10PM)

CvfZm7NOg1H3T9a8MyAmVQ.text: Best Mexican food in the state. I've been a fan since 1989.

0RWqyq_dS8FR9tOucGBWMA.text: I haven't had a chance to go to Valle Luna for a while. I was wanting their pollo fundido when I got off work tonight. I always thought, and have told many people they have the best food. Me and my family have been going there for a long time. Unfortunately I was so disappointed tonight.  It was so dry and burnt. I won't be going back. Bummer.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Burnt pollo fundido
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. I couldn&#39;t eat this

CmM6AUBDNmFOAX2SpMtSbw.text: What I thought would be an enjoyable meal for my dads 62nd birthday turned out to be the opposite. Upon arriving we had to wait 30 minutes to only be seated at a table that had currently been available the whole time we waited. Once we were sat we were told to not mind the "Do not slip" signs because the ceiling was dripping. As we sat liquid kept dripping on us! We asked to be moved and were told there was no other seating available. We got up and left, so disgusting! If you want a nice meal without having to worry about the ceiling dripping on you and expecting the staff to care then do not eat here!!

2FR5vcyNNkeJF6xcm0508A.text: If you are looking for real Authentic Mexican food do not come here. Food had no flavor. My friend and I ordered the same rice and refried beans for sides, mine came with cheese hers didn't. Michelada was basically just beer and a splash of Clamato. Friend asked for lemon three times before they actually brought it to her.   Point blank will not be returning!

t-Z2LASAq6CCqJ6MioS9HQ.text: Very interesting, and surprising. You go to a shopping mall and go to the corner. You going to the restaurant and as you walk out the back you are transformed into a nice Mexican lagoon. It may just be a pond across from a condominium complex but it really gives you the feel that you are sitting outside drinking margaritas with a palm tree over your head with good Mexican food. they said us out on the patio and it was amazing because we had no idea that the restaurant had been split in half and the bar and seeding is on the left, and the restaurant is on the right. The restaurant was very quiet and very nice to sit and have a relaxing drink and eat your food. But, the bar was jumping. And I would have much rather sat on that side because it was like a big Cinco de Mayo party and everyone was having a good time and I think it was on a Thursday we were there. If we go back? We're going to sit on the bar side for sure. So I won't leave a tip but I will tell you pick the bar side the music's fun that people are fun and the drinks are flowing. but remember when you leave the place you are in the middle of the city and you are leaving a shopping mall drive carefully.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Look up and relax

SqkxFLg4dz4zKifFHC9sBQ.text: It sucks I had to rate this a 2! The food was great BUT the restaurant was so hot we were uncomfortable before the food even got to the table. By time we did receive the food we needed to leave because our 4month old son was soaked from sweating so much. Also I know not everyone has children BUT the changing table was disgusting. All it takes is a little cleaner a rag and some TLC and it would be clean! It really is a shame for the restaurant being as busy as it feel like a sauna inside.

vYHg3JYqu7BVLPZ87RNAtw.text: I felt like having traditional Mexican food and this is it! We have been coming here for years. A local favorite in Chandler.   You start with fresh chips and salsa brought to the table (they used to serve a bean dip as well, but not anymore).The salsa is thick and chunky. All of the house favorites are amazing. I had the chimichanga dinner with red chili in the chimi. So good! It is served with rice and beans, sour cream and guac! Wow! I washed it all down with a refreshing Frozen sangria margarita! Perfect way to start the weekend and end a hectic week.  The kids are not big fans of Mexican food and that is okay. They have burgers, fries, mini ni I corn dogs and chicken fingers for the non-Mexican eater. Only problem, small kids portions so make sure you order a quesadilla app or extra chips and salsa to keep them satisfied.  If you are interested in outside seating and the weather is nice, this is a great place! The outside patio has a view of a local Lake and water fountains. It is calm and peaceful, perfect for date night or just a quick Escape.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chimichangas dinner...wow!
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sangria Margarita frozen with salt...perfect ending to a busy week!!!

YsShWD6RFg4L4OXovtyxeA.text: Food is decent but the service is not good    Waited in the bar a good 10 minutes before we were even acknowledged. Location and decor is nice

5psfjpeU8bvPxSHOF67C_Q.text: Great food and service! Our waitress  Krisann very nice attentive personable and awesome service! Ask for her table!

EGx2IdAK1htsSY0RlqdzpA.text: Very, very disappointed with the service as well as the quality of food. My husband and I went in for lunch I ordered Albondigas which were extremely salty and we ordered a cheese crisp with machaca meat on it.  We received salty shredded beef over unmelted cheese. The waitress took forever to bring out our drinks,  never came back to check on us and when it was time to pay she forgot to bring us our tab with our credit card. She was not busy and not once did she apologize for leaving us outside waiting.  Once again very disappointed.

YKd-lRfPtSk-Y8P03aVVYg.text: I really hate doing this, but I'm doing so in hopes that Management reads it. I would have rather spoken to one in person and not yelped it, but our server Brian would not get the Manager. I have been coming to Valle Luna for over 20 years and the Chandler location has always been my favorite. Their Pollo Fundito is usually made to perfection. I've honestly probably consumed at least 300 of them. I like them so much, my wife is now hooked on them, and we have been coming here at least 3 times a month. As noted in my previous review, its almost always a 5 star experience. Our last visit was on Tuesday July 17th around noon. Brian was our server.   My wife and I ordered our usual meal, 2 pollo funditios and a kids cheese crisp for our toddler. When the meals came, I immediately noticed that my funditio did not look right. It was somewhat flat and not fried all the way. My wife's looked great. Side by side, the two looked like completely different meals. When I took the first bite, I confirmed my suspicion that the fundito was not fried well at all. It was soggy and like a raw tortilla. Furthermore, there was almost zero cream cheese in it, and very little chicken. My wife's was fried to perfection, but had way too much cream cheese in and very little chicken. I dont normally complain, but for a dish costing in the $15 range, I expect at least borderline consistency and quality.   I had only taken 2 bites of the meal and then sat for 15 minutes waiting for a server or manager to come by. Brian eventually came by and dropped off the check. When he asked if we enjoyed the meal, I began to explain the issue I had. Before I could get two words out of my mouth, Brian said that my Fundito did not look right, and that he was surprised because Valle Luna takes so much pride in that particular dish. I agreed with him and said it just wasn't up to par... and the worst one I have had in 20 years. I kindly gave him my debit card and felt relieved a bit that I was able to voice my issue. Brian came back a couple minutes later, tossed the receipt on the table and disappeared. Nothing was taken off the bill. Not even an offer to have the Manager come by.   I hoping it was just a hiccup. However, this place has rightfully earned a great reputation in the valley, and service like what we experienced will ruin decades of great food and service in a matter of months, and that would be a shame. For the record, had a Manager come by the table or a new meal been provided, I would have happily paid full price for everything. Unfortunately neither was offered.

wAuNkGRqZiQFn-UqFAC1Bw.text: One of our favorite places to eat.  Margaritas on Monday $.99 for a small one.  Really good.

DpdhyvV2ArDBv6_bDp3HGQ.text: My wife and I came here late last night.  The service was great, our waitress was really fun.  I love it when you can tell the wait staff loves their job, makes a huge difference, kudos to her.    My wife ordered the Spinach Enchilada plate.  She said it was interesting because it was more like Spinach Queso Enchilada.  She really enjoyed it.  I ordered the Fundito with Pollo.  Whoa, it was amazing.  The Chicken was seasoned well, it was a very large meal.  I didn't even come close to finishing it.    We are definitely going to come back, next time we want to try the Cantina!

PkSFDaT-zGUjXZHx49X3cg.text: Went there with a couple colleagues for a lunch celebration and had a not so pleasant experience. To begin with, it was not busy but, the seating process took quite a while. Why does it always smell like a restroom when you walk in the building, also? Then, we were seated and it took 15 minutes to get drink orders. We made our orders and told our waitress we had two birthdays the day we went. She didn't acknowledge us. We waited 40 minutes for lukewarm food. It was the burrito bowl and it looked like it was last night's food reheated. The black beans did not look "authentic", but rather straight out of the can and set under the warmer. It I had a spoonful of chicken in the whole thing. It was awful. Never once after we received our meals were we checked on for refills or any other necessities. There was plenty of staff running around but, I'm not sure where they were running to. This was so disappointing as many people have said great things about their food. This was a lackluster experience and tasteless Mexican plate. I won't be giving it a chance again anytime soon. Oh! And you can't even find a place to park without circling about 20 times.

AD1tYRxnh5gD4AustE1XbA.text: Love this Mexican restaurant. Not often I give 5 stars to a local restaurant with multiple locations but I tried them all and the food is always excellent alt all locations. I get the enchiladas with chicken and beef. Always excellent and love the rice and beans with it. Much better food than any of the large chain Mexican restaurants.

Xksi6yapVT72gz9xTIN7mA.text: We went to Valle Luna today. I'm always hesitant to try new Mexican places because nothing can stack up next to Barrio Queen. I have to say, it was pretty good. I like white queso better than yellow but their queso con chorizo, which is yellow, is actually pretty good. I had steak fajitas which were very tasty. They have tons of gluten friendly options, which was great for my daughter and I. We loved the lake view, next time, when it's not 106 degrees out, we will have to sit on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

hHnsp0XketTQGmavX0j2Rg.text: Darcie and I dropped by around noon on a Sunday, or what Valle Luna calls Sunday Funday... and it was. We are def going back, and we are excited about it. {Tacos}  Funday happens in the Bar area. Brace for flavor impact: you are entering the awesomely affordable and incredibly delicious zone. Awesome Tomas, the bartender, was welcoming & friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. It's been a week and my mind is still dwelling on.. the tacos. Dude slings cold beer, wine, and eye-openningly tasty salsa and food. {Tacos, tacos}  Call me simple (you wouldn't be the first), but if your Mexican joint has subpar Taco- or Salsa-game... it's a hard pass for me. Fortunately, that's no concern here. {Tacos}  Valle Luna has stellar tacos and salsa. Grab a telescope. Point it to the Heavens and on a clear night you will see them up there. Alternately, just drop by Valle Lune and behold the bounty. Even their mini tacos are substantial. The regular salsa is very tasty, and their hot salsa has a memorably flavorful zing. Holy moley I'm in love with this place. {Tacos... em-effin tacos}  We also got the Bandito Burritos (mini bean burros, deep fried) and a cheese crisp. They were OK. The cheese crisp was more chewy than crisp and I could have done without the deep frying of the little burros. But I was on such a stratospheric high from the A-M-A-Z-I-N-G TACOS that my review is getting all wrapped up in 5-STARS for me. {Oh, the Tacos}  Throughout this review I have liberally strewn a consistent subliminal message that should prep you for your Valle Luna culinary adventure. {T-A-C-O-S}  I envy you the fresh discovery. {haunting whisper... tacos}  Big Thanks to Jesse for getting me Tomas' name. Credit where credit is due baby!

ds76uBe6G4cBm2Z0TiYxFg.text: Tried the "new" sea bass and honestly disappointed.  Needed much more sauce and the presentation was awful: flipped over.  What!!! ## waited nearly 25 minutes for this.   Stick to tacos. Service not attentive bit worried about checking in with us.

8YGk2_xHvc9hvdZPspHBeg.text: Wow!!! What happened to this place?! I had my wedding rehearsal dinner here years ago because it was amazing! Not now though. The quality of food and service is horrible. They need to renovate completely. New everything! I'm sorry but i have been coming here since I was a kid, I'm 38. It's gone so downhill. I'm sad for this fact.

PI77Getlj-wWj-9bJKyH3A.text: I really enjoy the food here, that's what keeps bringing me back- unfortunately the service just isn't the best. I'm someone who has been (and is still currently) serving for 10years and the servers here just don't have it. The greet is boring, no enthusiasm.. my drinks (even water) ALWAYS take forever... I'm really not trying to sound like "one of those" people and I typically wouldn't write a poor review on a place- but this is a constant thing I have dealt with coming to this location. I will continue to come here because the food is great- but the service could definitely use some improvement.

L1xcImtpVJPynwvNu6fhVg.text: Best bartender great food great people great vibes valle is my number one choose for food and drinks!!

yWn8SGmyT-GxzEkKa7OtRw.text: My daughter, grandchildren and I went to dinner last night here.  115 degrees in AZ. Danielle was our server and she is absolutely fantastic. She is friendly, professional and kept up on our refills. I enjoy seeing her as she always has a smile on her face. Food was great.  Fresh and hot. Absolutely delicious. The reason I am giving only 4 stars is because the AC wasn't working. My home AC was out so I was hoping to enjoy dinner in a cold restaurant and when we sat down it was muggy humid and hot. I asked Danielle what the issue was and she said they were working on it earlier but didn't know what the problem is. I think these restaurants especially in the heat of the summer need to make sure that they service  their air-conditioning units and keep the restaurant cold and comfortable. That's the main reason why people go to restaurants in the hot summer is because it's so darn hot and we want to be in a cold environment.  Restaurant itself with food and service deserves 5 stars.

Sggi57XUYVaUcSNBgB0J7g.text: In December, would have given them 5 stars for happy hour.  In January they doubled their prices and stopped the bean dip.  We had been going weekly and now not at all. The drinks are watered down and the quality has plummeted while the prices rise. So sad. We have been going here for 10 years.

JJRQVPV3FtSXg9PBLPOZlg.text: Valle Luna is a reasonably reliable Mexican restaurant.  Nothing spectacular, but reliable.  The food is pretty good, the menu has a good variety of "classics" (burros, chimis, fundido, etc), the chips and salsa are fine.  Nothing spectacular.   Service is reasonable, and the prices aren't bad (especially if you get a coupon which shows up sometimes in those coupon clipper magazines).  Obviously I'm not raving about this place.  I would put it on par with Garcia's or Serrano's.  Not great, but not bad.  Nowhere near the level of someplace like La Tolteca.  But it was closer, I have limited time for lunch, and I had a coupon.  One thing I will say is they support youth athletic programs.  They have numerous plaques displayed of the various teams they have supported.  Girls' soccer, boys' baseball, etc.  A LOT of plaques.  It's cool that Valle Luna takes an interest in their community like that.  Many places don't.  Has nothing to do with the quality of the food, but when choosing between comparable restaurants like Garcia's and Serrano's, I think it is nice to know I am helping support such things with my patronage of the restaurant.

NKcgsK9TD6IrczYBfjT-6Q.text: Love the patio. Great service and good food..We Had A Large Party and They Were Very attentibe

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

UrOVY8UAXDSAKVzJnlmYUw.text: While this place is kinda pricey they're queso fundido is amazing!!!  The wife and I love the amount of cheesy goodness they put on all their food.  The rice, beans, and service was perfect.  Wish you guys would put one down here in Tucson since I'd frequent it all the time!

R7R8siKn8RHVSY2i_lBkfg.text: This place has an awesome atmosphere great music in the bar area big flat screen tvs with all sports good cold drinks and amazing hot food

5Pcal5HsPbWFC66hjrW8vw.text: This was our favorite neighborhood spot.   Was. The last two times our service has been so terrible it is unbearable. Over thirty minutes to have our order taken. Longer for drinks to be delivered. And a very annoyed condescending server when we asked questions.   There are many places nearby that would be better. We will not be back. So sad to see this place slide into decline.

LDhBQ95hC_cTW1oIDqquuA.text: One of our favorite places. Such a great happy hour and patio. This may seem weird but they have the BEST wings ever. I don't usually eat wings but I can't get enough of the hot grilled ones from them.   Tomas is awesome and always has great suggestions. The rest of the staff is amazing also. I could go on and on but seriously try the wings or fajitas and wash it down with a margarita on the rocks.   The cantina and patio are where it's at. Also don't forget to try the wings.

4-gFbNssuJFDAEIgGf7siQ.text: This restaurant has THE best food. I got hooked on their Mexican pizza awhile back and now have a real addition. Their dips are amazing as well. Would highly recommend this restaurant!!

SYRLcqbtXj7V6MG8W5NMVA.text: Great local spot for some happy hour and food to keep you functioning enough to keep throwing back brews. They have this awesome drink called the dogma which isn't for the faint of heart that sets the tone every time I stop by that I always introduce to newcomers. The bar staff is always friendly and quick and the chips and salsa always on point.

Q6HODy72skC8u_RbU5JTBQ.text: Big Fan. . .   I have been here numerous times throughout the years and can't believe i never wrote a review sooner.  I love this place.  This location is excellent.  It sits right on the water so when the weather is nice the patio seating cannot be beat.   Every time I have been here the service is always excellent.     The food is great.  I usually order the Machaca Burro De la Casa with rice a beans and each time I am left satisfied.  Also just in case you prefer Black beans instead of Pinto or Re-fried.  Those are very good as well and have become my preferred choice of late.    For me personally this is one of the better Mexican Restaurants in the area and I would much rather drive here then each at Nandos which is closer to my home.    The only downside for others who have been here in past years. . They used to offer you bean dip with your chips and salsa, but not anymore.  Now they will charge you $4.00 as if its an appetizer dish and while it is good, for me it isn't' worth it.   Other than that, enjoy the food and the view.

GuP-GSCx6RfVgdQNxHNH4g.text: Normally when my husband and I visit Valle Luna we split an order of the fajitas and order the queso dip. Last night we had a buy one get one free coupon so we got separate orders.  They were pretty much was the same thing except I got the smothered burrito and he got the enchiladas. I thought that the meat was a little spicy for me but I still ate it. The burrito skin was not warm at all and it was pretty dry. My husbands enchiladas looked better than my dish!  Also I ordered guacamole with mine-$2.50!   I'm sure we'll come back, but next time I'm ordering the fajitas and queso dip!!!

oSIhJNTeydA2Daavbn-QMg.text: Not very impressed. I've been to the Valle Luna in the West Valley several times and thought it was good, so I finally went to the East Valley location. When I am rating a Mexican food restaurant always base it on chips, tacos, and enchiladas. First, the chips tasted over done. Second, the tacos were fairly tasteless and fell apart because the shell was drenched. Third, the enchiladas has black olives. I'm an Arizona native and have had Mexican food a couple of times and I don't recall of many places putting olives in their enchiladas.   In the end I may go back, but it won't be for a while.

0BXRttrJWmkQX1G4MJ3ubw.text: I'm torn about this place. Beautiful patio, great food and drinks, and even better prices. But in the years I've been going, I have only had one positive experience with the service and server's name is Brittany. If she isn't serving me, I have a server who clearly doesn't want to be there or serve me. I'm having to wave them down to even get my water refilled and not treated like a guest when they are at the table. I don't want to stop coming here, but I also don't know if it's worth it.

1R-F9vEx70NcHAb5sBvCgA.text: I love the Fundido and the chips and salsa are really good.  The Mexican pizza with jalapeno cream cheese is a great appetizer, they have an interesting variety of delicious margaritas, and the atmosphere in the cantina is subtly lively, if that makes any sense.  The staff is very friendly in the restaurant, but the service at the bar is hit or miss.

UPh0u4lTwqD9oCpVM__nbg.text: I have experienced the best of Valle Luna in 3 very different settings; the typical dinner dining, happy hour, and special event.  Those situations get 4, 3 and 5 stars respectively which averages out to a solid 4-stars.  The food has been consistent all around.  It's much better than the Mexican drive-thru's, not quite as good as Globe food, but pleasing with no surprises around any corners.    Happy hour and the dining room have completely different atmospheres and service.  The dining room was a typical Mexican food restaurant feel, with decent service. It was quiet and the tall booths make it easy to forget about other tables nearby.  The bar (the only place you can get happy hour deals) is loud, crowded, hectic and has had questionable service.  Not horrendous, but I think the servers are stretched too thin.  Getting refills on drinks that come with free refills seems to be a recurring issue... getting a second beer or margarita is not.  The happy hour appetizer menu is hefty enough to serve as dinner, which makes for a good cheap meal!  I'll put up with the bar environment for 3 tacos for $4.  I cannot say enough good things about the private event I attended here...the disclaimer is that I didn't organize it, so I don't know how the back end was.  My future in-laws planned our rehearsal dinner the night before our wedding, and Valle Luna proved to be a perfect venue.  We were out on the patio, right on the water.  It was mid-April so the weather was perfect. The set-up was functional.  Everybody loved the food.  All props to the decorating go to my mother in-law, but Valle Luna was on top of their game with service, ID'ing the appropriate parties, and making the whole event appear seamless to the nervous bride.

8lpDjpe0wYCLyL3isoZmIg.text: This is a Mexican food restaurant that seems very popular with the Chandler crowd. It serves tacos, burritos, quesadillas, nachos and other typical selections that Americans have come to believe originated south of our border. The food tastes good, but then again, I'm a sucker for most things covered in sour cream and cheese. It's definitely a step closer to legit Mexican food than some other places, but there's really not much here that you can't get anywhere else.  I will give a thumbs up on the happy hour. Great deals on appetizers and drinks make it worth the stop if you're in the area. Give it a look see.

iy-G9mBeCk6zMAzo5B_38g.text: Sunday's are awesome here. Great prices, good quality bar food. Sitting on the patio is heaven!

DhK0G0iTKBGitBwGP6daeA.text: Ate in the cantina area, my waitress Erin was amazing. She was super efficient, attentive, and sweet! Steak fundido=phenomenal. Great place.

Tui3CmUw3DgFnWeh-1Cezg.text: Valle Luna has fresh, hot food with great prices to match. I enjoy any combination plate for lunch or dinner, and those fajitas could fill an army! Our waitress was very knowledgeable and attentive once she served us, but the team could work on cooperation. We sat in the bar for over 6 minutes without anyone speaking to us, though I made eye contact and smiled at 4 different employees before being greeted. We will visit this location again, and enjoy a nice evening out on the patio.

lcAKRQOA2eRWq_CX23kPoA.text: Guess what? These guys serve Chili Relleno. Was craving for this dish since ages and here in finally.  Obviously ordered Chili Relleno. Met my expectations to be True. The cheese and the spice levels were right on. Lunch special was just $9.50 with rice and beans. This is the best lunch deal for the quantity they serve you.  Ambience is great and they have a lake view if you are that kinda person. Service was quick and food was fresh. Would rate this place a 4.5. Chili Relleno is a must try.

fLIy6csw0FlQ1TnIr0I6mw.text: 1st time here I came for the view and I love A Mexican Breakfast, well outside looks like a grocery store, host was friendly but our waitress wasn't right off the back. She came to us and asked my husband if he wanted a Bloody Mary! Um does he look hungover! He said no thank you what kind of soda's do you have and She had to think and said Pepsi products but couldn't name any other then Pepsi. He said 2 Pepsi's please and she actually made a face and rolled her eyes and gave him a dirty look for not ordering alcohol I guess.  Packed parking lot, you will have a little walk. Dirty Menu's, dirty seats, dirty window ledge with straw wrappers and the green thing that they wrap utensils with and bugs.... Flying bugs. dirty table. Just plain dirty everywhere.  It was 11am, it was 90 out and the shades where down with at least 20 dead flying bugs of all sizes so I asked our waitress if we could open the blinds, she said she has to find the manager came back and said he said we can't open blinds because it's to hot out. Um we were at the end in a corner outside was Palm Tress that provided shade and the Patio provided shad no sun in sight. WHAT HAPPENED TO CUSTOMER SERVICE. Even Denny's will open the blinds for their customers. I Guess  CUSTOMERS DON'T MATTER! You would think with so many BAD Yelp reviews mainly on the rude staff they might want to change. So we had to sit there in between a dirty wall and a filty bug infested shade. Just DISGUSTING!!  They cater to those who drink, I saw other waitresses literally run to help those who sat in Bar area.  We weren't asked if we've been there before, we  weren't asked if we wanted to sit Bar or Patio.  1st Pepsi came out Syrupy 2nd Pepsi was watery. How do you mess up Soda?  Now the food! Me being Spanish I make Spanish Rice weekly and I know packaged flavoring when I taste it. They should take the fake Rice off the Menu. Beans, well you can't mess those up, I like all beans even canned. Yeas I'm a Beaner.. No complaints on the Chips and Salsa seeing that most of the workers are not of Spanish decent so I figured it wouldn't be spicy and it wasn't  I got the Sonoran Enchilada they should change the name to Sonoran Sopes. It is not with Corn Tortilla it is with Sopes which is very thick. It needed WAY more cheese and a thinner sauce. The dry old Olives ruined it and I love Olives, but it was okay, it will get you full you should try it if your really hungry. The hubby got The Lunatic which is a Potato Pancake. I like his a little better good sauce. The Potato tasted like they mixed it with gravy which that I didn't like.  My advise is if you want to see the view sit in the Patio.  I will give this place another try and sit in Patio area it was my experience that was bad not really the food, come with an opened mind and don't expect to much, lower your standards maybe you'll be surprised.

WmsCYy7VJmRQHGhgsGNs_g.text: Average Mexican food. The outdoor sitting area next to the water is nice, but other than that the owners/management are far from professional.  Have been eating here for many years (next to our house). Catered food for an event and it was all very dry and unflavorful. The owners response was to my feedback was very unprofessional. Will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Green Corn Tamale (with enchilada sauce), black beans, Spanish rice, green enchilada casserole, salsa

ThVsyfO0lpR6b7rrOMvgqQ.text: Ay dios mio! Valle Luna has been a favorite of mine for the 10+ years I've lived in the valley. This place is classic Mexican dining.  Our most recent visit, we ordered the #4 combo with shredded beef-pork tamale, taco, whole beans w/rice and the asada taco dinner with refried beans. You can also order black beans here which I appreciate.  Now idk if it's the rebel in me, but anytime a waiter/waitress brings my plate and heeds the standard "this plate is very hot" warning, the first thing I do is touch the plate! What's hot to you?? This is one of those places where the plate is HOT! Our food is always fresh, even with larger groups, here.  We also like to frequent this location for the Happy Hour specials. Their house margaritas on the rocks are one of my favorites and the appetizer deals are too good to pass up. We enjoy the mini taco basket w/shredded beef or chicken, mini chimis, cheese crips, Mexican pizza with jalapeno cream cheese... so many options to choose from!  It's also worth saving room for fried ice cream with strawberries or chocolate.. drool!  There's a great view if you sit near the window or on the patio and plenty of parking, although you'd be surprised with how quickly it fills up.  I docked a star because service can sometimes be slow. This most recent visit, the napkins on our placemats looked dirty already and the menus needed a wipe down. :/ also, I miss the signature bean dip they used to serve with the chips and salsa!! BRING FREE BEAN DIP BACK!   Overall, this is a Mexican restaurant you wouldn't want to pass up trying!

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. #4 tamale and taco combo

ZbN7lzuPzAkFfgIrpoitpQ.text: Mexican food is my ABSOLUTE favorite food.. This place is SOOOO not delicious... SKIP this place if you can.. the food is bad, the service is bad, and the drinks are worse!!

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dining area

UNQaJ8keJyVd7lx2S9ep8w.text: My usual Mexican food spot was closed today. I had visited Valle Lune years and years ago and figured I would give it a try. To start, the salsa is the canned tomato kind. I'm not a huge fan of that kind or else I'd just pick it up from the grocery store. The entree I got was a taco and enchilada and the enchilada came out looking like a burrito. The taco was just a taco. My husband ordered the fundido which sounds like a chimichanga with cream cheese sauce. The jalapeno cream cheese dip was not jalapeno-y at all. Again, it's the soggy, canned jalapeno taste. The beans were too thick. Hard to dip my chips into and didn't have any amazing or specific taste. Even the Spanish rice wasn't good. Most other places, the grain is softened and flavored. The rice grain they use was harder and didn't retain much flavor. My husband loved the dollar margaritas and there were a ton of people in there!!! They have patio seating next to the lake which would probably be nice. I wouldn't visit again. Didn't do it for me at all. And price per entree for location was shockingly high. We also got the potato skins and there was just too much meat on them. The cheese was separated from the potato which also doesn't do it for me.

llRmjZu3Ph2ueb31qzis0g.text: So..... the food here is good, really good actually. The service - utterly disappointing. Slow. Uninspired. Uninterested. Did I say SLOW? We sat for over 30 minutes waiting for our order to be taken, then another 60 minutes before we got our dinner. Going through 3 baskets of chips and salsa just to assauge our hunger. If you're thinking the restaurant was crowded, you'd be wrong. Something going on for sure here, and I hope they get it fixed. No apology, no drink refills, no mention of any issues. Sad. I'd pop back in for dinner if I thought I wouldn't have to wait so long. Like I said, the food was pretty good. Just don't come hungry.

yPqxkntn3lFFW0bdZCD2Kw.text: We placed an order tonight with Valle Luna through door dash. We wanted sopapillas, but the app would not allow us to add it the way we wanted it. We called Valle Luna to ask if they could add it to our order. The hostess who answered the phone said she would get the manager. Whoever the manager is, he/she would not come to the phone. The hostess told us we could order the sopapillas  with just honey, (the way we wanted them) and come pick them up. Why would we order through door dash if we wanted to go pick anything up? We have eaten at Valle Luna and the food is good, but shortly after we ordered our food, we received a text our order had been canceled?? We ordered from Nando's through door dash and had no issues.  With so many restaurant choices, Valle Luna  won't be one we eat at again.

iloHMwYaMkbPWUCoISDpjw.text: After my dreadful experience, over a year and a half ago, at another location, I thought I was done with this long time valley chain. However, our recent experiences at their Chandler location helped me rethink my negative view.  We were meeting up with my daughter and my new son-in-law, and were at a loss as to where we could eat that was interesting. They suggested that we dine at Valle Luna. Despite my hesitation, I didn't want to downplay their selection. Hence, we agreed to meet up there.  It was a Friday evening, and the place was packed. My daughter had made reservations and opted to have us sit at the patio.  The view was quite marvelous. The restaurant faced a manmade lake with a fountain. The surroundings were quite serene and aesthetic. It was good so far.  We ordered several dishes.  They were the Enchilada combos, the Steak Fajitas, and the Sonoran Steak (their specialty). I will say that unlike my previous experiences wherein we were given food that seemed doused with chili pepper to hide the lack of flavor, these dishes (we always share as a family) were quite appetizing.   The steaks were cooked to perfection. The fajitas were spicy, but not overly so, with hearty grilled vegetables and meat. The  different enchilada sauces on the enchilada combo were appetizing, to say the least. Gone were our previous overtly spicy dishes. They were replaced with palatable dishes that were expertly prepared.  The great service we experienced was also well worth noting. Our server was prompt, and cheerful. Although it was a busy evening, he maintained his composure and cheerfulness. He didn't let us go too long before checking in on us.  To top it all off, their Flan dessert had a wonderful texture to it. The caramel was light, and not burnt.   After this marvelous experience, we have opted to return several more times for various other get-togethers with family and friends.  This place has definitely restored my faith in this long running chain.

XchukB_pTDxpuLd3ZFrmJQ.text: I believe in giving credit when credit is due.  This place is one of my favorite for fajitas in the Valley.    However, on Saturday August 17, 2019, I took an elderly friend of mine there for lunch.  We were walking through the restaurant and my friend did not see a step as there was no yellow line bringing attention to the step.  She lost her footing and fell and hit her head.  The EMTs were called as her head was bleeding.    I sincerely hope the management will take note of this.   My friend spent several hours in the ER and is requiring ongoing medical care as a result.  We were not happy with the way this situation was handled.

xs53KG0GDFhR2A0v8YhQDw.text: Fabulous service from Thomas D.!    I ordered a new adult beverage and wasn't too impressed with the watermelon margarita.  It wasn't nearly as authentic tasting as their delicious mango one.  Thomas recognized my dislike and replaced it with his suggested  prickly pear marg. Loved it!  In fact I  ordered a non alcoholic prickly pear drink for my daughter.  Thomas also let me know that customers can substitute vegetables for rice and  beans IF you want to have a healthier alternative.  Super service (even though it was one of their busiest nights of the last year) Thomas came through as a top server for us!

Cq5FH2yWRxh5_nJ-oS3m_w.text: Food was delicious and perfect portion sizes! My mom and I split the chimichanga and it was perfect for the both of us for the price of one plus they'll split the meal on two separate plates so you don't have to do it yourself. Great service and amazing food in all :)

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. We asked to split a shredded beef chimichanga and this is how much they gave each of us :) perfect size

qvabm6OHW7WBiVX4e7C_Wg.text: Two things I enjoyed as this was my first visit.  The indoor area was very family friendly,  what I mean is you can bring in the family,  and all sit together and talk comfortably and not disturb the family next to you.   The second thing I loved was the food.  They give you great portions,  and as usual I had zero self control with the chips and salsa at the beginning meal.    The only thing I'll recommend is asking for a refill before you pay your check if you want to sit and chat afterwards,  because you are dead to them the second they take payment.    No last cup of coffee for you!

RV_ClGfrN6lqjdEcTSg5MQ.text: DONT GO HERE!  This place has rude staff, and management False advertising.   All the way through the restaurant it has happy hour drink specials and food ssd's specials INCLUDING ON THE TABLES,, BUT you cant order them where they advertise.  The seating is small for a table of 6 or more and does nothing for customer satisfaction     Staff is very unprofessional and the wait time always wrong.

9hbwcdiatKUB62MJeo_L8w.text: Was craving Mexican Food and had seen their ads on tv.  Drove almost an hour to sit in a dingy table with broken plates, horrible watered down or machine made margaritas, and surly waitstaff.  But that is not what  prompted this review.    About 7 hours after eating there I became violently ill, and have been weak for 2 days...the bad stuff...where you get to know your bathroom pretty well.   2 of us had a mid afternoon dinner with 1 drink each with tacos, Sonoran enchiladas and a pork mexican pizza for a bill of 60.00.  Was not given any happy hour prices, although in their advertised time frame.  Waitstaff was so inhospitable I didn't even want to argue with them.  They never offered more salsa or chips or even asked if we wanted another drink (we didn't) So I figured at least I'd have left overs, not so, as everything  went to trash. My partner did not eat the pizza so we suspect that's what it was.  So unless you want to revisit your meal over and over and over again, then the pharmacy, do not go there.

7nguJpN6XYGTh3mK7WE6Jw.text: Nice spot In Chandler AZ, great view, near a man made lake.  Really, really good food.  I had a chicken & shrimp fajitas w/ beans and rice topped off with a excellent adult beverage
