zvgvWJ-Ci4ZynyOKg2qaZA.text: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and we were very happy with our experience this evening, frankly, very pleasantly surprised compared to prior experiences. We were quickly seated (it wasn't as busy as it had been in the past 2 or 3 visits.) Our server (Brian) was at hand quickly to take our drink orders.  We requested water with lime and inquired about beer that we would like when our meals were served. After he returned with the water, we ordered our beers. Chips and salsa were delivered to the table.  The chips were very fresh and light.  The salsa was amazing!  Just enough "kick" and very flavorful! Salsa was replenished with additional napkins. Our dinners were served in reasonable time ... Lunatic Huevos Ranchero and Grilled Chicken Fajitas. Both smelled great and tasted just as great! Eggs were perfectly done ... veggies and chicken were perfect! Brian served up our beers right after we received our food as requested.  He kept track but was not hovering.  We appreciated that! He did ask how everything was and if we needed anything.  (NOT "How's the food tastin'?") I'm pretty fussy about clean tables, utensils, etc.  Everything was fine. To be honest, this is the best experience ... best food, best service ... we have ever experienced at Valle Luna . So, whatever changes have been put in place over the past months, in our opinion, are working! We'll be back!

9JP3nNKzagPsT9zqdTTe2g.text: Absolutely lackluster flavors.  We tried 2 different burros, relenos, Chili, shrimp enchiladas. Ordered different sauces with each as well. Pico Salsa was well received because at least fresh. Chicken Burro was dry... Little cheese, ended up peeling away tortilla only to see PLAIN shred chic ..nothing else  Ate meat with Pico and left rest. We all left beans and rice few finished the main. Will NEVER RETURN. LESSON LEARNED to RESEARCH Restaurants better especially when with guests! Would not recommend at all! Only place worse is Garcia's. Service was very lackluster. There were also 3 people glued at front desk. Called good day without moving to assist me with opening the door after seeing  my immobile broken arm as we left.

My9cYqS-X6DixwH-7uEa2g.text: Terrible experience... waited for over an hour and received no food.  The waitress came over and said your food is 2 mins from coming out.  The ticket is up I just came to see if they ran it out.  They didn't!  That was at 40 mins.  The chip n salsa girl came by 15mins later and asked us if we wanted more chips.  No would like our food.  She then went and got the server who came back with another excuse.  I get it she had a big party across from us.  They had plenty of food and complaints.  At least they got their food.  Spoke to the mgr she said the cooks can't get it together back there?  What was she doing about it?? Nothing - she said I'm sorry as she was pushing out a catering order.  Funny the restaurant didn't come to a screeching halt.  There was no sense of urgency to fix the situation. She said the server is back there yelling at the cooks?  What are you doing??  I guess we weren't that important of a patron to her.   Would have left zero stars, but that isn't allowed

oJ0aiYM5y4U9wXPhCLM2gw.text: They play horrible COUNTRY MUSIC at a Mexican restaurant that has amazing authentic Mexican food.!!!! Nobody wants to listen to country music at a Mexican restaurant!!! I feel like I'm in Mississippi!!!!!! The food is good the music is awful, I couldn't wait to leave... I feel bad for the workers...  I would give it 4.5 stars but it's not deserved

uRW3Wx033uv-G-ZWI7sN1A.text: Great drink prices and good food. Our server Erin was awesome she was 5 stars without a doubt the kind of server you always want and expect

VsPR62RPR-XBmDwUkEWy4Q.text: I love Valle Luna. Great Food. Great Service.   I came here for my anniversary a couple of weeks ago, and I was blown away by the quality of the service and the food that were provided.   I'm a big fan of the chimichangas, so if you have a chance to grab one, I recommend the chicken chimichanga. They are phenomenal.

IcWOAIvuvCjkRNimkxbFQA.text: My friend loves going here, the food is just food. Nothing to great, it's a nice place to hang out and drink at during happy hour though. Parking can be a pain but I love sitting outside, having a few drinks and watching the sun set. The food is just average bar like food but I enjoy their happy hour prices.

pGLS7FI7i725m2qZNxTmRw.text: Me and my husband have been going to Valle Luna since they opened in Ahwatukee, well they closed that one because the rent was so high. Then we starting coming to this location. Well not impressed at all, they have some hostess at the front to seat you, not pleasant at all, seems like she hates her job. Then we sit outside then our order got messed up because our server didn't write it down to begin with. Then the food quality just so so. Not sure what happened if they sold it to new owners or what. Or their kids took over but the food is not good anymore, then they changed the green chili to make it hotter. WTH it was good to begin with that's why people come back. We decided after this last trip, not going back.

I0mbIM_3SlbKqz_rMfn40g.text: My husband and I went there before a concert a couple of Sundays ago.  The service was good, the food was good except for the cream cheese appetizer.. I forget exactly what it was called, but it tasted okay but looked horrible, like scrambled eggs or something, we didn't finish it.  Margaritas were good and very strong (which was nice) :) but the ambiance was just barely okay.  Reminded me of an old 80's place that hasn't been updated since.  Probably won't be back any time soon.

oHoNAG5S9469Cuy9hIUnFw.text: Bad service and bad food! The Milton margarita tasted like an old dish rag .  My wife ordered a taco salad and when it came to the table it had an inch of water in the bottom of the bowl. To top it off the waitress basicly threw our food down on the table probably was mad she had to serve such garbage.

25Ik36nadrXFB0wkyEgVMw.text: Showed up for a Phoenix Rising view party and the staff seemed to have no idea what was going on and we got out on a wait list for the dining  room no where near the viewing! Finally found a table in the bar area where we wanted to be, no help from the host staff but a friendly bus boy. As we were waiting for the bus boy to finish the table we stepped aside and excused ourselves out of the managers way and he what we thought was jokingly commenting he didn't want to go into the bar because " he didn't want to actually have to do work." He wasn't  joking we barely saw him the rest of our time there. Our server seemed out of it from the time we sat down, we planned on being here for awhile so we paced ourselves and didn't mind waiting for drinks or food knowing it was busy. Once we were ready for our second round we had to look for our server for over 30 minutes since she wasn't checking in (again we get it's busy but really) once she finally came back she seemed completely put off but us and the fact that we wanted more, again we waited more the 30 more mins to try and order food. It was extremely hot and overly crowded, they couldn't even get the game on  in time and were using customers phones to stream it. Highly disappointing since we expected to have a great time watching he game with other fans.

dcsHQRuY6Zc-L45CBTEjhw.text: The patio area is perfect.  It sits on the neighborhood lake and it's just beautiful and relaxing.  The patio is large and separates the bar area and dining area.  The food was delicious also.  One person had a bean burrito which was huge and very delicious.  Another had the border tacos, which were very flavorful.  I had the tomato, onion and chili cheese crisp.  It was the size of a pizza and incredibly delicious.  All in all  great meals in a wonderful setting.

gSaQeB-vDaul3j9yPtUpXw.text: This is the only mexican food place that i actually get excited to eat at! I have tried various dishes, but the best thing to get in my opinon is the carne asada burro dinner! I get it with no red sauce and a side of sour cream! It is so good!  Today there was no wait and the chips, salsa, and bean dip was placed on the table right away. The server arrived and was pleasant and got our drinks fast!  Other person with me got a #8 which is two tacos. They were ground beef and they stated it was the best tacos out here in AZ!  See corresponding photos and make your own judgement if you can from a photo! If you haven't been it is highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carne Asada close up!
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. #8 tacos meal w/ground beef
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carne Asada Burro dinner and #8 tacos

b__3mQ__397BKDcXU_8q0Q.text: I had a business meeting and we were planning on going to Pita Jungle next door but the wait was 30 mins. So we popped over here and was seated immediately.  Over the service was really good. I had a chicken taco salad and it was really fresh, definitely will get this next time I come back.  The only thing I didn't like was the water was out of the tap and tasted gross.  I guess I'm a water snob. Lol

b0JFE_pt5EBaNOww3K9EIw.text: My family came here on Oct 30th with my father who drove across the country to visit. They were not busy, there were only a few tables seated throughout the restaurant. We were seated outside, chips and salsa were brought promptly. We sat there for 25 minutes waiting for service. A server named Will noticed about 10 minutes in and promised to find our server for us. Another 10 minutes passed and I went to let the hostesses know that we hadn't even been greeted yet. At the 25 minute mark a table was seated next to us and were immediately greeted by Cassie, who I can only assume was our server since she was waiting on every seated table around us. She made eye contact with members of my family several times but never acknowledged us. At this point we decided to leave and stood up. Again, Will noticed and began profusely apologizing. He talked us into staying, immediately brought drinks, took our orders, and discounted everything. He is the only reason Valle Luna has any of our money, and they won't be getting anymore of it. The food is underwhelming, and aside from Will, the service is terrible.

wcGEUZg24tAoEawn-M-ncw.text: I am writing this review because our server last night needs to be recognized for how he took care of us.  We were a last minute party of 30 and Christian was assigned to take care of us.  In all of my years and all of my different restaurant visits I have never experienced service like we had last night.  We always receive great care when dining at Valle Luna but I am still amazed and we haven't stopped talking about Christian!  All 30 of us ordered cocktails, dinners, split dinners, kids dinners and separate checks.  In other words, we weren't an easy table.  Christian did not miss a beat!   Drinks were refilled and ordered before current ones were empty, all orders came out correct and not a single bill was wrong!  I still don't know how he accomplished this!  To top it all off, one of the kids fell out of his chair and Christian had an ice pack to our table minutes after getting him back in his seat!  We were stunned!  We didn't even ask for it!! We often receive great service here but we have NEVER had service like this.  Managers, please give Christian kudos for a job well done and tell him how valuable he is to your establishment!  Thank you Valle Luna and thank you Christian!  The Thomas/Felice family!

0RE7bMfgwoA4nKtt5f4HFg.text: We have come here many times before and these guys are usually very good but they missed the mark tonight. In their defense, they were VERY busy but...... We had to ask for drink refills several times and the food order came separately and very slowly. The restaurant was clean and had a nice atmosphere. Staff was friendly. Food was "OK" compared to previous visits which I would describe as "very good". We will come back, but not soon.

1xsrytKon3XG351Aafr5Vw.text: The food is good but not amazing. Decent sized portions to where, as usual, I eat half and have a full meal for the next day. I would not say I loved the food though. The service was pretty decent, nothing extraordinary. The prices are very good though. My husband and I spend $25 with tip on 2 meals. I have seen all kinds of coupons floating around in those little clippers as well, so keep an eye out! Buy one get one free. This is more of the kind of place where you are hungry but not starving and craving Mexican. They are close so we will be going again, but I wouldn't drive more than 10 minutes to get here.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

pXpH-jXBCsqJV4Znqv0HyQ.text: Mexican food is pretty good and authentic.  The bar side/patio is one of two patios. The second patio does not have TVs you cannot smoke out there. Therefore, the bar side patio is much busier.  Very popular place among the chandler residents. Fun atmosphere.   The happy hour is reasonable, but the selection is bar food.  I would recommend the bar patio for those who want to enjoy a drink, watch some sports, and grub on some wings and papas fritas.  I would recommend the other patio for a more relaxed feel- maybe if you have young children.  The patios are beautiful, because you sit over looking the man made lakes Arizona has. Water is relaxing even if it is man made.

04VYKo0nu1lYuD99n6shlg.text: My Dad and I went here for dinner tonight. It had been a stressful day, but Seth helped changed that. He was super attentive and carried with him a fun and positive vibe. He was simply the best server I've ever had here! Thank you Seth for helping turn my night around. You were such a blessing tonight! I hope management gives you the recognition you deserve! If you choose to dine here, please request Seth if he is working. You won't regret it!

FRrktNKg7s2RyfJZnBlJKg.text: What do you come here for?  Fantastic frozen margaritas and the patio on the lake.  Other than that, the food is fine and the service lacks.    We hit this place up on a Sunday night about 6p.  We had to wait about 10m and then were seated at booth inside with a view of the lake.  Our server was MIA for a long time and then all of a sudden she almost popped around the side of the booth and asked for drink orders (She never really stopped and stood and talked to us, just popped in and out). At some point a basket of chips with salsa and bean dip came out, which was great because it took FOREVER to get food - we ate every chip!   I had the chile relleno, black beans and rice.  It all tasted fine, but it had no spice, good flavor just no heat.  Oh and another thing about heat, it must have sat back there awhile before the waitress could get to it because it was warm-ish.  So it was all fine.  Not bad, not great. A-OK seems about right.    The only thing I can rave about was the frozen margs. They were a perfect amount of slush and booze!  I would have had more if I my waitress gave us more than a couple pop ins!  Oh well, give it try, may you will like it!

vT1JLSFI9kj9oqy8L2RUZQ.text: If it wasn't for the pretty lake at Valle Luna and the outdoor patio, I probably wouldn't ever go there. Their food is mediocre. The corn taco shells have been shiny with grease on the last 3-4 visits. The service for three of us at 1:00 PM today (Monday) was extremely slow. We were on our second basket of tortilla chips when our food finally arrived. The $5 house margarita lacked flavor; very disappointing. Didn't care for the black olives in the cheese enchiladas. The best time to go there is when you have a buy one entree, get one free.

M8HUpOtiNCTgP4kD5dGFng.text: Very average Mexican food, but cool atmosphere. Tacos come in hard shells, the Verde salsa is average. The do have a great happy hour, lots of TVs in the bar area. If you are trying to stay on a budget, this happy hour is a great deal! If you want good food, perhaps not the best pick. Ambiance is a typical Mexican-American restaurant. Flip Flops, shorts and t shirt. They do have a cool patio area on a urban lake.

a07ZeqzNkmaSp3SF-karZg.text: My family from my 30-something kids to the grandkids all love Valle Luna. The service and food is excellent. I've tried almost everything on the menu and have not been disappointed. The happy hours there are awesome and happy hour selection is second to none My family and I would eat there every day if possible.

X6hzDbdUsSh3ekV42Y-WAQ.text: Great place, love Brittney, Tomas and Chuey.  Food is always predictably decent, service is really great.  Awesome view of the lake, great patio.  We love this place!!

azqVZgSUPLcdXDOaaFXESQ.text: It's been mentioned, however it's extremely True. The bean dip rocks. Lots of Mexican restaurants start you with chips & salsa, but warm bean dip? Leet.  The location of this place is really nice, situated on a lake in the corner of a large complex. For some reason, I like how they are set way back in the corner and their front door is not immediately in front of you at the curb.   I've only been here twice, and I sat in the bar both times. Got pretty decent service, refills took slightly longer than I like but it looked like our server was the only one running around the bar and she was prego, so I'm not really going to fault her. Plus she was super sweet.  I'll be back because of the notable perks I have experienced so far:  Mmm, warm beans. Yes please! They have good happy hour specials, even on weekends (the mini burritos are YUM!)  And they have Michelob Ultra on draft.

HTbEY9IlACHDrB0kaV86HQ.text: Perfect place for date night!  We received a coupon in the mail, buy 1 entree get 1 free up to $11. It's a little far from our house but we decided to give it a shot.  We were very pleased.  It was a Wednesday night, which is Family Night. It was very busy but we were sat immediately because we wanted to sit outside on the patio.  The patio is PRETTY AWESOME! It looks out onto a precious, good sized pond which makes for a tranquil setting.  To make the experience even better there are ducks waddling around making you smile.  Service was a tiny bit slow but they were busy and I've been a server before so I know what's up!  Our server was awesome! He was sweet, informative,  positive and laid back.  We didn't mind at all about the lax and longer wait times because the atmosphere rocked and we were having a great time.  The food was great! We had the trio dips for an appitizer. The guacamole,  chorizo con queso and the cream cheese jalapeno.  The Cream Cheese Jalapeno is delicious as well as the guacamole.  I wasn't a huge fan of the Chorizo Con Queso but I had never had that kind of dip before. My man said it wasn't the best he'd ever had but still good. We had the chicken and steak fajitas and the fundido!  Both delicious! The Fundido was definitely worth it!  I also had a Cadillac Margarita.  It's tradition for me to get a Margarita on the rocks with salt and a shot on the side due to the margaritas not being strong enough. I want to taste the tequila and I'm a Lil bit of an alchy.  Anyway....I got a Margarita with 1800 Silver and a Grand Marnier floater with a shot of 1800 on the side.  The Margarita was so strong that I didn't even need the extra shot! Impressive!  We love the place! Definitely worth the drive and we will be back soon!

yw9STz0aCi4yl84SshWiOg.text: Had a party for 9 today at lunch. Took 40 mins for our food to arrive. We advised our waiter Harry ahead of time that we were on a work lunch break and if we could get our check with our food. Asked for Togo boxes with our food those never came had to go get them. Our checks were not ready had to wait on. My taco of whole bean rice and lettuce was wrong sent back then still wrong. And for one taco it apparently cost $4.27. When I wanted to changed my form of payment from a card to cash I was snapped at by Harry for messing up his order there were 3 cards there including mine. At no point were we ever apologized too for the late food. A sorry about that would have gone along way. The other girls said the food was good but would never go when your in a hurry.  We were at lunch for a special occasion and it was dampened by the poor services we received!

yWq19Ez_yd_yXQxqz1E9hg.text: Tasty food, good prices.  Great lunch destination.  Even the 'lunch special' portions are on the large side, all you can eat chips and salsa / bean dip while you wait for the meal (won't be long).  Try the lunch chimichanga special with green Chile, rice & beans, it's a piece of heaven on a plate.

435nDQIAhTf-75LH4738kg.text: Literally the worst Mexican food I have ever tasted in my life ( until I went to Macayos!!!)  So now its the second worst Mexican food I have ever had.  We had an appetizer that was overcooked or over deep fried little tasteless burritos that were supposed to come with a bean dip that didnt come til we were done with the appetizer.  When we asked for the missing bean dip our waiter got a bit defensive about it.  It was so bland and tasteless anyway and we didnt eat it. We had a chili relleno that was just awful.  It was swimming in oil, a thick slick of oil.  Very weird feeling in your mouth.  I almost vomited literally but instead I spit it out in my napkin.  I had a combo burrito and taco and the taco was in the deep fryer so long that the edges of the meat were black and the cheese they stuffed inside never melted so it was a weird combo taste texture.  The burrito was about the best thing but still the worst I have ever had.  There were lots of tiny pieces of what appeared to be red peppers and green peppers as well as onions in the meat mixture but it seemed to be old as if it had been in fridge or left over a couple days.   Someone else said that the beans were like play dough and yes thats a good description! The chips and salsa also not that good.  Salsa wasnt the worst but not that good and was definitely not fresh or made by them and the chips were so brown they were almost burnt.  The waiter was a bad mood jerk.  The atmosphere is absolutely beautiful with the lake and the fountain all lit up at night.  Gordon Ramsey really needs to make a visit to this place.  I cant believe they are in business since 83 and that people recommend this place.  What are they thinking????

FEAfyA4dJLMtoz_MZBosHw.text: Too many birds on the back patio.  It's to bad because the view is wonderful.

vKJCSfqOXZ16VNKTwYRhnA.text: The service was average but the food saved this from being a three star review. We were a demanding table of 5 (MORE BEAN DIP!!!@!) but our waiter and help were able to keep up. All in all, we had about three rounds of chips and dip before our food came. It felt a little long, but it was worth the wait. Dinner arrived sizzling hot and everybody enjoyed their food. The shrimp fajitas need more shrimp and less onions taking up room on the plate (sneaky sneaky). Good salsa, great bean dip, and delicious enchilada sauce.

F0ecYa6nS8aqb-oMO5q3qw.text: IS IT THE WATER ?  My wife dragged me to this place maybe five times before I finally said enough. The food and service was poor each time. I tried 5 different items on the menu and they all tasted the same (like not good cafeteria food). The atmosphere is OK if you sit by the water. They have a nice Mexican tap beer selection (the best in Chandler unfortunately for me). And this place is crowded too so somebody likes it. I just don't get it.

mQaWidsfMxYIxi3q7Ji2MA.text: Fundito was good...not great.  I got it with pork.  The pork was cooked perfectly...nice and moist.    My wife's bean & cheese burrito was bland (at best).  She wasn't impressed at all.  The salsas (both mild and hot) were flavorless and runny.  The hot tasted like Ketchup with a small bit of spice.  We even had some of the bean dip...not so good.  The chips were greasy too.  Valle Luna used to be some of the *BEST* Mexican food around... What happened?!?!?!?!

8zmPsaPfulfy_VJJlpGlAw.text: i enjoyed the visit.  the lake was a pleasant surprise.  went for lunch and ordered the 1 entry with rice and beans with fried ice cream.  i thought everything was yummy and filling.  the ice cream was topped with carmel!  would go back.

_qDJ92IUdKoDkFEjciWWDg.text: Great lunch menu even with fajitas that came out sizzling. Had leftovers for the next day as well. Great place for larger groups and friendly service.

V2sJ-4_wD3m7nua8_dY69A.text: Service was great but food took longer than usual. Carne asada was delicious lots of flavor. The restaurant has a great view of a lake.  I would definitely come here over and over again!

n-CEFXETQOz4OycJOzwRdw.text: sadly, i can't let my old review stand. i hope no one went there based on that review. idk what happened butttttttttttttttttttttttttt our food this last time was not good.   the beans on my friends plate looked like dried out play-do. it was really gross to look at from across the table, not gonna lie. and the lettuce on her plate was brown and wilty. i couldn't handle it.   my food had this weird flavor and honestly....  everything had a weird taste, even my diet coke.  we both agreed everything had a funny taste. idk what it was. i was sad bc last time my dinner was so amazing. i probably won't be going back for awhile. or ever, i haven't decided.

3Rww34gaPaIjCQ83NsLjLw.text: Although Valle Luna used to rank high on our list, my last visit there has caused me to boycott this restuarant.  I will summarize the story, as I don't like to draw out details.  I am a very forgiving and patient person but this incident was truly an example of extremely poor customer service.    After my mother passed away, my friend gave me a Valle Luna Gift card.  Eventaully, because it was emotional, I used it with my family.  After I tried to pay using the gift card, the waitress returned to tell me that the card was not activated.  I asked to speak to the manager and she advised that she would look into it on Monday.  2 weeks passed and I decided to follow up on it.  The manager than had conflicting comments, but bottom line, she cannot do anything to help me unless I have the receipt.  I explained, as I did the night we dined there, that I did not feel comfortable asking my friend after 3 months of receiving the gift since the chances were very low that she would still have the receipt.  Also, it made me very uncomfortable that if she didn't that she would then feel bad.  In short, the manager advised that if they honored everyone's gift cards that were not activated then they would be out of business.  She basically was accusing me of trying to use a stolen gift card.   I asked her to please check with the owners to make sure they agree with her decision to do nothing.  She did email the response saying that there is nothing that can be done and oh, very sorry for your loss.  (talk about salt in a wound).  A little more background:  We have been a very loyal and regular patron of Valle Luna for as long I can remember, well over 10 years.   On average we spent $1200/year there.  So, we have spent at least $12,000 over the past 10 years.  Value of the gift card:  $30  Interesting business model employed.  And this coming from a restuarant that has buy one get one meal coupons abundantly.

6lJ31JdFbIzDuk1dI1qV9A.text: For anyone who gives this place five stars-I seriously question your taste buds.  This is the Hometown Buffet of mexican food and it left both my friend and I feeling extremely ill.  If you want to spend a lot of money for canned food, then Valle Luna is perfect for you.

hV6nhTl_z32SLELUp4E3qA.text: Sunday Funday til 6pm... awesome for sure! Good deals on drinks... and food. It's in the bar only. But still totally legit. It was dark in the booth we were sitting in though, damn if I can't read a menu now and I'm only 27 what does that say about my future in a dark booth... anyone know of a good lasik eye surgeon... lol?!?!

Hiw7_nbiBPuHr6GN5Tp1Bg.text: I'll agree w/ the other reviewers, average, but I think its gotten  PRICEY for average.  I do love their pollo fundido.

OwceE80JjaC78W7E5Cjk0w.text: The food here is just not good. Not that it's particularly bad, but there is much better available nearby. It's bland in the way that wholly Americanized Mexican food always is, and the ambience of the place isn't really appealing either. The people who only wanted chips and drinks looked like they were having fun, but I can't speak from experience on that. The view of the lake is kind of novel in this area, but you're really only looking out over a big pond at some apartments, which gets boring very quickly. In short, I'm not really sure why anyone would want to go here, I'm pretty certain that regardless of what you're looking for, you could easily find better nearby.

sOE5Dy6Ygxq7zXF7HZrQwA.text: I love to go to Valle Luna for girls lunch out dates. Great Margs and lunch prices. I also almost always use a Restaurants.com gift cards and NEVER have any problems. I wish it was closer to my house but the drive is so worth it. Portions are great and the never ending chips are well ... never ending! Bar atmosphere is fun and as a whole this place is very clean. On the occasional day it gets chilly here in Phoenix I head right to this place for the fabulous Albondigas soup. Warms me right up. Keep up the great work Valle Luna!

LgewygKits4_Pegj27wf3A.text: I freaking love this place. I went for the first time with a group 2 months ago and every time anyone suggest meeting for dinner or lunch I always suggest here. They have really good enchiladas and you cant beat a $5 margaritas on Fridays.

GwSnFt3zsIIjQj21CXcEFw.text: We come here a lot with our friends from church after our group meets. Good service, good food & the price is right. Outdoors is delightful when the weather permits!

tl8tHGhwoIFpHdWwgZvcCw.text: Sue had the spinach enchiladas and I had the fajitas. Both meals came out quickly, they were hot, fresh with just enough spices. Our waitress, Erin, was friendly, attentive, and professional. Look for coupons, they always have a BOGO out there. But, be sure you take care of your server and tip on the full amount!

RbP80D5Fuzyt8yhB9wN72Q.text: Here for lunch during week day. I ordered chicken burrito lunch special with green Chilli source. I asked to put the cheese aside not on top of the burrito so it doesn't overrun the Chilli source flavor. Also asked for the whole bento bean instead of refried. It was a delightful lunch! Didn't touch the cheese at all.

tL4kXBuoTouoN5qKT4u0hQ.text: Ordered Fiesta nachos ( total disappointment ) albondigas soup, chips a salsa ( salsa tasted like canned tomatoes with a little cilantro and onion ). The nachos were soggy and loaded with tasteless shredded chicken and beef. Soup was slimy and the meatball tasted like un-seasoned hamburger, the only thing that was good was the cold beer !

ZMYfeGUGKx7kHRGuQblgaQ.text: I have been to this place multiple times.  I love Mexican food. So i saw this place in the corner of some strip mall and decided to pop in with some brahhhs.   Its a standard Mexican food place. The looks of the place i mean. We walk into the bar side and realize there is potential here for me to get very drunk off Mexican beer. I was correct. I got the mini taco basket (soo good and really cheap) and spent the rest of my night blowing my life savings on booze.   Now if you sit on the patio, you will be sexually assaulted by all the ducks that just chill all around you. It was actually kinda tight in a weird way. They just stroll up to you....see what they can steal...if nothing..they dip.   So after about 35 Dos lagers, and a small tab, i make my way to the front door. Thats about all I remember. I woke up in my car with face paint on and I was holding a softball helmet with 4 slices of smoked turkey breast sitting in it.  all in all....a great night!

nXxLvo-UF19ztklVhCM-zw.text: I ordered the tamale dinner, one of each with refried beans and rice.  The green corn tamale was excellent maybe one of the best.  The filling of the pork tamale was stringy pork, good but too dry.  The masa was great however.  The rice was salty which I enjoyed and the beans were perfect.   It is True, they no longer serve bean dip, and the house salsa is sub par.  Better to ask for hot sauce with the chips.  It was busy, but they did a good job with seating and service.  Would like to go back soon.

ayaGuKFqFiV7DGXahtJcyw.text: bland bland bland!  If you like Mexican food with no taste then this is the place to go.  The salsa tasted like tomato sauce, the bean dip had no flavor, and I don't think I've ever had a more tasteless chile relleno in my life.  Not even the pepper had any taste.  The whole plate was covered in cheese and mediocre rice and beans.  I did like the small side of guacamole, the only thing I liked at the table.  The service was lackluster and seemed to match up with the food here.    What I did like was that it sits right on a small lake and I would imagine in nicer weather it would be fun to drink margaritas and sit by the water.

nHY41vgDN8JYyK8UbaeFqA.text: A great traditional Mexican restaurant.  5 star decor and views of an older Dobson Ranch lake area.  Service was 5 star.  2 or 3 combo deals Mex and Match are a good deal.   The tortilla soup is the best secret.   Get it as your side.  Ground beef burrito was just ok.  It was bland, even as I ordered enchilada style, I wish it had more sauce and cheese.   Cilantro lime dressing was weak on the salad switched to cilantro ranch.  The kids combo is huge.  Kids bean burro was small.  Side of fruit was just grapes.

kMNM8Uyv8C5JxVUkxrrXFA.text: Good for what it is. Super greasy comfort Mexican food. Service is OK but could be quicker and more attentive. I would probably recommend other Mexican food places over this one most days but its nice on occasion.

II4JhfsMGr-lK8lRpjeSHQ.text: I'm a regular.  The staff is great with little turn over. The food is good and reasonably priced. Cheap beer! Great salsa!

4TF9Tf5BCR6VnE7-eMkkUA.text: This place has been a local for years,  and year after year they come up trumps,  great food,  great bartenders and some occasionally interesting people at the  bar.

Xcdz-ouFXLp5DbM5uw1mOw.text: 4 stars if you want a greasy heart attack. I often do, so I get the grilled pork chimichanga, I think it only has 7,000 calories.  Patio is awesome as long as you don't let ducks bully you into feeding them your delicious chips. (Beer doesn't help this). Down to 3 stars because the Sangria sucks, should be called a fruit juice meltdown, blech.

ZyGWYvBPvKll-nhXtEM_NQ.text: I loved sitting outside (with the misters on!) and enjoying the company of my daughter with delicious food. We were served right away and the restaurant looks clean. Can't wait to take the hubby over!

MV6-xGQGcPf-bfjwgvOXOg.text: Came for drinks and food on a Sunday afternoon at the bar top, had a blast.  Had 3 margaritas and the wife had the nogales iced tea! The bartender, Tomas, was friendly, attentive and super helpful to my wife's allergy needs.  He was informative and as a plus to our needs, our cocktails never hit the bottom of the glass. The food was delicious, in fact, i was a little uncomfortable for a few hours since i drank and ate so much.  This was our first visit and we will be sure to return, definitely want to sit on the patio by the lake when the weather gets better! Thanks again Tomas for the fun afternoon.

HYb4bFvjPe1gW156L3wcnw.text: Had an amazing lunch with my grandmother!! It was a beautiful day and the service was above average. Christian took such good care of us and our needs were always met. I really appreciated him saving us money by making our lunch order into a dinner meal.  We will continue going there not only for the atmosphere but for the staff.

BABOauIX1vzMFpiFFk46kA.text: Been coming to Valle luna since I was a kid.  Awesome food! Their flower chips are so yummy. Also, great salsa which is important at a Mexican food joint. No complaints on service either! : )

GXeLU4unrg3Ud1UeybBQQQ.text: We come here often. No complaints, really. However today our cheese crisp lacked the crisp- completely undercooked. After one piece I was done. My husband went ahead and ate the rest. Thankfully in doing so since his wings he ordered were dry and overcooked. Luckily we have dogs at home waiting for them. Service is fine not exceptional. Drinks- we recommend the prickly pear margarita.

zTpNy0YuPR3_LtiuJHqyiA.text: The wait for our food was about an hour, but we did have 8 adults and a baby. The waitress, was nice but the food was ok at best and a few of the items were wrong. Our reservation that we made was lost and the person checking me in made me feel stupid that I even would think we had a reservation.

OdC2s43Wh8ehKBltBmBz3Q.text: Valle Luna is a Mexican restaurant with multiple locations throughout the Phoenix area.  I would put Valle Luna in the above average Mexican food restaurant category. The food doesn't isn't close to having the authentic flavor, however if you know that going into it, you're going to enjoy your meal.  I love their appetizer list, which includes mini tacos, mini burritos, a tasty Mexican pizza, and more. If you're looking for a meal, the chimichanga, fundido, or Pepe's sizzling fajitas are all good choices.   I love going to Valle Luna for happy hour. They have daily drink specials, half price appetizers, and a nice little lake to sit next to.   Above average food, friendly service, and a great happy hour gives Valle Luna an above average rating of four stars.

4lUbTv3uI2L7YJMIK4VEmw.text: My fav Mexican cantina in Chandler! chicken taco basket and the Luna-Rita are the best!

pWdq1FgO-Z6WaBJR1Hu9IA.text: I crave Mexican food all the time and this establishment will not disappoint. I usually get the Chimi and its delicious and comes with chips and salsa that are also fresh. The take out staff is top notch! Highly Recommended. Wish they would send me more coupons like in the past.

ErzqpgVEuSM3sLx6Yo_Arw.text: This location was nice we went on Valentine's Day wasn't too busy was nice to see the view of the water it was a rainy night my now fiance had ordered the fajitas there were more onions then there was chicken he was very disappointed however I liked the fundio that I ordered it was very tasty the chips and salsa are yummy kind of spicy but good. We would go back to this location but I think that he won't order the fajitas again he was disappointed The four pieces of chicken and a whole big old pile of onions.

tXiEEZPbl_tuDgFuJAfL5w.text: Excellent ambiance. Service is nice to look at but not exactly proficient. Love the lake view

ayvrIm-KO2xcdYpNk74BFQ.text: First timers here. We're given the option of sitting in the bar area for happy hour, but opted for the dinning area, overlooking the lake. We asked for the blinds to be rasied, for the view, but we're refused by the staff, saying we keep them closed during the day! Provided a large basket of chips & salsa...the chips seemed a bit stale. Waiter seemed like he had a long day, not the friendliest we have ever encountered. He was quickly replaced due to his shift had ended, and replaced by a very personable young lady. We both had stuffed polblano peppers, with shrimp & cheese. Very good flavors, with tasty shrimps! Meal came with beans, and a good amount of grilled vegetables. Maybe....maybe not return!

zlrjFtxNaHercSpWaXlsOg.text: I've been going to valley Luna since I was 8 years old! I usually go to the one on cave creek road and when I moved to chandler I was thrilled to find one in my neighborhood. The patio is beautiful. And the chips and salsa are to die for. Make sure to ask for hot sauce I like to mix the mild salsa with the hot. Favorite is tia Rita's tacos plate or the green chili cheese Crisp yummmm

yFIJxroM5NnFpg6qR7t9rg.text: Good location, nice staff, the food is typical AZ Mex, drinks are a little watered down for my taste.

Vnux87yFCm4SfZa-GIIa4Q.text: Kid friendly and nice views of the "lake". Friendly atmosphere and good food. Come hungry as portions are decent. Kids menu is decent with a variety of kid options.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carne Assad burro with green sauce

QH9LHJ4Y0y4XNY7lZJfjpQ.text: This was my first time here - my date suggested it after church. Holy Schnikees! The location has a waterfront view - both inside and on the outdoor patio. Beautiful for these parts! The ambiance was well sculpted - each booth is given to privacy. The server we had, Bri, was fun, friendly and helpful! My date had a Vegetarian dish similar to a Fajita. She thought it was excellent! I had the pork Fundido and brother, let tell you, WOWSER!!! A little bit of deep-fried jalapeno cream cheese heaven was sent my way!  For the food, for the view, for the fun and the helpful service - 5 stars!!! Solid!

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Shrimp &amp; beef fajita.
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Vegetarian fajita.
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

ot78hYH6ImbgjAH4pqmAsg.text: Good food, reasonable pricing in today's market. Good service.

YwHwuomHTZBiKpjT63vKcw.text: This place has an amazing dish called 'pollo fundido' which is Spanish for 'fun happy chicken' according to no one.  Anyway the dish is super tasty with like chicken burrito married to a cream sauce and it's super good and you should try it.   Good luck intrepid traveler.

Tj_mJlc7JX60UKBhBbWENg.text: One of my favorite places. Great staff, great food, the patio view is a jewel, and it's a awesome place to watch a game. Some of my favorites are the Shrimp Chimichanga, Mini Taco Basket, the Fundido and believe it or not, some of the best chicken wings you can get. Order them grilled after fried, so good. Always good times!

gLhNzX4fst2tXpjnh6fWWw.text: Was given this recommendation for some really good Mexican food. For starters, the salsa and chips were tasty. I ordered the Carne Asada with rice and beans with a side of Kilt Lifter . My partner ordered shredded beef tacos that looked delicious. The food wasn't bad in flavor at all. Wouldn't mind coming back to dine on the outdoor patio once summer is over.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

J0S5733QxeK0jni5A12RSg.text: C, K and I stopped in for the happy hour specials. We grabbed a booth in the bar by the window. The bar was about half full and not very loud. Our server was Julie. Julie was amazing, she was easily one of the best servers we have had at Valle Luna. C ordered the classic cheese crisp ($4.50). Hot, bubbly, really good stuff. K and I split a 1/2 Taco basket all beef ($4.50) and the Chorizo Queso ($4.50). The taco's are pretty good. A good amount of beef, lettuce, cheese, tomatoes and a slightly greasy shell. For a buck fifty each, no complaints. The Chorizo Queso was a bit disappointing. The queso was a bit runny and just didn't seem made correctly. I like the plain Queso much better and will return to it the next time we're here for happy hour. Awesome server, decent h.h. food, good h.h. prices. 4 Stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. No. Not my leftovers. This is my $10.95 Verduras Skillet. Seriously? Kitchen running out of veggies?
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Skillet side car.
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken Fajitas

NPj3QJud6np-1P1bOlh2hw.text: Not sure why I keep trying this place. Last time I got the Mexican pizza on happy hour. It was two soggy tortillas with refried beans, cheese and jalapeno cream cheese (which is shockingly bland and salty). I would rate taco bell higher than valle Luna. Everything is over salted.  The menu descriptions make everything sound amazing and delicious. I think hiring a professional menu author (or whatever the process is) is the only thing keeping them in business, besides the location. if you dine in, you may find the place dark and depressing. Employees reflect this vibe as well. I don't think I'll be back, even with all the coupons they send out every month in the clipper.

ZiH_BL9SHcrx3xmMI8fH3Q.text: Colleagues from India, UK, NY and locally enjoyed Valle Luna.   While no table was promised, a table for 7 overlooking the "Lake" was ready when we arrived.  Good authentic margaritas. Abundant chips and salsa with an appetizer of guacamole. Made two ways, one regular and one hot.  We chose Fajitas, Chili Relleno, and chicken enchiladas.  Larges portions, most (but not all) staff were friendly , and good value.  Outdoor seating with view of lake...perfect for the cooler evening.  Moment of humor: one colleague ordered a drink of Baileys Irish Cream on ice. Order was met with disbelief. Two people came out to double-check that's what he really wanted. Guess they don't get too many orders for this stuff.  PS Can't say how Valle Luna compares with other area Tex-Mex...but infinitely better than anything in NYC.  Would return. See pics.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Huge side to the Fajita
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chili Relleno
Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Shrimp and Pork Fajita

FTBUjPgpWBljO1COgfdtEQ.text: Great for lunch. Great for dinner, great for happy hour, great for Sunday morning breakfast on bar patio.  I love this happy place with friendly staff, great food, relaxed atmosphere.  The restaurant has inside and outside dining as does the bar. Nice view of Lakeshore Condo lake and fountain.

ZUaUv_x--MqmPc48__fnxA.text: So me and me girlfriends have come here for years and today we were celebrating my friends bday and it was HOT. The AC was working and we were sweating profusely. However, our server Dan moved us to s cooler area and and as super attentive and fun! We were hot but he food was delicious as always and the service was awesome!!

Jj-yAY2nyWOq6jMK23BUow.text: I have visited this place countless times over 2 yrs...but I'm sad to say I won't return ..the staff is gotten really bad... I don't know if the hiring pool is just awful or this place hires good employees and just have the worst leadership....the 2nd is the food used to be good .... used to be..maybe they are going through tuff financial Times or they are under new owners/management,  either way the food is now bland and the quality falls below Taco bell ( at least you know what your getting with taco bell) ...last time I was there the bartender spent more time with his buddies than taking care of paying customers and worse management didn't care.... my overall advice is to stay away...I would have given them a worse Rating but 1* is all they get....Try    DOS gringos or Nando's If in  Chandler...

TjOIbj2xyLepIfIpRdGNNQ.text: Had reservations for 10 when we got there they put us in a hole away from the main stream of the restaurant area and next to the kitchen and the service was horrible and the greet staff are kids and are not receptive to their customers when u walk in or leave and had to wait over an hour to get our meal never again !!!!

KvGZm3xJqyy-GOvYz3-rDA.text: After 15 years I have yet to be disappointed.  Valle Luna "gets it!"   Upon entering you're greeted by all staff members you see, seated promptly, salsa and chips hit the table almost instantly, and your server appears in short order.  Next is deciding  what to order from a considerable menu.  It won't matter...It's all good! Whether dining in (lakeside please weather permitting,) ordering take-out, party trays or catering, you'll be happy!  And they're local and family owned...Huge!!

C9nGLI5Z0tbdPVXnHC6p7w.text: This was my first time here. There was one hostess that was really nice. The other girl who took my to go order was in a MOOD lol. The food tastes delicious but I'm annoyed that the moody chick told me the tacos were really big so I only got one instead of 2. Well it wasn't and all I have left is a tub of beans and tortillas chips. I'd go back because it tastes good but maybe I won't have the $9 taco lol

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States

ZTbKxxwJ3xMhnN5OvbL-lw.text: My all time favorite Mexican restaurant. We are never disappointed with the food or service. And the view of lake makes a great atmosphere.

-y5envabK0h5J0ZoWs_D0Q.text: Great tasting food for  the price. Was in town visiting family. Im very picking when it comes to Mexican food and the portions were perfectPopular local hangout atmosphere and by the lake.

9mtFvGbklQyLidzUKl3O8w.text: This was a mistake.  Some of the chips were soggy and the chips don't taste all that great.  The salsa also seems too watered down.  The chorizo dip tasted like nacho cheese from a gas station with pieces of something that didn't taste like chorizo.  The burrito fundido again tasted like they melted a Kraft singles piece of cheese on top of it.  It is missing something to balance out the taste.  Plus it was super salty.  Menu needs a revamp they need to seriously look at cutting it down and get staff that really focuses on quality.  The appearance wasn't too bad, but taste is seriously lacking.

XtSa-j3n_m08Fqn_kb7Bjw.text: I am done with restaurant, for good. I have been here multiple times and the service is always inexcusably slow. Tonight was particularly egregious, though. We waited a long time for our food (nothing we ordered was particularly complicated), again, and when the majority of the food came, my boyfriend's meal did not come and they got my best friend's order wrong. They told my best friend they would bring the item she actually ordered and never did. My boyfriend's meal, which evidently had not even been prepared, came 20 minutes after everyone else's.  One would expect some acknowledgment of the profound errors and delays, but the apologies were minimal and cursory. Then, to top it all off, when my friend got her bill, there was an extra drink on it, and when she brought that to the server's attention, the server admitted she had overcharged and was aware of the error but brought the bill anyway, as if it were just a minor error.

8Z2kjkKOqYr1O0-3ceLfjw.text: Yeah, methinks not. It's not like the place is a disaster, so I feel bad giving it one star, but...it was pretty bad. I ordered the chile relleno and an enchilada. The chile relleno cheese wasn't even melted -- gross. And the chile, I couldn't even cut through it with a fork. The egg batter was smooshy. Yuck. Worst relleno I've ever had, including the microwaved crap you get at the 'bertos chains. (If you like chile rellenos like I do, go over to El Zocalo -- awesome relleno). The enchilada was good; however, the enchilada sauce was super salty, I mean like they salted it way too much, then salted it just a bit more.  We also had the albondigas soup with salad. The meatballs were undercooked, red inside. The salad was right out of a bag.  Even the iced tea sucked.  The place has such a nice ambiance and a great view, right there on the water. I hope our experience wasn't the norm.

ucBcLSwzFYEzKEFb6_alcQ.text: Restaurant was really cold, the salsa was very bland indeed lacked any seasoning. I had the fish tacos and again no seasoning they rely on the sauces. My wife had the pollo fundido was ok

0Y36TL4aqG-wZoy-yJH7Kg.text: Came into town from Florida and wanted to take my husband's staff out to dinner (party of 10) we had Jessica as our server and what a great server she was handled our order like a champ, kept our drinks filled (bar drinks and non) orders were all perfect! Great server and service will definitely be back next time we are in town!

MDWyjrG64NAt7TEijDFlzA.text: Great food on the patio. The margarita special is fun even though they are super sweet. We usually bring a coupon when we can get them because it usually saves at least $5 or more. It's perfect to hit this place up for lunch and then go a few doors down for amazing ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Valle Luna Mexican Restaurant - Chandler, AZ, United States. Margarita on the patio

xbEbBdYZ7j4xtx8pL0yWGg.text: Went there a while ago and thought it was just a poor experience.  Went back today and it is not very good if you want flavor and freshness.  The hot is lucky to be very mild and the chips and cheese crisp again used stale chips and a stale tortilla.  I wanted the food to be good and tasty, but it is neither.  The service seemed good and it wasn't crowded for lunch on Sunday.  Just my honest opinion.

m1KrdFVB2UcayvUyeiyn2g.text: Been coming to Valle Luna for years and have always enjoyed both the food and the service.  Today I ordered the Fundido and it was quite dry so I asked for a little bit of Sour Cream I help correct the problem rather than send the food back.  Much to my surprise, I was charged extra for the Sour Cream.  So when I pointed out to my Server, Bree, that I was being charged for their mistake, not a word was muttered.  Just handed me the bill.    Bree has ended my patronage of Valle Luna.

c-1C07e_SUhyul4PXaO78w.text: Not sure what happened to this place ..I would say either the managment crew is mismanaging or hiring the wrong people but the food was awful and the Bar staff are just rude. I will not spend a penny more in this establishment!

UvCd3uI-wzkNxkWN-wtdnw.text: UPDATE***Jesse, the manager, followed up and was very professional and apologetic. She assured me this was not their standard practice. I feel she handled it very appropriately and we will definitely give Valle Luna another chance. Besides, they do have amazing food and I would hate to swear them off forever:)

QGx-ScXYHXM2WbGKnu_PTg.text: Smoking, smoke in my face.  I use to enjoy the patio but the cigarette smoking is out of control....cant sit there and be sick from the smell and eat too. Yuk

HF_tx4BYmxv0BMXJYmQtFA.text: Quality Mexican food at a great price! I'd recommend sitting in the cantina area or on the patio for the best atmosphere. The bar backs up to a lake with the cutest little ducks wondering around! As with most Mexican joints, the free chips and salsa are a bonus. They have super cheap happy hour prices and often have buy one get on free entree coupons in the mail. Never had an issue with service, but parking can be a bit of a nightmare.

x5XO3Lrifa2LptL3zfXU4A.text: The food was so gross!!!!! We sent our margaritas back, and left the majority of our food. I feel sick thinking about it. I can say our service was great! Very friendly and attentive hostess and waiter. Will not go back to this place and would not recommend eating here.

jMcB2ENeXa3MtQzR6Ft3JQ.text: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants of all time, the food is always fresh and hot, and the wait staff are always nice. Order the quest it is worth the extra couple bucks and the tacos or fajitas you can never go wrong.   We actually just used these guys for catering of a party of 80. It can out to about 6.25 a person with left overs yessss.   I will always come back here

-8PRxn7INFtICuKJvVkxsA.text: This is really great Mexican food. I have gone there twice now and each time the food has been amazing. The frozen margarita's are also wonderful. The chips and salsa you get on the table are a nice added bonus as well.

kKeFwpixNMsZTYNueaEb2A.text: We had THOMAS,  as our waiter. My in-laws have come here for 20 years, we have been going since moving here in Jan 2018. . Always been given great service & the good is always awesome.  . We had waiter Thomas as our waiter tonight. Speaking from a (past) waitress point of view.  . He was EXCEPTIONAL!!! We witnessed him showing appreciation and thanking his bussers,  servers, .he was curious & advised Us & other tables near by when he needed to reach across them (which I've never seen done!!) Did arrived quickly, it was delicious, as always!! .but Thomas made this experience so enjoyable , that our bill was $41 & we not only left him a $50 TIP!! Thomas was so nice & shocked, he looked like we took his breath away.  .lol. .it was Awesome!! We  took that extra time to tell the Manager our opinion of young Thomas. He said Thomas was fairly new and was glad he gave us such a great experience.  .We will DEFINATLY ASK FOR YOU THOMAS NEXT WEEK when we return. .  Great Service!!

zflYKvXzYRPhiWuS74AunQ.text: Now I must admit that this place holds some nostalgia for me. It is where me and my fiance had our first date.  We have been back a few times since then and it's been okay at times, good at others. Tonight was pretty darn good. The atmosphere of this restaurant is nice especially if you get seated by the lake view tables. I have to say I was a little bit turned off that we were given dirty menus from the hostess stand. Someone was slacking. Salsa all over. But the service and food did make up for it.  We had a buy one get one free entree coupon which was happily honored. Our waiter was very nice and kept our drinks refilled and checked in with us often. I had a cheese enchilada and a chicken flauta. My fiance had a shredded beef and bean burrito. Both meals were very tasty. The enchilada sauce was great. The enchilada had just the right amount of cheese.   We had a good overall experience. There may be a few other Mexican restaurants in town that are a little better but I enjoyed the food and service. I would recommend Valle Luna.

K6BQRrf77IAs0vNO0Pcwow.text: Been coming to this place since before the one in ahwatukee shut down several years ago... Food is consistently great but I'm really sad they took away the free bean dip!

6y1cLEiHwGFqiT9gr4tX7w.text: I have been going here for a year and a half, about 2-3 times a week.  I have learned not to expect good service or good quality of food.  I came back always because of the patio.  But as far as service, it is lack luster at best, as you can see by other reviews.  We sat there for about 5 minutes waiting to be acknowledged by our server who walked by several times.  We placed an order for Carne Asada nachos with drinks.  When we were eating the nachos we realized there was almost no chunks of meat on them, which cost $15 for nachos.  The cuts of meat were 1/8 inch in size and a very sparring amount. I considered this meat dust.  When telling the waiter this he just said that is the way it comes.  So the manager came over and as this was discussed it became apparent he didn't care either.  He wanted to take a whole $5 off the bill.  Maybe if I was back in Junior High $5 would have been a big deal.  I don't go out for a celebration and get concerned over $5.  What I am concerned about is the dining experience I have.  This place will always be busy, cheap drinks, average food and a good view.  So this won't make a difference in who goes there.  But this is the only recourse in having yet another bad dining experience here, for which I became accustomed to. I will attempt to find another Mexican restaurant to enjoy going out to.  I know, I only have about 300 other options.

rVnt9RL2hsoDDqqEV1cFYw.text: this place is bomb..... been here on several occasions...... with friends and family !!! service is great.... food is delicious ..... perfect place for friends and family .... you van count on having a good time when you eat at valle lunas !!!!

z3GBaeyyEziy-xA1tsFP1w.text: Food is alright, seems like they just threw it in the fryer and served it . Wouldn't go back .

1_2ifqINzza-T0yvX84IVQ.text: Had lunch here this week, great as always.  The tables are all booths, and the restaurant showcases a waterfront view for many of the tables.  I love the decor and atmosphere, food and service.  It's clean and the people are friendly and efficient.  Food was fresh and excellent, and salsa and chips.  Excellent service from the server Krystle, who was prompt and attentive.  I have been going here for more than a dozen years and it never disappoints.  Their margaritas are excellent so are happy hour deals and the senior nights 2/1 (I think Tue).  They have a great lunch special menu too, that is easy on the wallet.  Overall I rate this restaurant highly and consistently.

j1JGIsJpkwLid8qRF7mE8A.text: Sorry I decided to stop in. Friday happy hour, bad experience.  Cheese  crisp was greasy, wings were old, chewy, and drowning in sauce. My wife had a mango margarita that was too sweet. She tried a different variety that tasted like soap. Waiter (Diego) comped it , thankfully.  When she got home she puked it up. If you want good Mexican, drive on by this dump. Just because the view is good doesn't mean the food is good. I'll never go back.

exSsNX9_QciMbk7PWKKKCQ.text: We went to the bar and our bartender was one of the best servers I have ever experienced. He was very attentive and friendly. Shrimp tacos where delish, cod in the grilled fish tacos not as good. Atmosphere was fun and friendly and festive. I will definitely be back.

mYYxEV-42bLcdOqPumfkYw.text: Great food! Great specials. We are regulars and we love the staff however on a beautiful day you can't enjoy the patio because of all the smokers. So if you're allergic to smoke this is definitely not the place to go on a beautiful day outside. The only thing we would change is the smoking policy.

AsoLlmpKIpOKKWU3ErqPdw.text: Best Mexican food in the area, from the perspective of someone who grew up in S. California. The steak tacos had a ton of flavor, even with just meat. The chips and salsa are excellent. I loved the frijoles a la olla. I will stop going to other Mexican places now!

NTKuAGr7kKct4f8oTAKvCQ.text: Just had the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant.  Has a very delightful evening with my husband and decided to stop in to one of my favorite places to have a bite to eat.  It was late so we sat in the bar area.  Big mistake!  I felt like I was in a dance club, the music was blaring so loud.  I can get past that.  What I can't get past is the type of music that was playing.  I actually had to ask my husband if I'd I heard correctly.  Yes I did!  F-bomb dropping all over the place!  Very hard rap with very harsh lyrics.  I was completely shocked that my favorite Mexican food restaurant would allow music in their establishment that would have such harsh words in it.  I ended my very lovely date night with my husband very angery and I have Valle Luna Mexican Restraunt to thank.  So Thank you!  We could not get out of there fast enough.  The only reason we stayed as long as we did was the food.  It was as delishes as always. But the food does not make up for my dining experience and will not be back.  2 lost customers.

QOiIijUPubr9Qr9NE08W-g.text: This place used to be fantastic, I remember going as a kid all the time and everytime I've gone recently it's been awful. Food=bad wait=bad service=bad we went at 530 and left the restaurant at 8 and got our food at 740 waitress took forever to take our order. Literally 30 min just to wait for her to take our order. Like ur kidding right. And the food took forever to come out and a) wasn't good b) forgot to put one of my family's items on order (props to the manager for taking that item off bill) but honestly shitty service I won't be returning. It seemed everyone's food was taking forever Bc no one had their food and we all had been waiting forever. Ironic Bc it wasn't even busy LOL food was terrible my brother and boyfriend got the same item and they came out looking completely different, quality was inconsistent. Location is all this place has got but don't waste ur time I'd rather eat Taco Bell.

wi79TsooaqeVKZ0LC1T1Cg.text: Been going to Valle Luna literally for years. Good service good food good happy hour.  Tonight was a beautiful AZ night to enjoy happy hour on the patio.  Except the patio was literally full and more then half the guests enjoying the weather were smoking! Aren't there laws about how far away you can smoke? We sat at the table closest to the door! I smelled like smoke when I left as if I was in a smokey bar! GROSS!

ybaRW_pdEoGDgI3E0RkuQw.text: Excellent mouthwatering original chimichanga burrito! They are stuffed fat and will leave you with a belly that will be full for the rest of the evening! Their ingredients are fresh and full of flavor.

41KJQG18OdD1x6fujxfmEQ.text: Wings at happy hour and tacos are really good.  ask for the wings to be grilled you won't be sorry. yum .

od5JOvA_dMTz8gARsi9uyw.text: I haven't eaten at many Mexican cuisine restaurants, but this one is by far the best I have had yet.  Great food & descent service.  I have no complaints.

RATcHxbSen2u4zyvC4SMAA.text: Stopped in for Margs and appetizers.  Had 2 house Margaritas......AM I DRUNK?  Holy MOLY what do they put in those things?  Food was great, drinks were better, I'll be back!

_p0VSZq4GOiKMkcGd9v8fw.text: Accidentally ate here after forgetting that the food is terrible. Ordered a combination plate of a pork taco, a beef tostada and a chicken enchilada. I got a bean tostada that was soggy, a chicken enchilada that tasted like pork and had grizzle in it and a stew like porkish slop placed in a crispy tortilla shell. This time I will remember to go somewhere else for dinner.

86GdIe21i4wWey9t-fUP4g.text: Good service and great food.  We always have a great experience going.  Never any issues. We always get coupons from there in the mail for buy one get one and they always honor them.

IXk3XjIAZj626ElMeylPig.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS PLACE!!!    They have Buy one get one free coupons in the monthly coupon mailer book and Wednesdays are Family night which have their own specials.  Their Happy hour goes until 7:30pm which is the longest Happy hour around. Also they have daily specials for margaritas and specialty drinks(prickly pear marg is the bomb). $2.75 pints and $8 pitcher of domestic beer on HH too.  This is going to sound strange but they have the BEST GRILLED WINGS!! I would have never thought to try them, but we smelled some as they went by and had to order a dozen. They were SO tasty and flavroful! And from a Mexican place?  We haven't tried the burgers but we heard from other people that they were good too.  The Pork Verde is super DELICIOUS, and HUGE!  I really haven't had anything bad from Luna either. We are here often and each time we always see a new magic trick from Chewy - the awesomest bartender!  The service is quick and when something comes out wrong, they quickly remake the item and it's out without 5 minutes.    The patio has the best view of the lake too since it's in the center. They have tons of TVs, fenced the ducks off the patio, misters, both pubs and tables. It really can't get much better.  I mean, maybe if they had recliners or something but for now I'm all positive and give Valle and big thumbs up!

tH6ndKCXpL2g2lDiSORQQA.text: Greasy "traditional" American Mex is not really my cup of tea, so I would not usually choose this type of place for that reason.  However, I'm a medical sales rep, and we bring A Lot of lunches to offices.  Usually I try and steer them towards healthier fare since I have to eat lunch too, but one of my better accounts had a particular fancy for this place so I decided to be accommodating and give it a whirl.    I ordered their party platter which feeds 25, and told them to just put an assortment of stuff on there, beef and chicken.  My total was $125 before tax, and I found this to be EXTREMELY reasonable for what I got.  They were a little slow getting my order brought out to my car, but yes, they did bring it out and load it up and I only gave them an hour notice so I won't fault them for this at all.  It was a TON of food, two huge bags of chips, 3 large containers of salsa, 1 large container of guac, 1 large container of sour cream, a tray of rice, another tray of beans, and 3 huge party platter assortments of mini chimis, mini tacos, and flautas.  Even though the food was fried, it was not terribly greasy, and I actually enjoyed it!  It was a huge hit with the office, and there was so much leftover I actually brought some back for the staff at one of my offices since coincidentally they were having Mexican potluck day and as usual, I forgot to bring something in.  They commented on how good it was too, even though it was a full hour later and I looked super thoughtful ;)  I would definitely recommend this place for other reps who do catering orders or anyone who wants to feed a large group for what I consider to be a very fair price.  Huge hit, something for everyone!

Q9a00cu4pBMXBInfZj-kzQ.text: Ate here for lunch, awesome food, awesome service, and a view of the lake. I had the fondito chimmie, it was wonderful. We will be back.

lRLdCMU7G4c7_-hm9MsSiQ.text: Went here last night for the first time. Excellent service! Our server Ryan checked on us frequently and always made sure we had what we needed. The bus boy Anthony helped with keeping the chips, bean dip, and salsa full. My girlfriend had the fundito and I had the Fajitas. Both were excellent and well priced (even without a coupon). The lake and lighted fountain made for a next scenery while we enjoyed our dinner. Will definitely be returning soon.

_OAEKNyrM10e1rzc215pVg.text: AMAZING happy hour specials. We can get 2 pitchers of beer and eat all the food we want for about $20 on a Saturday afternoon. How can you beat that!? The food is simple and good, the staff is fast and friendly, and the patio is delightful.

xG0EQOqkS5n6vnXLudUHSQ.text: Chicken fundido is amazing. Spinach enchiladas are awesome. Salsa was awesome too. I love eating there.

1txpGAhtIbguuIAdILdUvQ.text: I went with my Birthday coupon for a free dinner but even without one this is the best real mexican in town.  I'm from San Diego and very picky when it comes to Mexican food. Valle Luna Rocks!

fkJGPYLmzrdkpBbN_AzYaA.text: OMG, this place is amazing! We had a hard time finding a table for 7 of us and ended up with something less than pleasing.  The female waitress was irritated with me and you could tell she clearly did not want to wait on us, so a young waiter, I think his name is Jeff, took her place.  He was wonderful, catering to our every want and need, the food was, of course wonderful.  We will continue to come here; however, avoiding the waitress with the attitude problem.

wZ6h8RLmlaAqoFACnU5HGw.text: Good chimichangas. Lunch specials are well worth it. Table salsa and chips are great.

afrklopIMxEDLfNDJa3HCA.text: Love this place -  best Mexican food in Chandler. Since Senor comes in second.

uwiwGl1dBMwOP4Wlz_armQ.text: I have been Valle Luna in the past and was not very happy with the food and service.  I said I would never go back yet, I decided to give it another try this time when I had friends in town. Once again completely disappointed with the food and service.  I had called ahead to make reservations for a party of 6 and was told they only accept reservations for 8 or more. Okay, I let that one go. We get to Valle Luna the waiting area is not busy at all. I place my name and party size with the host. He did not give me a wait time, just says," okay, have a seat." We waited 30 minutes before I finally had to approach the young man to ask how much longer. He said, "we are still waiting for tables to clear." We wait another 5 minutes then  finally are taken back to our table. First we are seated next to a table with a family with 4 kids, all of which were behaving badly running around screaming, no one said a word to the parents or kids.  Our waitress, Krystle promptly comes to our table to take our drink orders. This is when her poor waiting skills come into play. Krystle never approached us with a smile, a hello, welcome, just a "what would everyone like to drink." She returns with our drink then asks if everyone is ready to order. We all order. I personally had the spinach enchiladas. They were not good to say the least. The description mentions the enchiladas being filled with spinach, tomatoes, potato and zucchini in a blend of cheeses. These enchiladas should have been called cheese enchiladas, that is what they mostly consisted of. I saw the finely chopped pieces of spinach amongst the cheese sauce. However, I never once tasted or saw a potato, tomato or zucchini at any time while eating this dish. It was very bland and again I felt as if I was eating a tortilla filled with Velveeta cheese sauce. My husband and friends were not entirely pleased with their meals either. They all said that the food was okay but too pricey for the quality.  Back to our waitress, Krystle. The worst waitress I have ever encountered while dining out. She could have been more pleasant, and attentive. We had to flag her down on more than one occasion for drink refills, extra salsa, etc. Each time we asked her for something she acted as if we were inconveniencing her. We didn't receive even a thank you from Krystle at the end of our meal. I will NEVER go back to Valle Luna and will not recommend to anyone.

mKTzkKC-fpBObCMqqH3erw.text: The view here is spectacular. You may either choose to eat on the patio or inside but I ALWAYS love to sit by the water and eat this delicious food. I have never been disappointed here yet.

2cU-RwgIzixYwKLhkWm0PQ.text: Visiting from Pa...great food great service. Sat outside

MJ1j2GiHnsGOPNXGzr2_7Q.text: me and a friend started our night out here. we were surprised when at the bar we were offered chips n salsa! so since we had never been here, we were like, really? so, Tomas, the bartender took the chips n salsa and gave it to some customers who arrived later the we did! we promptly got up, informed the manager what had happened, that I would yelp about it, and we would never come back. so we went a few doors down to a sports grill, where I had a great  lub sandwich n a few beers which ill yelp about next. I wont go back to poor customer service.

4LHXA1wEza6EVHpPIr2siQ.text: Large portions, great taste but the service is a bit lacking.

cMhcj6Wn7DXPdzo1FOXszw.text: Here just yesterday for late lunch with a friend. It was magnificent. I don't even know what they have in any of their food, but wow. Love these guys.  I'm very sure it was pork in my fundito, but I've never had pork that tastey...nor that juicy.  Fortunately, I knew of valle luna from their cave creek road branch.  Had I never lived in central phoenix, I may have never known of them. And that would have made me sad...

dXAkRcKZzlds4LCgNUPqgQ.text: My Favorite in the east valley. I crave the hot salsa and chips the food is great always served hot . We mostly sit on the patio its nice we can catch the ball games enjoy a nice dinner and relax. You really don't think about the service cause it is fantastic and everything just happens fast and good. Now I am craving the chips and salsa its been a couple days since we have been, and I just asked my better half if she wanted to go again tonight and she said absolutely so we are gonna fit that into our errands and hope to see you there. Enjoy!

l8FeM5yEmWzPo9qHIZgAIQ.text: Valle Luna has exceptional Mexican food that is always fresh and delicious. The Chicken Fundido is one of my absolute favorite menu items and I have not found another Mexican restaurant in the Valley that can beat it! The jalapeno cream cheese sauce is TO DIE FOR!! The chicken in the fundido is actual whole grilled chicken breast, fresh and cut up..not the shredded soggy meat that you can get everywhere else. They give you chips, salsa and bean dip before the food comes.   The Happy Hour prices for Margaritas aren't great (around $5.50) but they taste great and I usually only have one for my entire meal. I go to this location at least once a month and the longest I have had to wait to get a table in this establishment was around 5 min. They have a bar area, restaraunt and patio which makes for a lot of seating. If you sit outside on the patio you will be on the waterfront where there is a cool fountain and some ducks that run around.   The prices compared to other good Mexican restaurants in the Valley is about the same. You get what you pay for though...quality food. I took my whole family here for my college graduation and every single person loved the food. My mom is not a huge Mexican fan but she is hooked on the taco salad!

FDq0UzukZqcySFEYHd6KRg.text: I loved this place.I usually judge mexican on the staples :rice, chips & salsa and drinks. All of the above rocked. Not only that, but they serve spicy beans to dip your chips in. DELISH! We were seated promptly and with a smile! The waitress was also attentive (making sure our glasses were full) yet not overbearing!   I had the tacos i could barely finish one but thats because I ate EVERYTHING! :)  A great place for a nice hot meal and a place to converse with your company.

JNFWZDEKAxUOwpmjTZX7uQ.text: They stay busy.  It is nice if you can sit outside on the water.  The service is fast and efficient and the prices are great.  I really enjoy the cocktails and the charro beans.  Mmmmm...

oJH8NiT0wKVr2Xc4a9jM8A.text: I don't really love the food here, but it's my boyfriends favorite. Our waitress Leah was AMAZING!! Best waitress I've ever had anywhere. Super attentive and anticipated our needs as to extra napkins, spoon for salsa with my tacos, etc. She made me actually like this place.
